text:
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, orange and hops.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque golden/amber beer with a slight white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast and orange; ends slightly bitter and dry with hops.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Amazingly sweet Belgian beer with a lot of orange and even some hops at the end. Really refreshing and damn tasty. Great aroma appearance and palate as well.

URUS 3.0
Aroma: apricot, banana, spicy, cereal, herbal
Taste: medium sweet, apricot, banana, spicy, cereal
Pite na Urusie. Pachnie przyprawami, owocami, lekko bananem i rodzynkami. W smaku słodko, banan rodzynki, wchodzi jak woda, ale smak nie powala.
Hazy golden liquid, no head. Sweet, heavy aroma. Heavy body, no carbonation. Taste is sweet.

Sweet tripel corn flakes aroma. Fruity sticky boozy mash up of awesome. Boozy Belgian ale with strawberries, cranberry, wheat, white chocolate. Fantastic, not overrated at all. One of the best Belgian ales Ive had in a while.

0.33l bottle. Hazy orange body with a white head. Aroma of grains, orange peel, oatmeal, cloves and some apples. Taste of oatmeal, orange peel, honey, apple cider, lemon zest and some floral hops. Very nice.

Kolor złoty, mętny. Pływają farfocle. Piana bardzo intensywna, gęsta, wolno opada. Wysycenie bardzo duże. Zapach trochę owocowy, winny, ziemisty, średnio intensywny. Smak przyprawowy, lekko ziemisty, troszkę owocowy. Piwo bardzo mocne, ale alkohol nieźle ukryty, a ma aż 12%. Uderza do głowy. Piwo degustacyjne.
Bottle at home. Deep golden in colour. Caramel, stone fruit, rum, candy, figs. Rich in flavour. Boozy. Highly enjoyable.

February 2017 - 330ml bottle at home in Richmond as De Dolle Stille Nacht, 2012 vintage, 12%. Pours a clear dark orange, highly sparkling, foamy beige head. Aroma is sherry and toffee, tulip floral vibes. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is sugary and very sweet, sherry and red berries, some port wine in the finish. Sweetness is just about kept in check by a soft woody bitterness. I can see why the barrel aged versions of this work so well - its very rich and robust. I like it quite a lot but its quite one dimensional. (3.7)
330ml bottle at House of Belgium, Xiamen. Pours hazy golden amber with a thin white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, malt and spice. Sweet finish.

Bottle. Amber Gold. Sweet, fruity, very spicy Christmas ale. Caramel, malty, citrus, dark fruit and honey flavours. Yeasty (lots of floaties). Lots of very warming alcohol. Spicy & fruity finish. Enjoyed this. Lovely. Classic Christmas Beer. (2008)

Acheter à tabac&co palais des bières dans famiflora à Dottignies.
Bouteille de 33 cl.
Couleur orange cuivré reflet dorée ! 
Belle brillance , légèrement trouble !
Mousse plutôt inexistante pas de col de mousse ! 
Au nez : cest intéressant ! Sensation vineux et également de cidre je trouve !
En bouche : cest étonnant, elle a beaucoup de saveurs !
Note comme un cidre un peu de pomme et de sucre ! Mais également sensation vineux de raisin blanc ce dégage je trouve ! 
Un petit amertume en fin de bouche !
Beaucoup de corps très bien équilibrée et moelleux comme un gâteau type cake !
Un régal!

Bottle from la caisse de bières. Pours a very short white head with sour bays aromas. Deep golden colored body. Long and old hops in mouth with a long spicy and hoppy finish. Lacks carbonation for a perfect result.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Light amber with a huge head. Belgian yeast and fruit are in the aroma. The flavor is very with lots of candy sugar. Very lively carbonation with a big alcohol burn. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

La Stille Nacht fait sans conteste partie du cercle des bières de Noël dexception dont elle en transcende les codes. Pour lapprécier et la comprendre pleinement, il faut bien entendu aimer les bières puissantes, car avec ses 12 % Abv, la nuit a beau être douce, elle en possède pour autant du caractère. Mais cette puissance est totalement mise à profit à la chaleur, la densité et à la longueur de la bière. Mais en premier lieu, mention spéciale pour létiquette, qui dans un style naïf-excentrique, nous fait être entièrement dans une atmosphère de saison. En verre, notre Stille Nacht se pare dune belle robe blond vénitien. Cependant, de par une effervescence peu poussée, elle ne possède quasiment pas de mousse. Le 12 % Abv ny sont pas étrangers. Et de toute façon, demande t on à un virtuose dêtre un top modèle? Le nez est splendide, à la fois doux et très complexe avec des arômes de miel, candi, réglisse poire et banane. Une superbe entrée en matière. Lattaque est soyeuse à souhait. Les bases dune bonne bière de Noël sont posées. Sur un fond de céréales et de miel, sexpriment des arômes épicés (notamment de poivres) et de Guenièvre (conférant une touche doriginalité). La suite est somptueuse. Il faut alors souligner la fois lintelligence chez De Dolle dutiliser du Houblon Nugget (amérisant fort et arômes lourds dépices) mais également leur maîtrise dans son utilisation notamment avec un houblonnage à cru. Celui-ci lui confère de la puissance et ce côté corsé tant attendu que lon retrouve en seconde bouche. Les arômes se portent alors sur les plus grands whisky avec des nuances sans limite mais avec une précision redoutable à linstar dun grand Django Rheinardt, pouvant faire glisser ses doigts sur le manche de sa guitare avec une précision hors du commun tout en pouvant varier autour dune mélodie pendant des heures avec la plus grande des virtuosités. Larrière bouche quant à elle est dense et pleine, sur le miel et le fruits conférant une excellente corpulence et une homogénéité sans faute. Léquilibre alcool-sucre est parfait. Le final incroyablement long, marquera davantage les notes épicées couplées à des arômes dagrumes. Que la nuit est douce, que la nuit est belle... Still a Stille Nacht avec les De Dolle Brouwers.

Fruity aroma with some(very little) phenolic spicy notes. As it warms more estrous notes came out like apricot, red apple. Very smooth, little oily mouthfeel, carbonation too high for my taste. Alcohol well hidden, warming. Balanced beer but I expected more.

Bottiglia da 33 cl anno 2016. Color oro rosso leggermente torbido con pochissima schiuma bianca che sparisce in fretta. Al naso buoni i profumi mielosi e di frutta sia rossa ( lamponi, more e ribes) che di frutta a polpa gialla matura (pesca e frutta esotica). Al palato esplode in dolcezza con sentori di frutta che lasciano spazio ad un leggero amaro ma sempre con base fruttata. Non lascia sentire molto lalcol che svanisce nelle note mielose e fruttate, di corpo leggero offre un finale molto lungo e intenso di frutti rossi, bassa carbonazione, ottima birra da dessert e dopo cena nelle fredde sere invernali.

[ Vintage 2015 ] Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 20170103. Yeasty, spicy and sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, sweet and light alcoholic. 7 3 7 3 13................................................ [ Vintage 2012 ] Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 20170103. Fruity and spicy with dried fruits, deeper and not as sweet as the 2015 edition, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is sweet, dry and fruity. 8 3 8 4 15

Color naranja, medianamente turbio, con capa de espuma blanca de tres dedos de grosor (estilo espuma de afeitar, muy buena retención). Restos de levadura. Carbonatación a tope. Aroma especiado, frutal, a levadura, un mínimo de lúpulo que anticipa el amargor; recuerda más al de una Tripel que al de una Belgian Strong Ale. Sabor frutal, especiado; inicialmente amaga con ser dulce, pero el amargor llega al instante (imponente y placentero). En boca queda algo de especias y un poco de caramelo. Muy compleja, preciosa visualmente, y disfrutable.

Bottled 2013. Nice sweet aroma and taste. Empowered by moderate fruity notes - apples. apricots. Caramel is present, but well hidden. Some spices in the background - definitely cinnamon, some clove. ABV warming developed thru the degustation. Damn fruity and natural character with nice sweet notes. Very good brew.

Pours a hazy, pale amber body with an off-white, fully lasting head that laces the glass well. Quite strong aroma of lovely Belgian yeast, spices, sweet caramel, light fruits and a touch of vanilla. Strong flavour of delicious and spicy Belgian yeast, sweet caramel, pale malts, light fruits, alcohol, sugar and honey. Moderate sweet taste and a light bitterness in the long finish. Full body, syrupy texture, moderate carbonation. A very nice one, Im looking forward to try another bottle from this batch in a couple of years. 
[33 cl bottle, 2015 edition, from Vinmonopolet Aker Brygge]

Light acetic note, candied fruit, apple, sugar, amber with a thin white head not very persistant, full body, law/medium carbonation, refreshing at the beginning, beautiful taste of dried fruits with a pleasant warming in the final...i want to retry this beer many times again.

Birra quasi perfetta, molto forte.. è una birra di Natale.. si predispone molto allinvecchiamento e si sente; ha un colore pulito e molto "carico", lascia un retrogusto che lascia intuire le proprie potenzialità. Poco luppolo al gusto ma una sensazione intensa che scalda il cuore.. Una delle birre migliori mai bevute..

This bottle was a present from Rachel - very nice too! Hazy orange with huge white head and some floating yeast. Intensely sweet with lots of candy sugar and hints of mandarin, bubblegum, raisins and spices. Huge, intense mouthfeel with tons of alcohol. The powerful sweetness is balanced by some hoppy bitterness. A great strong Belgian ale.
Tap @ Mikkeller bar Copenhagen 3/1-17. Medium body... spicey and fruity!!!!

Never the same beer. An average of at least two ratings is required. First is bottled 2015 tasted dec 2016, second is bottled 2014 tasted jan 2017.
First. A4 A8 T7 P3 O15 TOT 37. Orange, healty head, average persistence, nice lacing. Freshly fruity aroma (peach, green apple), with herbal, almost resinous hints, spices, warming feel. Taste is very sweet but also shows a sharp herbal and slightly earthy bitterness. Full bodied with high carbonation and a bit of warming alcohol/phenolic feel. Nice and very interesting, still a bit too sharp.
Second. A3 A8 T8 P4 O16 TOT 39. Murky orange, average head, decent persistence, scarse lacing. Sugary/earthy underlying base, freshly fruity aroma (peach, pineapple), slight spiciness, warming feel. Brigthly fruity taste, sugary sweetness, moderate spiciness and a nice but not at all aggressive alcohol/phenolic feel. Overall very sweet though nicely balanced by slight acidity. Full body, light to medium carbonation, surprisingly mellow for the abv and quite creamy. Very tasty, still nicely balanced and drinkable for its strenght.
Tried recently in Bruges, really nice xmas ale. Fruity sweet blonde. Was recommended by Englishman who used to live in Belgium.

Bottle from Belmont Station. Realized after drinking the Reserva that I hadnt rated the progenitor first. For shame!

A: Cloudy burnished gold with a huge fluff of white foam.

N: Clove, banana, cracker, esters, raisin, coriander, a bit of pine, some grapefruit, and peppercorn from the hops. Pretty earthy. Some pear and green apple in here. 

T: Very sticky and sweet. Substantial bitterness.

M: Medium body, pretty good bite from the alcohol, crisp carbonation.

O: Pretty good. Theres quite a bit going on here, but I can definitely see how itd benefit from a year or two of aging. Good now; I will probably put aside a couple bottles to revisit.
Weinig aroma, lichte gist. Mondgevoel: dikke olie/banaan. Gist, caramel en hop in de smaak. Nasmaak met lichte bitterheid.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2017 300 piwo recenzowane na Ratebeer. Aromat średnio intensywny, owocowy, głównie brzoskwinie, morele, żółte owoce, do tego białe wino. W wyglądzie średnio opalizujące, brzoskwiniowa barwa, piana nikła, w postaci białej obrączki.W smaku słodkie, owocowe, figi, brzoskwinie, rodzynki, białe wino. Gdzieś w posmaku pojawia się lekko kwaskowata nuta w stylu lambica, lekko kontrująca sporą słodycz. Ciało dość gęste, degustacyjne, czuć bardzo przyjemne rozgrzewanie, alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty. Ogólnie smaczny, przyjemny belgian strong ale.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2016 Bottle at home, 2014 ed. Pours a cloudy murky golden colour, dense white creamy head that leaves a nice lacing. Complex but nicely balanced nose and taste, mainly sugar/caramel malty, white grape/dessert wine and ripe apple sweetness, citrus, banana, a little acidity, funky, spicy, light bitter and dry finish: orval-ish, but more sweet and more bodied. Aftertaste lacks length. Firm body, medium carbonation, oily mouthfeel.

Bottle 
Aroma-floral, fruits
Appearance-golden, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, medium sourness, 
Palate-full body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2016 From Belgium in a box; pours clear golden with giant white head and brownish grey yeast clumps; aroma is somehow citric, slightly buttery, malty sweet, spicy and slightly alkoholic; taste is medium to very sweet, malty, slightly fruity and spicy herbal hoppy, spicy slightly alcohol finish; thick oily mouthfeel with high carbonation; doesn?t feel like 12% [2015 bottle, tasted 26.12.16]

Bottle. Pours a murky orange with a lacy off white head. Aroma is of orange, spice, ginger, clove, banana, bread. Taste is of pepper, spice, orange, citrus, banana, clove, ginger. Oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Bottle from Cork & Cask. Hazy golden body with a loose white head. Lively carbonation. Very faint lacing. Aroma of fig, cooking apple and a hint of red wine. Flavour of tart cherry and honey. Medium to full body with a sticky mouthfeel. Light fizz. Sweet and sour.

Bottle from Cornelius. Clear amber, almost no head. Nose is sugary sweet, orange peel, caramel. Tastes caramel, orange, citrus peel, bitterish, very sweet, marzipan, boozy, warming. Quite sugary. Still good though.
33cl bottle from 2012 according to one of the cousins from the barrio. Nutty, boozy, esther booze and that Belgian funky yeast. Warming.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy golden yellow pour, aroma has all the dried fruits, light yeast, some orange, taste has very complex fruit action, hint of marzipan, some yeast esters, delicate spicing peeps through the big ABV, great Xmas eve beer.
Duft krydret koriander frø appelsin appelsin skal smag citrus krydret appelsin frisk stærk eftersmag malt sød

Muy buena. Tiene cierto punto afrutado y el alcohol muy bien integrado, tiene 12% pero no se nota. El primer sabor es un tanto afrutado, y diría que hasta fresco, el segundo sabor es más consistente y con cuerpo.
@ Kerstbierfestival Essen (B) - Dark yellow, off-white lacing. Light aroma, strong barley taste. Fruit tones in aftertaste, as well as some bitterness. (Essen 201612)
2016, abboccata, caramellosa, miele, fiori, corposa e peprsistente, vaniglia, luppolo assente

Yellow, slightly orange hazy with rich but fastly disappearing head. Nice fruity aroma. Fruity sweetness with some sour notes on medium strong bitter background. Sweet-sour fruity aftertaste (yeast notes)

Bottle, 330 ml, 2016 edition. Pours hazy light amber with a two finger white frothy head, which starts to shrink immediately down to a stable sheen. Thick, gloopy lacing. Moderate amount of carb visible, medium size bubbles. Pretty! Nose is a fruity and spicy one - fruity notes leaning on the sour side a bit and very candied with some orange, apple, blueberry, cherry, estery banana, non-pithy citrus, gooseberry, maybe even a tiny hint of lychee or something similarly tropical. Lots of yeasty spice too, quite funky/musty, some honey malt and powdered sugar. Quite phenolic as it warms with some fortified wine notes developing. Really interesting nose overall. Taste is heavy and strong, big, sweet, sour, almost medicinal fruity kick bringing candied orange, wine gums, lemon, port wine, and plenty of white/powdered sugar. Yeasty spice, esters, allspice, cinnamon, white pepper, pithy, resinous hoppy bitterness in the finish with lingering cereal and spice. Seems a little stale towards the end which is a shame. Booze, obviously, but definitely not overpoweringly. Fantastic balance of flavours overall, just a shame about that staleness. Body is huge, texture is thick, carbonation is surprisingly lively, which suits the spice, but the finish is a bit cloying and, as mentioned earlier, stale. Outstanding stuff overall however!
Net een flesje uit 2014 opengemaakt. Schuim bleef maar komen. Ruikt fruitig maar ook iets te sterk naar alcohol. In de smaak merk je eigenlijk hetzelfde. Wordt na een paar slokken wel lekkerder.

Fosca. Aroma Dolça, notes afruitades. En Boca destaca el malt per sobre de tot amb notes dalcohol lleugerament marcades. Cos Alt. Cervesa equilibrada, càlida, a lespera de podeer tastar la danys anteriors per veure si el punt alcohòlic queda més integrat.

2014 Hazy golden with little white head. Aroma is cherry pips, some chocolate, fruity hops, yeasts, juicy. Taste is spicy fruits, sweet and sour. Floury mouthfeel, slight chalky and fresh citrussy. I like this one best. Nice!

2015 Big head. Green stuff in the aroma, taste is more phenolic.
2016 little head. Sweet and phenolic, fresher and a little unripe.

Very nice Belgian strong, malty cocktail, some even honeyish touch, candy, some ripe fruitiness, light yeast impact. Mostly sweet with light bitterness, bit undercarbonated for my like, but
very nice overall anyways

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Po roku-dwóch w piwnicy przeobraża się w totalnie wybitne, niesamowite Belgian Strong Golden Ale. Wersja 2005 totalnie mnie zniszczyła.

Honey yellow, hazy. Nice white perfectly lacing head. The aroma is surprisingly funky, lots of sourish fruit, vinous, candy in measure. Full body. The flavour is very Belgian. The funky yeast a perfect accent for malty base. Spicy, fruity. Light bitterness. Great.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle at home. Couleur un peu urine, grosses bulles et mousse quasi inexistante dans la minute suivante. Nez fruité (abricot, pêche, autre) et épicé, levures et houblon. Bouche : fraîche, "pleine", un peu sucrée, légèrement piquante, légère amertume mais idéale pour le concours "Quelles sont ces bonnes épices ?" Je reprendrai de cette bière complexe mais attention de ne pas dépasser la dose si vous voulez passer une Stille Nacht.

Small head. Malty caramel. Some mushrooms. Sweet bitter dry. Alcoholic but well hidden. Portwine. Complex. Let this one develop like wine for years. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amber. Nice aroma and very rich flavour, with fruity notes, phenolic spice and malt. Sweet, assertive, and slightly pungent taste with some alcohol. Full body. Overall, a great belgian strong ale. Very tasty and somewhat balanced, despite the sweetness. This sample has aged for a year so the booziness has mellowed a bit.

Ottima birra. Dal colore biondo oro antico, quasi ambrato e dalla schiuma bianca e decisamente persistente. Sentori speziati molto forti, quasi pungenti, accompagnati da un buonissimo fruttato e un po di caramello, nonché un leggerissimo tocco di liquoroso. Molto consigliata!

Cerveza de color ámbar con tonos anaranjados con un montón de sedimentos y una gruesa cabeza de un intenso blanco. Aroma dulce con una grande complejidad de matices afrutados y su toque de alcohol. Sabor intenso y fuerte, pero con un gusto dulce, la variedad de matices es difícil de describir, el regusto tiene notas de frutas y especias persistente, una excelente cerveza de invierno, me encanta.

33cl-fles op de kerstbierentasting bij Mario. Merci! U: Licht wazig goudblond met witte schuimkraag. G: Bleekmout, karamel, fruitig, en honing. S: Zoetig met bittere toets. Veel karamel en fruitigheid. Witte kandij en een mooie alcoholwarmte. Lekker! M: Volmondig met medium carbonatie.

330ml bottle 2008 vintage @ Alexs. Pours a cloudy rusty brown. Nose of brown sugar with hints of booze. Flavour is warming with the same brown sugar, dark fruits and spices.

330ml bottle 1990 vintage @ Alexs. Pours a cloudy rusty brown. Nose is disturbing and off putting... mushrooms and tobacco. Flavour is sour mushrooms.

Tasting at Alexs.
Bottle 330ml. Vintage 1990. Pours a hazy brown with no head. Aroms and taste are fruity, some seeds, oxidized with some mushrooms, sweet grapes and tabaco notes.
8-3-8-4-14=37

Vintage 2008. Pours the same color, but with strong a strong tan head. Aroma is fruity, slightly bready. Taste is malty, boozy, with fruity and bread notes. Slightly oxidized already.

8-4-8-4-15=41

Piana obfita, średnio oczkowa, bardzo trwała. Barwa ciemno złota, mętna, z pływającymi drobinkami drożdży. W aromacie sporo kandyzowanych owoców, karmelu, miodu, jasnego winogrona, rodzynek, w tle odrobina przypraw i placek drożdżowy. W smaku dość słodkie, pikantne, przyprawowe, z konkretną słodową podstawą i wyraźnym chmieleniem. Sporo tu suszonych moreli, rodzynek, kandyzowanej skórki pomarańczy, skórki cytryny, a wszystko wieńczy keks bakaliowy i miód. Goryczka średnia do niskiej, ziołowo alkoholowa. Wysycenie średnie, treściwe, pełne i lepkie w odbiorze, nieco zbyt alkoholowe.

Piwo ma potencjał do leżakowania - słodowe, słodkie, alkoholowe - ma się tu co układać. Na chwilę obecną, prawie rok od rozlewu, wciąż brak balansu i gładkości...

Bottle shared, thanks Neil! Great treat, probably one of my favorite classic Xmas beers, lots of fruity esters supported by weedy hops, yummy sugar cane, definitely some heat on the finish but thats what xmas beers are all about. Outstanding!

Bottle shared. Thanks Neil! Pours a slighty hazy copper with a finger of foam. Lovely yeast character on the nose with nutmeg and clove alongside autumn fruit and some apricot. Dangerously smooth and so drinkable. A touch of booze on the finish with more fruit and spice. Everything comes together very well.

Likaisenoloinen, samea hailakanruskea olut vaahtoaa melko kevyesti ja vaahto katoaa pian kokonaan. Ei ole ulkonäöltään mikään helmi todellakaan. Tuoksu appelsiininen, viljaisen maltainen ja hiivainen. Maultaan hedelmäinen, hiivainen ja kevyen mausteinen kääntyen entistä enemmän appelsiiniseksi loppupuoleltaan. Alkoholi esillä maussa hieman, muttei häiritsevästi. Pehmeä, makean täyteläinen ja lämmittävä kokonaisuus. Aika erikoinen, mutta ulkonäköä lukuunottamatta toimii.

330ml bottle from Whole Foods Market, Giffnock (£4.36):
This one was an excellent beer from De Dolle & came through with almost everything that Ive come to expect from big, bold Belgian beers. There was a lot of flavour packed into this one & some good spice as well with a combination of yeast & citrus flavours opening things up & rich fruits following them up. It was a very well-balanced & easy to drink beer despite its strength & its definitely up there with some of the best the country brews; great stuff.

Bottle sample tasted at BBF Lab Madrid 2016 on the 02/07/2016 (Vintages 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014). Golden colour with a nice white head. Aroma of caramel, malts and hops. Taste is sugar, hops and roasted malts. Intense caramel and candy aftertaste. Next one please!

Pours hazy apricot with a thick eggshell head. Aroma delivers fresh malt, fruity and subtle butterscotch notes. Flavor offers fruity, yeasty and fresh malt tones, though the butterscotch seems to disappear. Mouthfeel presents decent fizz and body. Happy any old holiday!

Bottle shared with Shahaf and Dina. Clear-to-hazy gold with a white head. Banana bread, phenolic a bit, a little green too. Taste is sweet, a little alcoholic and some green apple. Full body, sweet apple aftertaste and a little fizz.

Aroma ácido suave, aromas a levadura
De aspecto cristalina pero con levadura flotando, trozos gruesos, no turbidez
En boca compleja
Cada trago distinto maltosidad caramelo, especias 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lukt: Frukter, høy og malt.
Utseende: Gyllen.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum.
Smak: Frukter og noe søtig.

Backlog. Small bottle shared in the form of beer shots after a long session.  The only notes I took down was the score :/

2008 vintage bottle at Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade, july 25th 2015. Hazy orange amber body with a medium beige head. Aroma of burned caramel, apples and honey, spicy yeast. Taste is fruity with marzipan, raisins, and a mild balancing bitterness. Faint alcohol notes. Warm pleasant plum finish. Quite a good beer!

0,33l bottle at home. there is some kind of print on the cap, unfortunatly part is missing only 2015 is readable, which I assume means the vintage. orange hazy color with quite a lot of particles, rather big white head. smells of belgian yeast, spices, oranges, some sweetness, ripe fruits, good smell. full body, light carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes citric, belgian yeast, nice fruit notes, candy, good spices, peppery, light alcohol. finishes lightly dry with notes of ripe fruits and spices. good stuff drinks very good for the high ABV.

Bottle from 2014. Aroma: Quince tincture, winey, banana, apricot, spices, minimal licqueury feeling. Appearance: Nice stiff head, color is golden. Taste: Very smooth, strong quince again, very fruity, alcohol feelable just in the licqueury feeling, spices feelable stronger than in aroma. Palate: High carbonation, extremely drinkable, body is medium, finish is sweet.

Decided against ageing this bottle. Beautiful beer. Supremely drinkable for its ABV. 
De Dolle are quickly becoming one of my favourite Belgian breweries. 
Carbonation is just right. Retains a decent size head.

BTL beat me to it again.. Firstly, props to the Sloth for providing the beers for both ratings...you heathen, knuckle dragging, flannel wearing, biscuit sucking,old bay loving, clark road driving hick. Firstly folks all hop presence is lost during this malt centric, smooth focused, creamy lusciously apportioned body. Split with the Alex. I thought tripel when I first tasted it. but Strong ale seems about correct. I am sure that it will be a silent night since Alex and I got a bit boisterous installing the new 220 line to the table saw... Watch out world.... I can cut you inhalf... if I drink enough of this beer.

2015 bottle. Cloudy orange straw. Head comes and goes. Nose is bready with a little citrus. Palate is the magic, barnyard funk, dry cracker, some lemon zest. Mouth is dry round and slick. Warming the belly. Mhmm.
Bottle, fresh batch. Hazy golden color, small head. Aroma of sweet fruits, banana, peach, apricot, some spices and herbs, caramel. Taste is very sweet, fruity and yeasty flavors, note of alcohol.

0.33 bottle. Hazy, gold color and a large, white head of decent retention. Aroma of spices, citruses, and a lot of bananas. Taste is very sweet, malty, banana-like, spices feature prominently again. A medium body, a creamy texture, and a fizzy carbonation. Finish gets rapidly bitter and only worsens with time. Overall, the beer starts off pleasantly but its finish and carbonation spoil the whole experience.

Tremenda. Fuerte aroma cítrico y levadura con marcado carácter a melocotón. Buena presencia con ligero carbónico y retención de espuma. En boca es dulce, melaza y cítrica, alcohol y albaricoque. Muy fina
DWF, klar gyllen brun med litt hvit skum. Aroma karamell, frukt, gjær, alkohol. Smak sitrus, søt, frukter, karamell. Lite co2 . Veldig god.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka 2015**. bardzo wysoka, troche mydlana ale zostajaca ladnie piana, lekko metnawe, jasne, zlote piwo. aromaty bardzo intensywne, glownie slodkich, dopjarzalych owocow (brzoskwinie, banany, biale winogrona). Za nimi czuc troche przyprawowosci, alkoholu, jakies zbozow-herbatnikowe klimaty. troche tez roslinnych, trwiastych nutek, ale daleko w tle. Po aromacie - Duvel na sterydach. w ustach tez - ewidentnie czuc belgijskie drozdze, mocno slodkie piwo, z niewysoka goryczka, spora iloscia ciala, sporym wysyceniem. alkohol jest odczuwalny, ale glownie jako rozgrzewanie i w posmakach - jak na 12% ukryty bardzo skutecznie. jeden z najlepszych jasnych mocnych belgow jakie pilem, bez udziwnien, po prostu bardzo kalsyczna pozycja Rami Rami is drinking a Stille Nacht (2015) by Brouwerij De Dolle Brouwers at Muzeum Azji i PacyfikuBrzoskwinia morela banan guma balonowa melon troche przypraw juz malo alko ale jednak poszczypuje, no lubie Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2016 33cl bottle vintage 2015 , served in tulip glass. Poured a pale amber with lots of yeast in it. Nice 2 finger white head. Aromas of malty sweetness, orange peels, citrus, apricots, apples, caramel. Taste: WHOAH! This is supersweet! Candi sugar overdose, with roasted malts, spices, black pepper, caramel, vanilla, orange, lots of alcohol, whole wheat bread, raisins, apricots, plums. Full body with a long dry, sharp alcoholic and sweet finish. Overall a pretty good brew, the 12% ABV is clearly present and its supersweet on the candi sugar. I believe that its especially these factors that will do a lot of good things to this brew if you cellar this properly for a couple of years. The brewer advises on cellaring and lots of people who have followed this advise say this brew really works its magic if you let it rest in some dark, cool place for a couple of years. I have stashed a few bottles myself and see if it really improves on age...
Update (24 december 2016):
Bottle 2015 vintage, tastes much more rounded, alcohol is not as sharp as last year, tastes sweet, candy sugar is still very much present. Still lot of apricots, plums, raisins, pepper, caramel, orange peel, honey, maple syrup. Alcohol is still present but not overwhelmingly as when drunk fresh. Taste has definitely evolved to a higher level, much more rounded. Tastes absolutely amazing. This is a very unique beer, one of a kind and cant really be compared to anything else out there. Sip it like a really fine cognac and you will be richly rewarded.
En god juleøl, med masser af fylde af malten uden at være spritet. En fin øl

Bottle, 33cL. @Brugge, Le Trappiste. An orange opaque beer with a big white foamy head ; good retention. Roast, herb, alcohol, biscuit, citrus, pear, prune, flower. Medium to heavy sweet, warming, medium dry bitter ; fresh wind. Powerful but no suffocating heat. Full body, medium texture, good carbonation, dry warming finish. Overall, a really good herbal yeasty floral belgian strong ale ; nice balance ; puzzled, I was expecting a dark winter ale. But hey, what did I expect ?...

Botella 33 cl en el momento en Cimmeria 08..01..2016. Lote/edicion 2015 en chapa. 12 vol. Marca peculiar. Tonos ácidos con maltosos amalgo caramelizados, todo ello con una buena sensación alcohólica. Buena.
Yellow with a nice head. Very full body. Earth, banana, malt. Long finish with some alcohol

330 ml 2014 vintage bottle from my EU Local Swap 3/2014 sender Anatole, many thanks!
Amber, hazy body, with a small, dissipating, frothy head.
Aroma of sugar, green apples, citrus, grass, flowers, honey, some grains.
Tastes of honey, biscuit, some sweet bread, dried fruits, apples, citrus, flowers, booze.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes warm, medium boozy, astringent, medium dry, sweet, a bit bitter, floral, fruity, a bit citric, with some honey, subtle zesty/piney hops.

Very nice. The nose is a bit flat maybe, but the taste is really lovely, intense, with a big, sweet malt body, but very well balanced, never too sweet. Alcohol is quite strong, but not overpowering and providing a pleasant warmth. Overall a great example of a strong Belgian pale ale, while not my favourite one.

33cl bottle at home. Pale dark orange with a medium white soapy head. Full body with low to moderate carbonation. Quite sweet with subtle bitter tones. Tropical fruits, sugar, yeast, caramel, some booze and spices. Quite alcoholic, but still nice.
Mooi donkergeel troebel bier met oranje gloed en romig witte schuimkraag. Aroma en smaken van abrikoos, perzik, geel fruit, sherry, cognac. Hele lange warme afdronk, licht alcoholisch. Topsap !!!
Stark in der belgischen Art angesiedelt mit ordentlich Hefe und Hopfen. Dazu etwas Vanille, Blumen, eine leichte Süße und ordentlich Perlung. Gute Sache.
Pours golden with whiteish head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, fruits, apricot, some alcohol, apples. Flavor is sweet, fruits, apples, apricot, malt, some booze. Finish has some dry bitterness.

Bottle bought in Enschede. The beer has got a hazy golden colour with a smooth body and steady head. Aroma of yeast and wheat. Taste of belgian yeast, flowers, caramel, blossoms, malt and cookies. Yeast Belgian finish.
12oz bottle pours a hazy brown with an off white head. nice burnt caramel and sweet malt taste

Bottle, batch 2015. Colour golden, hazy, nice head. Aroma vinous (chardonnay!), spices, some alcohol. Taste vinous, raisin, pepper, toast. Finishes dry with bready maltiness and spicy bitterness. Nice!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
En meget kraftfuld øl. Der er et strejf af bitterhed, men ikke overdøvede. God rund eftersmag. Og eftersmagen afløser den lidt bitre første indtryk fint.
Medium white head, orange golden coloured body, fruity yeasts herby floral, alcohol yeasts herby medium to high carbonation, medium bitter,
-2012. Draught mikkeller bar- fresh, punch-in-face, apricot, belgian yeast and caramel. Sweet, thick spicy, honey caramel, nutmeg and Alcohol finish. Overall: happy triple Christmas!
Goudblond bier met fijn witte schuimkraag. Geur: een zuurtje, moutig, beetje muf, kruiden. Smaak: zoet, honing, blonde basterdsuiker. Afdronk: wat alcoholisch en zoet.

Bottle, spec brew 2005, enjoyed 10 years after bottling. Pours light hazy golden with some sediments, and a nice creamy off white head. Aroma is sweet roasted malts with bread, rum raisins, prunes and dark fruits. Full, velvety creamy body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is roasted malts with bread and toffee, notes of nuts and wood, and dark fruits with raisins, prunes and figs, as well as kandi and nice sherry notes. Lingering sweet malty finish with wood and dark fruits. Still beautiful after ten years.

Bottiglia. Color ambrato carico con un cappello di schiuma compatta e persistente. Aroma stupendo, sembra un dolce natalizio, frutta candita, zucchero, caramello e frutta sotto spirito. Al palato si riprendono tutti gli aromi, lalcool si fa sentire un pochino e riscalda la bevuta. Favolosa.

December 29, 2015. Bottle, vintage 2010 and 2015.

Hazy dark orange with a medium sized white head. Aroma is sweet malty and fruity with candi sugar, caramel, dried fruit , grapes some cloves notes and spices.
Taste is sweet, soft bitter.
Finish is sweet with bread, candi sugar, dried fruits, some banana and grapes, very soft bitter grass and hay notes.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation.
 2015 was too young with a bit too much glue notes, fruity esters and slightly harsh grassy bitterness.
2010 was much better, sweeter with more dried fruits and softer bitterness.

From 2015. Pours orange with a thin white head. Aroma; banana, dades, orange peels, prunes, raisin, apricot, yeast and some alcohol. Flavours; dades, prunes, apricot, some caramel and alcohol. 
From 2010. Pours amber with a thin white head. Dades, apricot, prunes, orange peels and caramel. Flavours; Dades, prunes, apricot and caramel. 2010 is way better than the 2015.

2010
A: Light brown/dark orange, almost no head. N: Vanilla, dates, figs, apricot T: dates, caramel, figs, apricot O: Flavours really settled nice!

Bottle from JefVerstraete, thanks! Initially bursting with red fruit, it soon becomes a beery interpretation of white wine, enriched with notes of coriander, cardamom, peppery phenols, apricot, sweet citrus and herbs. Its very sweet, almost syrupy but the discernible ABV justifies that. By discernible ABV I mean only the warming touch on the palate, as I didnt get any boozy notes. Excellently balanced, very rich beer for slow sipping.

On tap at La Capsule, Lille. Light golden with a thin white head. Orange peel, banana, spices. Medium sweet with a drier and moderate bitter finish. Full bodied, sticky mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Probably worth tasting an aged sample.

2014 edition. Appearance- it foams out of the bottle, despite being sat upright for 12 months... very lively. The colour is orangey golden, with a dense one finger white head. Plenty of sediment floating around. Aroma- loads of orange, Belgian yeast, spices, lemon, orange peel, hop resin hints, banana sweets. Taste- juicy orange, spices, honey, tropical fruits, banana, sugary fruit, yeasty undertones. Mouthfeel is sticky, with a bit of carbonation at the end. A long finish with barely a hint of alcohol. Very nice indeed, a shame some of it was lost down the sink.

Typical strong ale. Specially great aroma: cereal, a little bit of alcohol.
Consistent and creamy white head. Taste is sweet. Overall, better than the majority of Christmas ales and for sure, one of the best Belgian strong ales out there.
My sample was a young one; nice sweetness on top of the acidity and the alcohol; some sweet oranges and bitters to top it off

Before a beer like this are few words to say. A true wonder. For two days I tried one that was a year and a half and another who was this season. I liked more the new, more powerful cooler. But perhaps it was a matter of temperature. A great beer!
Een sterke tripel met een volle, gelaagde smaak. Specerijen, alcohol en tarwe vormen het palet. Ook is er vanille te ontwaren. Kleur is troebel goud, met een mooie schuimlaag.

Bottle at home, vintage 2006 (9 years old!), aged in deansos cellar (Thanks for granting this opportunity!). Luckily a controlled gusher. Hazy amber, brownish with lots of yeast particles and a white head. Rye, honey, prunes, apricots, raisins, sweet malts, tea, biscuits, oranges, maple syrup, vanilla, gumballs, marshmallows, marzipan, almond spice, cake, citrus, yeastiness, resin, even a hint of pine. Very sweet with a delicate light bitter and light acidic finish. Body feels thin by the experience of high abv but full in the density of all the sweetness and rich aroma. Pretty lively sparkly carbonation. Very delicious and complex sweet heavy roller that drinks like a sparkly festive port with some serious extra weight. Its obviously a very strong beer but in the flavor there is absolutely no alcoholic note. Amazing! If it didnt look like brown yeast soup it wouldve been in my top 3 ratings! I wouldnt be surprised if this vintage was measured at +20% alcohol. Im not sure how that long bottle conditioning works but damn its only my second beer and Im nearing a complete couch lock.

Versa nel bicchiere di colore ambrato, nebuloso; la schiuma è bianca e spessa, ma di breve durata, lascia una pellicola sottile sulla superficie della birra. Sul fondo del bicchiere rimangono anche alcuni residui di lievito. Laroma può solo essere descritto come "Natale in un bicchiere"; marzapane, frutta candita, zucchero candito, lievito, mele caramellate, cannella ed altre ricche note dolci. Cè anche un pò di stile Brett in background, che si mescola molto bene con la dolcezza ed il fruttato. Il gusto non è così sfumato, ma offre molto di più in intensità, con zucchero candito, fenoli, agrumi, caramello, estratto di lievito ed una decente presenza di alcol presente durante tutta la bevuta. Il lievito non è opprimente, così permette allo zucchero candito, al caramello e alla frutta, di essere ben percepiti; mentre si crea uno sfondo effervescente che complimenta lasprezza degli agrumi. Lalcol riscalda il petto in modo significativo, rendendo il finale apparentemente senza fine. Nel complesso, si tratta di una birra per eccellenza; con abbastanza alcool per riscaldare anche lanima più fredda.
Bottle 0.33l at home, Nivala. Vintage 2014. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, sweetness, Belgian yeast and malts.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2017 33 cl. 2015, aperta il 27 febbraio 2017.
Oro antico con riflessi dorati, leggermente velata, schiuma bianca non molto persistente.
Aroma di mela, pera, fichi secchi, albicocca, arancia candita, zucchero candito, note legnose; un bouquet fruttato fantastico.
Al palato liquorosa, principalmente mela, fichi secchi, intermezzo affumicato che porta ad un finale liquoroso con albicocca secca e note di fichi secchi, il tutto accompagnato da un piacevole tepore etilico.
Corpo pieno, carbonazione poco meno che media, vellutata e avvolgente, alcool nascosto in modo diabolico.

------ cl. 2016, aperta il 27 maggio 2017.
Oro antico con riflessi dorati, leggermente velata, schiuma bianca di media persistenza.
Aroma di mela, pera, pesca, zucchero candito, note legnose ed etiliche.
Al palato principalmente mela e pera, etilico presente ma estremamente elegante, intermezzo con pesca sciroppata, finale con succo di mela e pesca sciroppata con una gradevole nota amaricante tra il legnoso e lerbaceo che equilibra la bevuta egregiamente.
A distanza dallultimo sorso lascia un lieve ricordo di fragola.
Retrolfatto con mela e pera.
Corpo pieno, carbonazione media, vellutata e avvolgente.

Vintage 2012 and 2014 vertical. Golden color with white head. Aroma is apricots, spicy yeasts, powdered sugar. Taste is more apricots, sweetness. Carbonation is high but small-bubbled. De Dolle at its best!

Bottle, vintages 2012 and 2014 vertically. The younger version is much fresher, the older quite dusty. Very fruity and sweet, and in beautiful harmony with just everything. Apricots, orange, some lemon. Incredible!

Botella. de @Cimmeria, Oviedo 21/12/2015. 
Color amariillo, aromas y sabores dulces, toques levadura y herbales, Todo muy bien integrado, compleja.

Powerful aroma of toasty malts, caramel and herbs with notes of fruits (banana and citrus). Semi-clear, golden-brown appearance, fine white head. Medium-high sweetness, light-medium bitterness. Average carbonation, full body. Great beer!

330ml bottle from Secret Santa in 2012 
Pours clear dark amber with floaters, medium sized beige head, lots of lacing. Aroma of sweet malts, caramel, raisins and dark fruit. Taste is sweet, caramel, honey and raisins 
Nice and tasty on a cold night.
Red gold pour plenty of foam. Aroma honey some grass - sweet honey classic belgian flavors. Tastes perfume orange honey malt. A little syrupy. Hides booze well.
Denne øl har en uklar gyldent udseende med et medium hvidt skum. Øllen har en frisk og sød citrus smag med en bitter eftersmag. Medium karbonering.

330 mL bottle from Tasty Beverage Co., Raleigh (2014 bottle). Hazy dark orange pour with a huge and frothy off-white head. Aroma of light citrus peel and faint Belgian candi sugar. Taste is mildly tart upfront but quickly met by booze and sweetness. A very well done Belgian strong ale and one of the best Christmas seasonals.

Flasche (datiert 2014, 33 cl) vom Bierzwerg, 1 Jahr daheim gelagert. - Dunkleres Orangegelb, gut trüb; bescheidene Schaumbildung. - In der Nase süße Rosinen, Studentenfutter, kandierte Orange, Ingwer, dazu weinig-schnapsige Noten. - Antrunk sehr breit malzsüß mit Rosinen, dazu Traubensaft. Erst allmählich setzt eine herb orangenfruchtige Note ein, die aber von der Süße erdrückt wird, ähnlich wie kandierte Früchte. Auch die säuerliche Schärfe wirkt etwas unrund. Matt rezent, enorm vollmundig. Im Abgang reibt sich herbe Orangenschale an der der fetten Malzsüße. - Trotz erkennbar bester Absichten recht schroff und unausgewogen. Ein Jahr Lagerung war wohl noch nicht genug.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Review from notes. Hazy amber color with off-white head. Aroma has classic belgian esters but also some zestiness. Taste leans towards sweet with the belgian yeasty character and warming alcohol. Body is not as carbonated as other belgian strong ales but it doesnt help the drinkability too much. The strong alcohol presence is enough to make it a slow sipper.

Une très belle bière à la robe ambée et à la mousse persistante. Le nez est complexe et élégant, à la fois fruité et floral. La bouche est parfaitemetnt équilibrée à la fois moelleuse et fraîche, longue et harmonieuse. Une délice de fin de soirée.

2014 bottle. It pours a very hazy deep, rich golden orange color with a massive frothy white head that lasts. The aroma hasa mix of alcohol and dried fruit esters. Apricot, orange with strong alcohol and subtle spicy yeast. The flavor has some warm alcohol, orange, peppery spice, dried apricot, a little leather and citrus. Spicy bitterness. High carbonation makes the full, alcoholic body more tolerable. Fruity, spicy, prickly and alcoholic. A joyful sipper that has a lot of intangibles including the full, frothy head and carbonation despite the high alcohol.

0.33 l bottle from Slijterij t Fust in Amsterdam, 2014 vintage. Clear, golden yellow with a thin, dense, slowly diminishing, white head. Intense, sourish-fruity and slightly funky aroma of rotten apples, oak, gooseberry, some caramel and brown sugar with notes of booze. Heavily sweet, slightly sourish and fruity taste of caramel, cinnamon, oak, vanilla and gooseberry, followed by a long, slightly tart, rather alcoholic and warming finish. Medium to full body, creamy and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Super intense beer, very sweet but with an interesting sourish note to balance not only the sweetness but also the alcohol which is quite prominent. Despite the alcohol, I enjoyed it a lot. Big and unique beer!
Smells super malty with caramel and raisin. Super nutty taste. Medium body, medium carbonation, and some foam.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2016 2015 bottiglia. Dorato scura con buona schiuma media persistenza e frizzantina. Al naso intensissima, speziata, dolce. Fenomenale al palato, oleosa, corpo pieno e intenso, dolce e spezie. Alcol molto intenso. Bellissima birra natalizia. 

2016. Bel Dorato con schiuma sottile, al naso frutta candita, pere e mele. Al palato super, avvolgente, dolce e traspare quasi una nota di panettone con canditi, spezie e dolcezza perfetta. Alcol ben nascosto. Si conferma al top alla spina.

Pours golden with whiteish head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, fruits, apricot, some alcohol, apples. Flavor is sweet, fruits, apples, apricot, malt, some booze. Finish has some dry bitterness. Overall: very good.

Clear pour, golden beer, retentive white head. Nose is warmly boozy, spicy, fruity, candi sugar, apple hints. Flavor is very "belgian", candi sugar, toasty malt, fruity notes, mild bitterness in the finish with lots of warm booze and fruity sweetness. Boozy, but smoothly so. Noce winter warmer.

From bottle (2015 bottle) @ Basement Beer Bar Juleølsmagning. Light malty aroma, wheat, light hops, light yeasty banana. Hazy amber with white, fully lasting head. Heavy sweetness, light+ bitterness. Full body, oily texture, avg. carb., sweet finish with moderate alcoholic feel.

2011 bottling. Powerful beer with absolute truckloads of malt sweetness. Not quite at GABS one-off beer stupidity but on the way. Funky fruits mid-palate with a small lining of bitterness late. Pure treacle. Slutty but hard to ignore. Should keep for at least another 2 years.

F: average, white, not long lasting, diminishing to thin film.
C: dark yellow/orange to amber, hazy, non-transparent,
A: malty, sweet sugary, nuts, some hoppy tones, yeast.
T: 0,33l bottle from De Hopduvel in Gent, huge malty, sugary, alcohol warming, nice fresh grassy/earthy hoppy tones, dried fruits, apricots, biscuits, full complex body, still not aged but great already, a must beer for Belgian Strong Ale.

Bottle from Voldby. Pours a pale, hazy yellow with a big, white head. Aroma is floral, spicy, sweet, slightly boozy, yeasty, pear-fruity. Slight hops. Taste is surprisingly light and fresh, dry, spicy and bitter, but with a nice, fruity malt sweetness to it as well. Yeasty spices and a pretty high carbonation gives this dry impression. Medium full bodied.
Hazy amber, thick white froth. Fruity, heavy yeasty and malty aroma. Sweet malt flavour with fruity esters. Quite alcoholic, still smooth and sweet.

Bottle from Auchan market, Luxembourg City! Bottled Oct 2010!

Pours hazy amber colored with a creamy flat white head. Aromas of strong spicy malts, orange peel and cinnamon. Taste has delicious spicy malts, sweet brown sugar and some gingerbread. Goes into a very spicy, malty, fruity finish, slight alcoholic warming.
Een zachte en straffe smaak met bleke mout en kandijsuiker. Een speciaal winterbier.

2014 Bottle at home, 7th November 2015. Pours with a big gush, appearance is straw yellow with lots of ugly floaters. Aroma is spice, booze fruit. Taste is hop, spice, banana, quite sweet, easy for the ABV, but not sure its necessary.

hazy bright amber colour, minimal off-white head; aroma of dried fruits, mostly figs, some plum, raisin and apricot, vanilla, caramel and floral notes; taste is also complex with dried fruits, syrupy sweetness, vanilla and spicy alcoholic notes; excellent ale!
2/21/2007 4:13:52 PM Bottle at home. Sweet, citrusy with relatively minor alcohol taste, scent. Huge foamy head. Full-bodied. Tart.
From zombier. In La Trappe glass. Playing KB Dark Side. Masterpiece. Its 12% noticeable at all. Dangerous. Nicely sweet. Repeatable
Bottle - Vintage 2003 - Butterscotch, caramel, raisin and some creamy apricot. Clear copper with a decent white head. Caramel and nice nutty dry notes. Nice
From old notes - no detail available - will re rate once I find the beer again.
Ambar anaranjado. Mucho sedimento. Dos dedos de espuma poco consistente. Aroma a miel licor y caramelo. Carbonatacion alta. Sabor predominante a sidra, y muy alcoholica y amarga. Dura.
Bottle, 330 ml from Roybeer, Milano. Pours golden with white head. Fruity, bit yeasty spicy. Sweet. Not bad, but somehow I expected more.

Pours cloudy pale gold with a short, short-lived white head, minimal lacing. (3/5) Nose is boozy dark fruit, candi sugar, spices, green apple. (6/10) Taste is moderately strong sweet, mild tart. (6/10) Medium slightly oily body, moderate to low carbonation, lingering boozy finish. (3/5)

Well, subtle this isnt - nor is it light, refreshing, or any of the other adjectives one normally associates with the beers of spring. No, this is very firmly a winter beer - one appropriate for lighting a fire in your belly as you gingerly sip it during the long cold months of torpor. And at a beefy 12%, theres fire aplenty. I dont say this often, but this might be too emphatic a beer - a little more even-handedness and balance would go a long way here. Still pretty good, mind you... (12/20)

Jen suis encore tout retourné !! Cette bière est un chef duvre. Un beau col de mousse persistant. Une bouche sirupeuse avec des arômes de genièvre et dépices, un arrière goût qui vous fait voyager dans les fleurs de houblon. Je suis impressionné par cette merveille, par cette brasserie et même par cette Belgique !!!

33cl bottle at Dulle Griet, Gent. Pours slightly hazy deep golden with some sediments and a fairly modest head. Complex somewhat earthy and fruity aroma with notes of dried fruits, Belgian yeast and spices. Sweet, earthy and surprisingly well balanced with complex flavours and a certain dryness in the finish. Full bodied with fairly soft carbonation. Heavy on the sugar and the alcohol, but well integrated and surprisingly well integrated.

Bottle at Bruxx with Nick & Rachel. Pours Golden Amber with a good White head. Aroma of booze, cane sugar and some fruity citrus. Some honey sweetness to the taste. A background of hops and cloves. Lots of sweetness and lots of booze. Very nice

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2015 2015/04/25 - Vintage 2012 from Kulminator in Antwerp. Pours a hazy, dark orange/amber colour with a thick foamy, off white head that lingers and laces nicely. Aroma is yeast, dough, molasses, sugar, gingerbread, cinnamon, apple and fruits. Taste is sweet; molasses, gingerbread, candi sugar, with bread notes and some nice apple/fruity flavours. Mouthfeel is medium and oily with average, smooth carbonation and a sweet, boozy, warming finish. Really great stuff. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle from Belgium in a Box - Hazy yellow, ugly looking beer to be honest, nose is bready. yeast and warm pizza dough. Taste is fresh and apple at the start, dangerously drinkable, then ends with a generous warming feeling as it goes down. Palate is thick and oily. A real gem. Looks can be deceiving.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2015 Shared 11.2 oz. bottle poured to snifters, showing a cloudy, orangey gold color, with frothy, white head foam, and waves & spots of lacing. The nose was a touch of yeast, ripe fruit notes as apple, subtle spice, and vinous-like character. Medium bodied, with lively carbonation, the taste was tart, adding citrusy & earthy bitterness, noticeable, but fairly disguised alcohol presence, with an effervescent finish. Quite enjoyable! Another shared bottle at Tims 40th included a bit of noticeable funk to the yeast, added more ripened fruit as lemon, & stone variety, more exposure to the alcohol, and a tart & dry finish.

Bottle at Gradi Plato Epiro, Rome. 

Orangish with golden reflctions, pretty turbid. A little persistent foam layer with just some little bubbles. 
Aroma is pretty intense, but not particularly lasting. Marzipan and bread, canned fruit, raisin. 
Coming to tasting, I have to say: Great body! Really dense, almost creamy mouthfeel. Start sweet, then you can appreciate a sour note, then remains a medium, dry, persistent bitterness. We can distinguish fruit, sugar, spices (pepper). Alchol flavor is soft despite the ABV.

Amazing in its complexity, perfect for aging.

From the bottle, this beer simply smells like beer. Unable to distinguish anything. When poured the aroma evolves into apple and champagne.
The taste works in the other way, first the champagne clone and then an overloaded taste of alcohol.
Clearly not my type.

Ambrée trouble, sédiments en suspension, effervescence moyenne-forte, col blanc abondant. Principalement maltée, fruitée (prunes principalement) sans être trop sucrée, trop dalcool, légère amertume sur la fin.

Fin gylden lidt uklar ale med relativt flygtigt, men kridt hvidt halvtykt skum. Tynd næse med lidt blomme og citrus. Sødlig smagseksplosion med en anelse bitterhed til næsten at ballancere sødmen ... men ikke helt nok. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille. Robe ambrée limpide, mousse blanche timide. Nez sucré et levuré sur des arômes de baie de genièvre et de pruneaux. Bouche sirupeuse et biscuitée aux accents de miel et de vergeoise. La final propose une jolie amertume avec des notes d?épices , de prune et de fruits confits.

Bottle at home. Light Amber with a light haze, white head that leaves a long lasting ring. White grapes and apple, quite some champagne and cider notes, light musty and herbal. Big sweetness with marzipan, canned peach, cake, apricot pie, light spices. Mainly sweet going into light fruity tartness and has a light bitter finish. Full bodied with full carbonation. Great stuff.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2017 05/04/2017 : retaste. Aged one. Taste is much better than fresh one. Booze is gone but it is much fruitier (ripe fruits). bit caramel, warming, nice! Change from 3,8 to... 20/02/2015 @ home - 33cl bottle from de Hopduvel.Orange like colour with off white head. Aroma and taste : fruity, sweet, boozy, warming, creamy mouthfeel. Just a bit too much alcohol on this one, maybe still to young, but however already a very nice beer.

330 ml Bottle, 2012 vintage. Golden color with some floating yeast particles. Aroma is dried fruit, pale malts, candy sugar and some light spice. Large Belgian yeast flavor that shows the same exact flavors as the nose. Nice body with a sweet finish. I enjoyed this as much as the Reserva 2010 I had over a year ago. I didnt want to age it any farther and it was a great drink.
Aroma of apple and champagne. Mouth under attacks by its 12 ABV. A tad soapy. Goes down the throat like a spirit. Abundant dregs.
Arôme de pomme et dalcool. Goût de pomme. Lalcool est très (trop) présent. Amertume en arrière goût accompagné par lalcool.

Bottle. Pours a clear and bright orange with a small, white head. Aroma is vinous, winegum candy, dried fruit, some booziness. Taste is somewhat sweet, alcohol, vinous flavors,. Sweet pale maltiness, fruitiness, apricots and peach. Full with medium carbonation.

Bottle courtesy of Deanso. Poured a hazy medium amber with a round bubbly white head. The aroma is sweet sugary malt, caramel. The flavour is moderate sweet with a big alcoholic malt toffee caramel palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

2005 vintage bottle shared thanks to Deanso. Had numerous vintages many times but never actual rated it, Ill rate on a vintage as thats the best way to have Stille Nacht. Pours hazy murky golden brown with a ring off white head. Aroma of caramel, porty aspects, toffee, light dank and moldy, really showing the age but in a way that works so well with this beer. Flavor is heavy sweet, booze from the fresh version is gone. Full bodied with very soft carbonation.
Bottle at Brony Tasting, DC. Aged by Travlr, but someone opened it. Im glad at least I enjoyed it! Rosy brown, foamy gray head. Sweet raisin, red fruit. Full lovely flavor.

330 ml. bottle. 2010 date on cap. Pours a hazy golden orange with a decent white head. Aroma of fruit, yeast, and spice. Taste is apple, peach, malt, yeast, spice, and caramel. Wish I could find more of this.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2015 Stille Nacht 2014, uitgeschonken in Oerbier glas. Oranje mistige kleur met veel gistdepot, veel zwevende gist deeltjes met een bescheiden witte schuimkraag. De smaak is zoet en kruidig, in balans gebracht door de bittere hop tonen, enigszins wijnachtig. Top product van de Dolle Brouwers. Complex, en aangenaam zoet als een dessert. Smaaktonen van winterse kruiden en specerijen. Als kruidkoek of appeltaart. Specerijen als kaneel en vanille zijn aanwezig, alsook gedroogd fruit, rozijnen, appels en abrikozen. De carbonatie is licht, en het hoge alcohol percentage van 12% is knap verborgen. De afdronk is zacht en kruidig met zachte hop tonen. Geen wonder dat de Stille Nacht is verkozen tot beste Belgische Kerst/winterbier, werkelijk een uniek product op de biermarkt. Een aanrader voor de echte bierliefhebber tijdens de donkere dagen van het jaar.

33 cl. bottle from 2014 @ home, gift from Barend.
Hazy amber with some sinking yeast flocks and a dense white head.
Fruity yeasty aroma with some candy sugar. taste is sweet with an underlying alcohol sweetness and a sour note. Mouthfeel is very creamy with a slight alcohol warmth, which is really gentle for its 12%. very long warming finish. Wonderful complex winter warmer.

Appearance is a beautiful amber honey.   Frothy small head with tight bubbles.  Maybe the lightest 12% Ive ever seen in color.  Aroma is a powerful sweetness, which is a mix of chocolate and caramel.  Smells a bit like a candied apple.   Palate is one of the finest Ive ever tasted- increadibly rich creamy feel from start to finish which is amazing.  Taste is the only thing that knocks this down slighly-  its warm and boozy feeling and has light malts with the sweetness and some dry hoppiness aftertaste.  but this is a bit flat in flavor compared to the aroma in my opinion.
Overall a fine world class ale.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2015 (2011 version on tap @ Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade, Jan 8 2015) Pours a hazy medium orange with a small lacy off white cap. Aroma of peach and orange sweetness and lemony acidity, candy sugar light but there, slightly burnt/dark sweetness, yellow raisins, spices. Palate is super vinous with yellow raisins and grape juice, orange peel, golden sugar sweetness all the way through, herbal yeasty sort spice mix it in the middle, some non alcoholic apple cider on the drier finish, hop bitterness moderate for style, light acidic undertone but less than on nose. Lingering concentrated dried fruit mix and dried herbs on aftertaste. A little alcohol heat. Medium bodied with high carbonation. Very complex and a fascinating sipper.

Aroma is apple. Taste is light apple golden sugars. Lots of floaters. Not much of a head. Mouthfeel is buttery and perfect. Taste is also light buttery. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2014 vintage, bottled, etregourmet. Effusive rocky white head, fragrant with a yeastiness reminiscent of apple blossom, wild honey, pollen, fermenting apple sauce, some jenever-like alcohol. Taste adds some marzipan malt and more orchard fruit yeast complexity to that aroma while remaining fairly light, non-unctuous nor sticky for the abv. Very subtle tart bretty note - probably ages with some gain? Accomplished heavy hitter with potential.

De barril en el XXXII The Great Power of Beer&Wine.
Una gran cerveza, unica en su genero, ademas si pensamos a una cerveza de Navidad. De color ámbar claro y espuma densa y persistente, en nariz hay frutas maduras, plátano y chuches, en boca encontramos en principio el dulzor de la malta, que rápido desaparece detrás del acidez y un final ligeramente amargo regalan un equilibrio sin igual.

Bottled 330ml. -from Magic Beer Room Zagreb. Vintage 2014. Clear dark golden coloured, minimal white to off-white head, notes of yeast and white wine in the nose (not so pleasant to be honest). Sweet malty, yeasty, fruity, heavy alcoholic and decent spicy with notes of wood and dried fruits. Also some cidery notes of apple and medicine alcohol in the finish. This one is hardly a good beer...or just a bad batch.

De Dolle Stille Nacht has a very active, overflowing white head, a murky, gold-gray-yellow, bubbly appearance, and heavy lacing left on the glass. The aroma is of light fruits, candy, white bread, and cream cheese cake frosting. Taste is similar, with low bitterness and noticeable bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium, and De Dolle Stille Nacht finishes semi-dry and boozy. RJT
Le graal. Cest une excellente bière. Un bouquet puissant, du corps, un goût unique. Testée et approuvée au coin du feu lhiver.

Bottle (2013 on cap). Deep amber dark pour with an nice head. Lots of hints in the aroma. Fruits, tart, candy, brown sugar. Very complex taste. Almost different per sip. In the beginning some carbo with light fruits and some sour notes. Sour notes get pushed to the back when the beer warms up. A very sweet beer then comes forward. Good, belgian-ale, sweet finish. Complex indeed. Very good brew altough I prefer the Easter beer from De Dolle Brouwers at the moment.

Stille Nacht perfectly matches the brewers intent. As a Belgian Christmas Ale, the Stille Nacht delivers. The aroma is rich with spice and fruit, the sweet scent tantalisingly lures you into your first taste in what turns out to be a blissful experience. The deep cloudy bronze, coupled with a rich head, present an absolutely stunning beer. Spice, rich fruits and lingering sugars engages you fully, and reward the effort of finding this Ale. Highly recommended.

Frangimus

Bottle at home. Massive body, very thick moutfeel. Gets better once warmed up. Taste is peach, mandarine, honey, sweet malts, candy canes, cinnamon, raisins, caramel... lots of stuff going on in this one. Palate is complex with little carbonation. The interaction between the sweet notes and the long finish are the big positives for me. Id hapily buy this again when I need a fix for my sweet tooth.

Bottle split two ways. Hazy bronze pour with a generous head. Lots of spices on the nose, some dark dried fruits as well. Super smooth with no sign of the fairly high ABV. Taste has some yeasty notes, dried fruits, some herbal notes and some malty sweetness.

Bottle, 2014 version. Pours golden with a white head. Grapes, apricot, pear, herbs, lemon, white raisins, caramel. Sweet, medium bitter and light sour, medium full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Vinous, warming and slighty boozy finish. Very nice, feels a bit young.

33cl flesje bij Cambrinus, Brugge
Alcoholpercentage van 13%
Uitgeschonken in origineel Oerbier glas

Uiterlijk:goudoranje kleurig met redelijke witte schuimkraag

Aroma en smaak: zuurtje, fruitig als peer, zoet als koek, citroen cheesecake

Conclusie: speciaal bier van de Oerbrouwers, zeker niet slecht 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
