Aroma and taste is medium sweet malty, caramel, laden with dried fruits, yeasty and light herbal, some nice spices on the palate. Gorgeous.
Bottle @Bierhuyske. Pours cloudy yellow to amber with off-white head. Aroma is fruity, hint of caramel, bit alcohol. Taste is fruity, alcoholic.
Un panettone liquido .. Grandissima birra che è ormai un MUST tra le natalizie ..

Arriva Natale...arriva Stille Nacht!!!! Non bere questa birra nel periodo di feste è come se non si festeggiasse il Natale!! Per pura curiosità e per il suo essere una "vintage deccellenza" me ne sono messe una decina ad invecchiare in cantina!! Birra da sapore mieloso e fruttato con una punta damaro (scorza darancia) ma con un finale morbido e caldo. Non vedo lora di comparare la versione invecchiata con una di produzione recente! Buon Nataleeee e buone feste con Stille Nacht!

Bottle bought from GBBF and kept until Christmas. Amber, big white head that dies down. Aroma of sweet raisins and caramel. Assertive carb. Sweet but dry, fruity but subtle, loads of contradictory flavours, complex and yet drinkable. Incredible that its 12% ABV but has no perceptible burn or heat.

Bottle. Pours hazy light brownish amber with small white head . Aroma is sweet apples, prunes, duck roast and candied peel. Taste is medium sweet, light to medium bitter and light to medium acidic. Body is oily with medium carbonation. Finish is long and balanced sweet and acidic with notes of malt, apples, prunes and cinnamon.
33cl @ bottle. Stille Nacht 2014. Belgian Strong ottima per un felice natale da alcolizzati.

Lille julaften, hjemme: 2009-årgang (okt-09 iflg. kapselen), denne har jeg lagret lenge. Jeg åpner den med andektighet og skjenker opp i mitt Hadeland nisseglass, her skal alt stemme. Lett uklar rødlig kobber, med kort filmskum som varer. En intens aroma av fiken, svisker og kandiserte frukter stiger opp, og smaken er like intens, her er rosiner, sukat, fiken og alt som hører julen til innen gjærbakst. Overraskende slank og lett for sin vinkelhastighet. Med Dag Arnesen trio på stereoanlegget blir dette virkelig en høytidsstund.

33 cl bottle shared. Appearance: Hazy amber orange color with a small head. 
Aroma: banana, apricot, peach, pear. alcohol.
Taste: sweet, light bitter, with some fruit and peppery yeast and warming alcohol in the finish.
Full body, average carbonation.
.Full bodied with soft carbonation and long bitter finish. 

Seems that the bottles were quite fresh, but for now We did find this to be a slightly better than average Belgian Strong Ale.

330ml bottle, v2014, at the Barley Cargo, Athens. Hazy golden orange color with off-white head. Aroma is sweet fruity citrusy, orange, light dusty, yeasty, wineous, light wood and alcohol. Taste is sweet like the aroma, citrusy fruity, malty, light wineous again, light spicy and light alcoholic. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Birra bionda con schiuma poco generosa. Odore di mosto duva, vino bianco frizzante, odore Di frutta gialla. Non eccelso. Alla bocca migliora. Mosto duva, arancia, frutta gialla e qualche prugna. Finale secco ed astringente. Tessitura tra lacquoso e loleoso, buonissimo il corpo. Warmer etilico pazzesco,riporta quel bel sapore di uvetta passa e frutta sotto spirito. Gran bella birra.

33 cl, flaske, 12,0 % ABV, købt i Den Belgiske Ølbutik i Vanløse, 15. december 2014.
Karamelfarvet og ufiltreret belgisk juleøl med minimal og flygtig offwhite skumtop på 3-4 mm. Svinder smukt til lidt bobler i overfladen og en lille kant. Rolig i glasset.
"Smuk" og velduftende aroma af frugt bl.a. banan, kaktus, marcipan. Vinøs.
Majestætisk smag! Let syrlig sødme og veltilpasset bitterhed. Kompleks øl. Solid alkohol i smagen, men elegant integreret. Opsummering: medium til stærk sødme, medium bitterhed og let syrlig.
Umådelig veltilpasset karbonering, som er et godt stykke under medium og giver en let perlende fornemmelse i munden. Kroppen er rund og fyldig og konsistensen tyk og klæbrig. Lang bittersød eftersmag. 
Dette bryg er sødt, men mesterligt udført.

On tap at the Birre Sotto l'Albero festival in Rome-ITALY (Macche and Bir&Fud). Pours golden hazy with a compact white foamy head. Nose: wine most under fermentation, peers, cellar, pungent pepper. Mouth: round complexity of fermenting beer most, spices and peculiar yeast. Perfect beer! Worthy a 40 minutes queue. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

De color anaranjado y reflejos ambarinos. Presenta una buena formación de espuma y estabilidad. Presenta turbidez. En nariz presenta aromas intensos a frutas que recuerdan a orejones, melocotón maduro y ténues notas melosas. Aparezen trazas suaves trazas de alcohol. En boca presenta buena correspondencia con el aroma aunque el alcohol está menos presente ya que se encuentra muy bien integrado en el conjunto a pesar de su 12% de alcohol. Buen cuerpo y carbonatación media. Su final es seco y con generosas dosis de malta en el retrogusto. Deja una suave y agradable sencación de calor al pasar por el esófago. Un GRAN cerveza. Botella 330 ml

Aroma: banana, spices, caramel, intense sugars. Appearance: hazy, pale gold, medium, frothy, white head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: quite intense carbonation, malty sweets intensify, caramel, some yeast. Overall: outstanding Belgian Strong Ale, amazing taste and palate. Bottle from Beers of Europe, Kings Lynn.

33cl teku. Pours a small to medium white head, dark orange peachy cloudy colour. Smells sweet malty, extremly fruity, candied sugar,  yeasty, champagne like, leathery/woody, light pleasant alcohool; thats very nice and really unique. Tastes white wine grape, malty, peach, yeast, belgian, candied fruit; medium+ sweetness, perfectly rounded by a low bitterness and low to medium, nice and intresting, sour acidic note. Medium body, low carbonation, Supreme drinkability (its 12%) !!!! A very original, complex, classy and rich brew, amazing

Bottle 2014: Nose is orange, candy sugar, very strong cloves, apple, slight nut, grapes,. Its a perfect nose for a Christmas beer. Taste is very sweet, barley wine like in some ways, with strong orange (with a little acidity which stops the beer being cloying.) green apples, apple brandy, , peach, grape, pronounced barley sugar, honey, leading to a little oak and floral tones. The finish is perhaps a touch short. 

Edit: As I got through the bottle the orange juice and barley sugar flavours took over, and the beer lost some of its complexity. Its still a very good beer, and oj is an interesting and unusual approach, but Im not a huge fan of the oj taste. 

A complex and interesting beer, which stands out from other Christmas beers with a deftness of touch and a greater range in the taste profile. The beer is exceptionally balanced.

An interesting beer indeed! cloudy orange-amber. Flakes of brown-gray sediment can be seen listlessly bouncing along the bottom of the glass. A film of tan head that very quickly fades to nothing. Some bubbles are seen to rise, but there is no staying power in this head. Aroma is candy, moss, biscuit, some spice. Some lactic seems to come through as well (which upon a second read is consistent with the brewers description), although this isnt apparent in the flavor. Flavor is light brown candy, some general spice, even a bit of bread crust and white raisin, prune. And a bit of hot rummy alcohol to top it off. A bit bitter in the aftertaste (spicy hops.) Palate is heavy, syrupy, with a moderate carbonation and light associated burn, Take a bit of the weight of the body off, but not enough to balance it. Its a bit much actually. Weak points are head retention, and slightly oppressive body and sweetness. A very nice and interesting sipper. Drink in cold weather. (Its cold here in Providence now, but alas, my heat is stuck on!
UPDATED: JAN 19, 2017 0,33l fles gedeeld met lion. Niet verkeerd voor een Belgian Ale naast de overdaad aan zoetigheid ook wat zuur en kruidig.

Pours orange with almost no head, looks like lemonade. Aroma very high on caramel, nuts, very sweet, lovely smell. Taste kicks in with caramel, nuts, sugar. Turns into haeavy alcohol and lasts sweet in the mouth for a long time.

Cervesa amb aroma i gust molt complexes, destaca un toc a àcid làctic, la cervesa evoluciona molt bé, recomanable beure-la amb tranquilitat.
Cerveza con aroma y sabor muy complejos, destaca un toque a ácido láctico, la cerveza evoluciona muy bien, recomendable beberla con tranquilidad.

Bottle 0.33l from De Hopduvel beer shop Ghent Belgium.Pour it hazy yellow color with small white head.On the nose fresh cheese. Taste and aroma of grapes, peach, malt, cheese, caramel.Aroma and Taste that blows you away.Great complexed and what to say just Perfect.

Bottle at Studenterhuset. Pours hazy dark orange with a medium shortlasting head. Aromas of fresh orange, caramel, spices, yeast, malty sweetness. Taste is pretty fruity up front, raisins, caramel sweetness, citrus, lots of spices and some grass.

Vintage 2013. Mala pianka drobinki osadu rozchodzace sie po pokalu. Kolor ciemno zlocisty aromatyczny pigwowy i nieco biszkoptowy. W smaku slodkawe, ale z przelamaniem goryczkowym. Finisz dlugi zalepiajacy podniebienie rozgrzewajacy alkohol. W smaku tej mocy sie nie wyczuwa. Klasyk wspaniala rzecz na rozgrzanie w cicha zimowa noc. polecam
330ml bottle shared with the Mrs. wrapping presents. Big orange nose, light alcohol, light spice. Taste is more orange peel, light spice, light booze burn. Lovely.
330ml bottle. Orange gold color with small white head. Very thick taste of dark fruits and spices. Sweetness.

Bottle from Binnys in Bloomingdale, IL. Murky golden-orange pour with a smaller white head - doesnt necessarily look like much. But then you smell it, and out jumps loads of candi sugar, apple, honey, maybe some plum. Sweet for sure. Taste is very similar, quite sweet, a touch boozy, and some yeast. This is super tasty.

Mmmmmmmm this is an awesome beer! Very sweet with aromas and flavors of honey, sugar, peach, grape and spices. Dry and slightly bitter finish. Despite the very high ABV the alcohol is barely noticeable. Excellent beer. Bottle from 2012
Bottle at home. Color is brown/golden with a small white head. Sweet aroma with notes of raisin, nuts and alcohol. Taste is sweet with a nice aftertaste of spices with a hint of plums on the finish.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2015  --- 2007 Edition --- 
330ml bottle served in a Trappist chalice. 
A: Very nice hazy amber color. A huge bubbled beige head and many lacings left. 
S: Fantastic nose. Strong notes of strawberries and grapes at the moment its poured. Dry fruits and oak. Alcohol can be felt but is very well hidden. Bready Belgium yeasts. 
T: Great taste. Strong notes of dark fruits, dry fruits (plums and raisins). Strong notes of bready Belgium yeasts. Oak hints. Sweet upfront (little bit chocolate). Very dry and bitter finish.  
M: Heavy full body. High carbonation.
O: Wonderful beer. Bring me a cask! 
[ BA Review @ 1/19/2010 ]
 --- 2008 Edition --- 
330ml bottle served in a chalice. 
A: Very nice hazy orange color. A huge bubbled beige head and many lacings left 
S: Very fruity. Strong notes of plums and peaches. Notes of oak. Alcohol can be felt but is very well hidden. Bready Belgium yeasts 
T: Again, fantastic. Very peculiar. Fruits and Belgium yeasts are evident. Oak. Very dry aftertaste 
M: Heavy full body. High carbonation 
O: Wonderful beer. This 2008 Edition reminded me a Strong Pale Ale compared with the 2007 version which is darker and smoother 
[ BA Review @ 12/28/2010 ]
 --- 2012 Edition --- 
330ml bottle served in a tulip glass. 
A: Pours a nice orange hazy color. Lots of chucks floating around. Forms a huge bubbled white to yellow head. Good retention and many lacings formed and left 
S: Sweet and fruity. Notes of plums, peaches and grapes. Strong notes of oak. Quite winy. Alcohol can be felt but is very well hidden. Bready Belgium yeasts 
T: Great taste. Very grainy and spicy. Sweet upfront with notes of candi sugar, dark fruits and bready Belgium yeasts. Strong notes of oak. Bittersweet Belgian style 
M: Heavy full molasses body. Good carbonation. Sweet grains and hoppy bitter aftertaste 
O: Great drinkability. Excellent beer 
[ BA Review @ 12/03/2012 ]
 --- 2014 Edition --- 
330ml bottle served in a tulip glass. 
A: Pours a slightly orange to amber color. Lots of thin particles floating around. Forms a medium bubbled off white head. Excellent retention, it never disappears completely leaving tons of thin, 
lingering and molasses lacings in the glass.
S: Sweet and fruity. Notes of plums, peaches and grapes. Strong notes of oak. Quite winy. Alcohol can be felt but is very well hidden. Bready Belgium yeasts 
T: Great taste. Very grainy and spicy. Sweet upfront with notes of candi sugar, dark fruits and bready Belgium yeasts. Strong notes of oak. Bittersweet Belgian style 
M: Heavy full molasses body. Good carbonation. Bittersweet aftertaste, a balanced mix of candi sugar, dark fruits and grassy hops.
O: Great drinkability. Excellent beer 
[ BA Review @ 01/03/2015 ]

The Dolles famous winter beer, a classic since 1982, with off-white, regular, relatively stable, sticky head and orangey amber colour, hazy. Perfumey, tempting aroma of orange, pineapple, ripe peach, amaretto, flowery hops, spiciness, whisky; very vividly fruity taste, almost like fresh orange juice, quickly becoming yeasty, spicy and malty, honeyish, slick and creamy mouthfeel, dry finish with floral, aromatic hops and lots of booze, but fortunately not becoming wry, long and satisfying. The older version of 8,1% ABV, made with Rodenbach yeast and basically a blend of old Boskeun beers, was better still, more balanced and less alcoholic. Has a great ageing potential, I hartily recommend vertical tasting of several vintages.  Which gives me an extra argument to state that this beer deserves to be classified as a barley wine rather than the somewhat meaningless Belgian strong ale...

330ml bottle at Bistro LAutre Oeil. Cloudy golden with a frothy white head. Flavors are dough, honey, vanilla, barley sugar, grapes, apricot and citrus with herbal and spicy notes. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, creamy texture.

Pours a hazy brown body with a medium head. Faint yeasty aroma. Rich malty taste with a nice balance.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Couleur ambrée un peu trouble, mousse qui disparait. Nez fort miel, levures, nonettes, fruits noirs. Gout sucré, miel, fruits noirs, fruits secs,malt, épices , notes houblonnées. Tout les gateaux et épices que lon trouve traditionellemnt a noel mais trop sirupeuse et sucrée a mon gout.

a bit overrated. its a better than average ale, fairly standard for the bsa style. spice and fruit and alcohol in the nose. yeasty flavor, with plums and other fruits, with a sweet, dry yeasty finish. alcohol shows a little, but this is a good golden ale overall."

Golden brown and clumpy cloudy with a ringed white head. Nutty sweet, redcurrant raisiny and a buzzing candy sugar that leads into the initial taste. Neat bitterness throughout but theres a cakey creaminess. Carbonation is clean and oily. Fading sweetness on the finish and a classy sealed bitteriness. Bottle, Tasting by Numbers Tasting
Bottle at Craigs. Pours amber, nose is raisins, caramel, dark fruit, taste is dry, sweet fruit, caramel, spices.

On tap at lost nation: pours cloudy golden with a nice white head. Aroma is grapes and funk. Taste is grape, honey, sugar, more sugar, more honey, and Belgian yeast. Way cloying ly sweet. Medium to heavy body, nice carbonation. Not for me.

2013 bottle. Aroma is boozy, like a tripel with even more alcohol. The body is very rich and heavy, comparable to a quad, maybe even thicker. The flavor is full of different sugars, sticky, complex, sweet but not too sweet. Creme brulee, hints of vanilla, rum barrels, candi sugar. Warming. A perfect Christmas beer.
Troebel donker geel bier met schuim. Smaak is krachtig, kruidig en zoet, kandij, drop, anijs. Licht bitter. Blijft lang hangen. Top bier wat ook in de zomer goed smaakt.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2014 An old bottle, end 1990. Expiry date around 1996. Cellar kept bottle, dusty and intact etiquette. Just beautiful, no words can describe the intense character this beer has obtained over 20 years. Pours amber with a small vanishing head. Who cares, cause the aroma is overwhelming! Undescribable even. Slight tart, full body, slightly sour, heavy melasse, cream, grass. What a balance! Since early 2000 this batch has been my favorite... and hardly any beer has stand up to the test. One of a kind. This old Silent Night - and I still have some bottles left - is most evidently one of the best beers around. Even a 5 year old one beats the vast majority of best rated beers. Try to taste one if you can, nothing beats this experience! Sleep tight, silent night.

A younger bottle, around 1995. Pours a clear amber; what a clarity! Hardly any residue in sight, tiny foamhead sticking to the glass and remaining present during the whole session. Even sticks to the glass long after. Explosion of soury, red forest fruits and brettanomyces-ish aromas. Wood, slight booze, pomegranate, prune aftertaste. Everything I’m gonna put here will be an understatement anyways. One of the best beers around, fresh and aged. 

Second pour : yeast residue appearing (better not drink this as it creates a headache the day after: trust me). Even more wood and soury fruits. Sticky splendor! Waaw!

Bottle 2013 : The typical but unique aroma and taste a Silent Night always guarantees. Aroma is caramel, apple with a touch of honey - medium body - booze kicks in slowly - low carbonation - soft hoppy aftertaste. Sugar lingers on, which is nice.

Bottle at chez Clem. Dark Amber color with a disappearing white head. Full body and medium carbonation. Taste of alcohol and of sweet but with a spicy aftertaste. Very well balanced and very interesting.

Bottle from Dranken Pauwels. Pours a rich golden clear amber, with a large white bubbly foam head, which dissipates to thin. Some floaty bits. Nose is exquisite. A grainy, sweet, citrousy tripel, with sour vinous notes, sherberty sugar, fruit syrupy, and then lots of dried apricot, dried plum, dried mango, white grape, spicy. Taste is sweet, pungent alcohol, lots dried apricot, grainy barley, vinous, light citrous bitter, and then on the finish some nice fruity sherberty candy sugar.

Mézszínű ital krémes habbal és aszalt gyümölcsök illatával, melyben leginkább aszalt sárgabarackot vélünk felfedezni, amint tejszínes-mézes öntetben fürdőzik. Íze nemkülönben fantasztikus élményt nyújt. Az édes jelleg, mint vélelmezhető alapíz természetesen megfogalmazódik bennünk az illat alapján, de ez az édességnek olyan mesterien lekerekített formáját adja elő, hogy csak ámulunk. Amikor az első korty a szánkhoz ér, valamiféle szirupos, ragacsos jellegre számítunk, mely azonban a legkevésbé sem lesz az, az édesség foka ugyanis hirtelen megáll egy bizonyos ponton, még időben visszafogja egy kellemes kesernyésség, mely ízek tökéletesen összefonódnak, és bár idővel némiképp intenzívebbé válik édeskés karaktere, mégsem lesz túlságosan nehézkes és lehengerlő. Meghitt esték italaként szolgáló valódi különlegesség.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2014 2013 bottle. Hazy dark orange color, small foam head. Aromas of blue cheese, yeast, nutmeg, canned apricots, sun dried tomatoes (the dried kind, not the kind preserved in olive oil), hint of laurel. Blended to perfection. Winter stuff. Quite a boozy smell I might add. Taste is absolutely jam-packed with herbs and spices, nothing I have ever tasted before. Nutmeg, freshly ground peppers, laurel. If this does not accompany a hearty winter meal like meat stew or rabbit, nothing does. Amazing. Develops beautifully, all the tastes fade away nicely, a slightly boozy kick follows (but it is accompanied by a nice taste of orange zest) and it ends in a very modest stickiness. Would rate it even higher if the carbonation was better; it lacks somewhat in this respect.

33cl 2013 bottle,pours a dark orangey colour,with a large creamy white head,aroma is sweetish grain fruity notes,taste starts sweetish with light grain and drier tastes later,sweet dryish finish that lingers.nice heavy palate,overall a very nice ale well worth drinking

Totally delicious stuff; very sweet, belgian yeast. Prominent carbonation and head, and some alcohol notes in the nose. Booze notes as well, but in a good heartwarming way. A sipper for sure, and a lovely beer.

When I drank this Christmas beer last November I new it was something special. It is possesses the distinct Oerbier flavor typical to the De Dolle brewery however this one possesses that perfect combination. It tastes like an aged beer right out of the bottle of the same year. Drinks like a fine wine. Amber color that starts with a grape/wine flavor then ends with a slightly sour finish. SO Good!

@ Vino Bellissimo / Lima OH --- Cloudy medium amber with a lot of sediment specks; heavy head cover, sheet of lace. Taste is malt with dark dried fruit and yeasty dark biscuit. It moves without incident through the palate to a lightly hopped finish. A solid, albeit somewhat heavy, brew that is best enjoyed on a cool evening.
Flesje 33cl, oranje geel van kleur. Zoet aroma. Smaak is prettig, licht bitter met zoete touch. Heerlijk bier.
Very complete Belgian strong. Raisin and some light prune. Nice package and balance. Finishes with light sweetness. Soft carbonation. Belgian yeast. Nice package.
Sweet, with some slight lemony citrus flavor, pepper, burnt sugar, and some slight clove-like spiciness. Sweet, malty, and complex, with a strange dryness.

A - Gushes out of the bottle and pours a deep, dark orangey hue with a massive, off white head that leaves quite a bit of head.

S- Plum, cherry, apricot, grape. Amazing to just stick your nose in.

T- Grape, cherry, strong alcohol burn, light hop notes.

M- Medium bodied and effervescent.

D- Amazing beer to sip on. Just when I thought I hadnt had a belgian beer in some time that really blew my socks off ...

Pours dark golden color out of bottle. Quick fading white head leaving some lacing on glass. Aroma is wine and malt. Initially a strong malt flavor followed by white grape juice. Finishes with some toffee and a hint of bitterness. Chewy mouth feeli with nice carbonation.

330 ml bottle at home, into a tulip glass. ABV 12%
Dark orange copper colour on the body, with a small, slighty off-white head sitting on top, thin also and with low retention. Light lacing left on the glass.
Aroma of sweet malts, sugar, grapes, some red fruits.
Nice taste, quite wine-like, white grapes, quite sweet, sugar. Alcohol notable but only as a light burn on the finish and a warming feeling on the body. 
Medium thick body, soft carbonation. 
Overall very good and especially on a cold weather.

Color trials, such as the triple. But it is written with 13% alcohol content. Myself were included in the mouth is not so much in the hope but was surprised at the moment when I drank. s A taste and a strong full-bodied but delicious balance of sweetness and alcohol is exquisite. I also drink a neat indeed for a refreshing fragrance smell like grass does. I was not impressed with this beer is made really well.

ASPETTO: color oro carico, schiuma bianca, buona presenza, fine e media persistenza . OLFATTO: impronta inziale nettamente propensa ai malti, con profumi di zucchero, miele, frutta matura, in infusione in note alcoliche a tratti quasi vinose( vin santo), lieviti evidenti. GUSTO: approccio dolce, mieloso , confettura. presenta note speziate, alcol notabile e nel finale mantiene un certo tocco acidulo, compaiono amaricanti della luppulatura e uno speziato ampio sostenuto dalla alcolicità. TEXTURE: Corpo medio, morbida, lascia una leggera sensazione burrosa sulle labbra, media carbonazione. COMMENTO FINALE: non prettamente natalizia a mio avviso, offrendo una certa speziatura meno evidente rispetto ad altre birre del genere: la luppolatura gioca un ruolo piouttosto evidente mantenendo un tocco acido che la allontana appunto dal classicone natalizio. alcol evidente ma ben inserito accompagnando in una sensazione di calore piacevole. annata 2013
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes dunkel goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig süß, alkoholisch, belgische Hefe. Geschmack sehr malzig alkoholisch, fruchtig, würzig

Bottiglia 33cl comprata da giangaspero e bevuta a casa.
Ambrata con schiuma persistente.
Corpo pesante e alcolico, complessa, molto dolce, un po' di amaro alla fine dona un po' di equilibrio.
Difficile e complessa.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

This is one of the very best. At least for my taste. Poured into an Oerbier glass, the first thing youll notice is the color. Unlike almost every other Christmas beer, Stille Nacht is clear orange. The aroma is very complex and difficult to describe: apple, maybe some honey, some vanilla (?). The head is white and lasts pretty long. Onto the first sip. Again, a pretty unique tasting experience... Starts off sweet, yet the finish is rather dry with some roasted malts and you can notice the hops. Love the apple like taste, which makes this quite refeshing. I will try to keep some of these bottles in the cellar for aging, but it will be quite the challenge. 

To summarize: another great beer by Dolle Brouwers, but that is no surprise. Hope I can get hold of a Reserva one day.
Aroma is bananas/bubblegum, mild/medium sweetness and slightly perfumed fruit. The flavor is fruit/bubblegum/berries, medium sweetness/sugar, malts and a tart/alcoholic finish.

Bottle. Clear dark gold with a big off white head. Aroma is caramel, vanilla, apple and floral Belgian yeast. Taste starts off with the apple, giving way to some caramel, huge alcohol punch and a roasty malt note in the finish. Medium-thick chewy mouthfeel and relatively strong carbonation. This is an old favorite from before I started rating beers so I was really looking forward to having this again. It did not disappoint.

On draft at Max's . Golden pour with no carbonation. Interesting flavor reminds me of root beer ... Good stuff!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The pour is clear mahogany with a fizzy beige head. Fruity nose of guava, peaches, juniper berries, alcohol, caramel, honey, floral notes, and candi sugar. Very interesting esters all around. The taste is sweet with a bitter backbone. Medium to thick mouthfeel with a substantial body and gentle carbonation. Very good.

Wonderful aroma hits you as soon as you greet this Belgian Strong Ale. Hints of plum, raisins, and malt on the nose. The taste is slightly sweet yet the hops shine through. The finish is smooth and refreshing. An amazing Belgian Strong from one of my favorite Belgium Breweries, De Dolle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Contrairement à la plupart des bières de Noel, celle ci nest pas noire ou brune. Bière très complexe et riche: agrumes, miel, épices, alcool présent. 
Indispensable... et à laisser vieillir !

Bottle from Cornelius Bruges. 2012 version. Somehow expected this to be dark, but slightly hazy gold with energetic fizz. First impression is that its way too sweet for me, but after 2-3 sips its full character comes through. Fruity in a plum/raisin way, and wrapped in that warm boozy blanket that never overpowers despite being up front. Theres a zing here too though, both on the palate with little tingles at the sides of the tongue, and in the taste which veers from that sweet fruity booze to a medium dryness with hints of clove and banana along the way. Packs a punch at 9am too! Very good indeed.
Amazing clear golden in color. Tastes like banana bread. Thick on the tongue. Cant wait to try the reserva.

Bottled: On Friday I had a bottle of this and I was too wasted to rate it ... ; ; Toffee apple  covered over butter and booze ..white grape covered in chocolate brownies and tart bitterness . Fucken good sipper... beautiful texture .

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2014 33cl in a Delirium Noel glass. Pours a bright orange colour with lots of carbonation for such a strong beer. Almost quadruple-like in its richness and flavours. Tremendously strong in flavour and alcohol. Almost like what I would imagine an eisbock Tsjeeses to taste like with fruity flavours, honey sweetness balanced with a slight bitterness as to not be overpowering with a good alcohol burn. Very good and will evolve with age - good job I have some for Christmas 2014 and 2015 cellaring.
Update: 2014 - sampling 2012 version - much better than previous years sample. Less strong tasting. Clearly a more mature beer with much more rounded edges

Pours a copper color with three fingers of fizzy eggshell foam, some floaties. The nose is a steady mix of fruit fuji apple, white grapes, pepper, clove and a touch of sweet wildflower honey. The palate follows the nose and is boozy yet very drinkable. Nice balance of sweet grainy fruit and boozy yeast profile. Pepper, cinnamon, honey, apple, fig some earthy almost cognac booziness. Bitter finish with some heat.

Bottle at home (2013). Pours hazy amber with a fast fading white head. Sweet, fruity, flowery, aroma with yeast and alcohol. Sweet, fruity, taste, some alcohol, and a bitter finish. Nice thick feel, but a bit harsh still. Would probably really like this when aged.
Amber coloured beer. Sweet aroma with something of bubblegum. Taste is sweet. Raisins, tropical fruit, honey but also because of the high alcohol content what liqueur-like.

Pours a hazy amber colour with a frothy white head. Complex aroma of exotic fruits, apricot, grapefruit, banana, yeast, spices, hops, some alcohol. Flavour is exotic fruit sweetness, yeasty, some alcohol warming. Modest bitter, spicy aftertaste. Very interesting and enjoyable brew!

Bière ambrée avec un beau col épais qui développe des senteurs de fruits confits, de sirop de malt et desters alcooliques. En bouche, la gorgée est dense avec un profil sirupeux moyen à la saveur de pain dépices avec un arrière goût légèrement suret (sucre fermenticide?) et un relent de levure. La finale amérisée est minérale et florale assez longue avec une touche de fruitée (levure + sucre) faisant penser à la banane et la mangue. Cest une ambrée très savoureuse légèrement surette bien charpentée en alcool et en malt aromatique .

Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur légèrement ambrée, trouble, mousse assez faible, peu de tenue. Arômes fruités de pêches, abricots, ananas, une touche de bonbon, un alcool bien présent mais pas rédhibitoire et une pointe de houblon en toute fin de bouche. Très savoureuse, juste la texture qui manque un poil de peps à mon goût. Trouvée à Vanuxeem - Ploegstaert.

DAA; My No. 300. Bottle from 2012. Pours hazy orange with a fading off-white head. Nose fills with yeast, sour, fruits, sweets, spice and alcohol. Taste adds sweet, malt and loads of fruitiness of all kinds. Vinious, warming and complex. Full body, texture is sticky and the carbonation is soft. Lasting fruity and spicy finish. Enjoyable indeed.

DWS :) 2012 bottle. Colour amber, little foam.
Aroma is yeasty, sweet, sour, applecake, vanilla,butter, spices and fruity.niiiice aroma :)
Round taste, vineous, sweet, alcohol, caramell, apple, spicey, honey, cherry.. lots of well balanced flavours. Soft carbonation. 
Fantastic :)
Heerlijk bier met een verraderlijk hoog alcohol percentage. Een van de beste bieren die ik heb geproefd.

zacht,zoet bier met weinig bitterheid.
kleur amber met witte volle schuimkraag.
sterk bier, ideaal voor de winteravond

BOTTLE 33CL.

Look: deep amber and cloudy with an small off-white frothy head with poor retention. 
Aroma: dried fruit, raisins, rich malty and grainy, alcohol.
Taste: dried fruit, raisins, strong phenolic bitterness, the alcohol is a bit over the top.
A great Belgian ale. Beautiful vinous and sweet raisin aromas. Quite awesome. Sweet malty flavors a touch of grape too.. Nice boozy finish. Superb.
Sweet nose, bit of booze. Golden with yeast in suspension. Taste the booze, good yeast profile and finishes with a hop kick.
Amberkleurig met prachtige romige schuimkraag. Krachtige volmondige smaak. Zachtzoete aanzet in de smaak. Weinig bitterheid
Very nice winterbeer. Subtile taste of caramel, citrus, dough and some red fruit. Perfect for the cold days.

330 mL bottle. Kind of an unappealing, hazy brown with floaties, but it has a nice, off-white head. Fairly bold aroma has spice, Belgian yeast, fruit, and some candy sweetness. Surprisingly smooth taste, and not as sweet as I expected. There is candied fruit, spice, honey, yeast, and just the slightest note of booze. Shockingly drinkable. Big body. I had to keep reminding myself to just take sips.

2004 vintage tasted in 2014. Stored properly for the last 10 years. Deep copper with a nice large collection of floaters on the bottom. Yeast? The colour is beautiful, no head. Smells of super sweet toasted malt. Figs, caramel, raisin, nut, orange, alcohol, nice soft spice. Full oily body. Initial sweet taste of caramel and toasted malt but then settles into a medium roast in the mouth with figs, alcohol and finishes nutty, complex spice and a bit of alcohol. Warms the tummy. Aftertaste is fruity and spicy. One of the most dynamic beers Ive seen. At 12% the alcohol is still noticeable after 10 years who isnt a bad thing. Defiantly a a Christmas beer to sit by the fire and eat chestnuts with. Very nice. Would like to compare to a young one. Defiantly one of the top beers in the world.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Light brown beer with no head. Aroma of toffee, caramel and malts. Taste is toffee, quite a bit of caramel, hops, spicy fruit, pepper and some sweet golden syrup. There is some alcohol warmth. This beer seems to improve the more you sip it. Full bodied and low carbonation Very unlike the other strong Belgian beers I have tried before. Overall, very good and interesting.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: JAN 4, 2014 33 cl. flaske . 12 %. Købt i Ølkonsortiet i Aalborg. Årets, 2014, første øl. Gylden øl, måtte gerne have lidt mere sødme, efter min smag. Lidt sprittet, men også på de 12 %. Årgang 2013, havde nok haft bedre af at blive gemt et år eller to
33 cl bottle 12% abv. Cloudy golden. Sweet taste with fruity acidity and alcohol heat. Dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Bottle at home. Two year old. Pours a clear dark orange colour with a big, light beige head. Fruity aroma with touch of hay, some citrus, pale malt, apple and Belgian yeast. The flavour is similar but with more sweet malt, and only hints of alcohol. The mouth feel is rich and slick, and has a light bitterness. A rich and malty Belgian strong ale with a very nice balance.
Es una cervesa k al primer tast et confon pero un cop la vas probant es mes bona i mes dolça. A gust a barrica de vi. Exelent
Bottle shared by alexsdad06, 2006 vintage. Pour dark gold with tons of floaties. Nose sweet malt, citrus fruit. Taste sweet malt, spice, heat late in palate. Still very drinkable.
Very nice winterbeer. Subtile taste of caramel, citrus, dough and some red fruit. Perfect for the cold days.

2007 vintage bottle at home. Pours clear golden/copper. Aroma is yeast, alcohol, sweet malts, spicy and caramel. Taste is pretty sweet and alcoholic. Nice and complex. Full bodied, sticky texture. Good stuff.

Gusto mio personale. Una birra perfetta, Profumo, gusto, corpo, carbonatazione (moderata per fortuna), finale. Tutto al punto giusto per il suo stile. Nel rating sta sotto a birre che valuto peggiori, penso che alcune belgian strong ales infatti dimostrino, a parità di gusto, uneccessiva frizzantezza. -------- My personal taste. A perfect beer. Perfume, flavor, body, carbonation (moderate thankfully), final. Everything in the right place for his style. The rating is below the worst beers that I rate, I think some belgian strong ales in fact demonstrate, for the same taste, excessive carbonation.

Color amarillo miel, media cabeza de espuma que perdura, al acercar la nariz a la copa explosión de aromas, flores, levadura de pan y frutas tropicales; entrada de trago potente y maltoso, se nota el alcohol pero está bien integrado, cuerpo y carbónico medio, trago corto con notas a especias. Cerveza para tomar despacio ya que los 12º se acaban notando, guardada unos años seguro gana mucho ya que necesita hacerse más redonda y ensamblarse sus ingredientes.

Enjoyed on Christmas Eve watching White Christmas with kids nestled all snug in their beds. 2012 bottle. Very deep yellow slightly cloudy, but with just a few floaters left at the bottom of the bottle. Nose is straight up canned pineapple with some cinnamon and cloves poking through. Booze starts to dominate the nose as it warmed. Taste is warming alcohol, sweet canned pineapple, dried apricots, and some cinnamon and other spices. Sweet but not cloying. Definitely a sipper and a tad hot. Reminds we very much of a grilled pineapple dish we make at big summer barbeques with rum, butter, and cinnamon. Winter warmer indeed.

Bottle from Marlou Genk , bottled 2012. Has a deep, hazy yellow appearance with a yellowish head, which vanishes fast.
Aroma is of strong alcohol, differents spices, including clove and cinnamon, and yeast.
Taste of Stille Nacht is nearly complex, alcohol is present from the very beginning and lingers till the end. Very yeasty, lots of spices on my tongue, cinnamon, clove, pepper, burned malt, sugar, honey and a little bitterness at the end, which enhances the sweetness of the sugar. Long aftertaste of mostly sugar and alcohol. In my opinion they push it too far, the beer appears unbalanced to me, sugar and alcohol are too present, they dominate all the other ingredients and interrupt the possible complexity.
UPDATED: DEC 26, 2013 Sweet and heavy. Lots of apricot fruitiness. Found it a bit hard to drink with the high abv and thick body, but had a great experience overall with this barleywine-like beer.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2014 2007 bottle, picked up at Bottleworks and consumed in the dead of night on Christmas Eve Eve. Bottle gushed all the hell over me and my kitchen floor -- thats what I get for not being prepared. Anyway, gushes a really unattractive, murky, sediment-suspended light brown with pillowy offwhite head all over the bottle, but not a ton left in the glass. Aroma is really nice and layered. Apple is the first thing, followed by cotton candy, some (not at all unpleasant) oxidation, cherries, figs. Moderately sweet, lengthy finish, some alcohol warmth. Love how the apples and toffee and booze go on and on and on. Palate: Full, sticky body with all kinds of carbonation. Overall: Despite the gushing, this is a really beautiful beer (I mean, it aint much too look at, but the nose/taste is remarkable). Ive steered clear of Belgin strongs somewhat because they dont tend to resonate with me, but this could very well change my mind. Had I been smarter with my purchase I would have bought a 2013 to have side-by-side and do this all scientifically.

  Vertical with OldMrCrow on Feb 10th.  Bottles from 2013, 2009, 2005, and 1995.  Not a gusher in the bunch, which brings the appearance up to a 4.  The fresh bottle was full of molasses, caramel, grape, apple, brown sugar, and cotton candy on the nose, with a thick sticky texture, lively carbonation.  Quite sweet with a bit of heat and some doughy yeast character.  If this was all this beer could be I doubt Id return to it.  The 2005 poured darker, flat, murky, and full of particulate matter.  The sweetness was more restrained, though it had a surprising hop presence.  Lots of honey and brown sugar, but also some prunes, soy sauce, and cardboard -- at this point, it tastes like a good, old beer that is a bit over the hill.  The 1995 bottle is just way too old.  Undrinkable beyond a few sips, and Im not going to let it influence the ratings here.

  The 2009 ... wow.  This is the sweet spot, and if I were rating on this sample alone this would be an easy 4.3+.  Average, fizzy head.  Clear, sparkling light amber pour.  Everything in this version just gels -- the over the top sweetness has now been cut back, kept in check by whatever it is that dries out old beers after a few years, but the cardboard/stale hops/prune flavors are nowhere to be found.  Sherry, grapes, apple, some honey ... it all just melds together beautifully.  

  Its unreasonable to say that *all* beer should be consumed fresh (even if most of it really should).  On the flip side, its even more unreasonable to say that *many* beers benefit from age.  On balance, I tend to lean closer to the former perspective than I do to the latter, but beers like this one serve as a glaring counterexample to the "fresh is always best" camp.  At 5 years old, this one was nearly magical.  I could see how a person could get caught up in chasing this kind of alchemy.

  Im updating the rating to reflect the range of experiences Ive had with this.  If I only ever drank it at 5 years old, itd be 4.3 or higher.  If I only drank it fresh, or when it gushed, or when it was too old, that could drop as low as 3.7.  4 seems like it hits the (weighted average) alright.

12% bottle from Ohtsuki, shared at Christmas Tasting. Musty, woodsy, caramel, possibly slightly oxidized? Taste-wise somewhat boozy, caramel, musty, port notes, really homey easy drinking beer. Something to curl up with sipping next to the fire. To me I wasnt digging the musty smell so much but the taste was actually quite drinkable and enjoyable. Everyone felt like they were being wrapped in this beers loving embraced-it elicited many allusions to the word comfort. I guess it is a comfort beer?

2008 ver.
Aroma is woody, funky, carmel, cabin smell. musty. 
Taste is leathery, sweet, spicy, porty and warm. Boozy. 
Some heat. Fireside.

2007

Pours light mahogany, minimal tannish head

Smell dark fruit, red fruit, sweet

Taste rum, fruit, raisin, and surprisingly still a bit of heat, caramel

Mid to full body, complex

Nice

lote 2013.
De color cobrizo, anaranjado. Con espuma blanca, esponjosa y de burbuja pequeña que desaparece poco a poco, dejando el rastro del encaje. 
El aroma acido es lo primero que destaca, achampanado y dulce.
Bien carbonatada y con cuerpo medio, oleoso.
En boca fruta madura y levadura, con regusto achampanado y algo de alcohol, aunque para tratarse de 12 % está bastante bien integrado.
Una gran cerveza, aunque no es mi estilo favorito.

Well, since Im a big fan of De Dolle my expectations are very high. A 2013 33 cl. bottle poured in to a Trappist glass. Hazy, deep amber golden (a lovely orange) colour with a fat, white head that fades to a thin layer. Sweet, complex aroma with yeasts, sweet exotic fruits, banana, oranges, spices, honey and some candy. Very rich and malty. A bit of alcohol. Taste is medium to heavy sweet. Palate is perfect, full body with a rich, oily texture supplemented by a lively, dotting carbonation that removes some of the fatness from the rich malts. Long lasting sweet finish with yeasts, spices, sweet fruits and a slight heat from alcohol. This is truly great - I bet a little bit of ageing would mellow some of the alcohol down. Superb experience!
Una splendida birra di natale, perfetta sia al naso che in bocca. Frutta matura, caramello, note resinose.

From tap and bottle @ kerstbierfestival Essen. Somewhat dark orange cloudy pour with an Okay head. Good aroma of wild fruits, berries and spices. Taste is very full though complex. I get oranges and grapefruit, hops perhaps? Burnt sugars and cinnamon. Full thick body yet drying finish. I can see why this is a favorite, might be too much of a newbie to recognize all the flavors. Still a fantastic christmas ale.

Bottle in the Bierbrasserie Cambrinus, Brugges. Pours a cloudy amber colour with a little white head. Very spicey flavour, but light and hoppy. Starts sweet before a good very bitter finish. Possibly some orange and cloves in there too. Really good.
Aroma of banana, apricot, peach, pear. Sparkling with golden color. Large white head. Some heavy sweetness balanced by the hops. Full bodied with soft carbonation and long bitter finish.

11.6 oz bottle to snifter (2012 vintage; shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a semi-transparent dark orange with off-white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells solid; Belgian yeast, stone fruit, and candy. Tastes like it smells with a nice mouthfeel. More apricot in the taste than the nose. Good beer.
Hazy amber orange color with small head. Aroma is sour and fruity. Flavor is sour and malt, alcohol, belgian yeast. Not really my kind of beer, but not bad.

Bottle.
Pours amber with a frothy white head, retains and leaves nice lacing on the glass. 
Sweetness, banana marshmallow, peach, winegums 
Taste is sweet, bitter, herbal, yeasty, peppery and has some raisin notes Belgian allright. 
Thick and with low carbonation.
Bitter dry after taste.
Hazy yellow blond, medium carbonation. Very well balanced beer. Aroma of spices, yeast and stone fruit. Sweet and bitter. Very complex but also easy drinkable.

330ml bottle into a goblet. 2008 vintage.

Pours a brilliantly clear medium brown, at least until I got down to the bottom of the bottle and all the chunks came out, with a one finger white head. Really great head retention.

The aroma is loaded with dark fruits and has a really nice sherried quality. There is some spicy yeastiness along with a touch of vanilla and cherrywood. Very fruity all around.

The flavor is nearly all cherry up front but the other flavors follow quickly behind. More dark fruit supports the cherry along with a slight bit of oxidation. Vanilla and wood undertones along with ever-present alcohol letting you know that you are drinking a very hefty brew. Bitterness is very low with really no hop character to speak of. The mouthfeel is silky and smooth with some light warming after the finish.

Overall, I really love this beer. I wish I had a fresh one to compare but I imagine that age has done wonders on this as it is so smooth. The greatest think is it was already five years old when I bought it for $5. Truly a steal.
UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 Bottle @ unibaren. Slightly clouded orange, medium white head, great lacing. Aroma, malty, belgian yeast, wheat, banana, spices, licorice notes. Similar taste.

On tap. Pours amber with an off white head. Aroma is very fruity and a bit hoppy. That's all I get - it's served a bit too cold. Full bodied and sweet - it has a strong taste of fruits - especially citrusy ones, malt, sugar, bread, yeast, spices and some hops. Quite complex. The aftertaste is sweet and fruity - makes my mouth water (in a good way). A very Belgian strong ale and a real sipper. Love it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Vintage 2001. Truly an exceptional beer! Aroma of spicey caramel malt, dark berry fruits. Medium body, moderately carbonated, flavour is honeyed, sweet caramel malt and some heavy citrus. Finish is sweet and alcoholic.

Une bière qui mérite un classement dans mon top 10 (et pas loin du top 5) !
Complexe et raffinée, l'alcool n'est pas prédominant. Notes sucrées mais sans excès. Un must !

Stille Nacht 2010. Fad.
Hvidvin, syrlig duft.
Uklar mørk korngul.
Sød men tør. Belgisk. Lagret. Svær at beskrive men kompleks palet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Une levure machable dans un paradis de sucre candi accompagné de pomme, petits fruits et un peu dagrumes. Jy ai trouvé des éclats semblable à la Rochefort 10.

Merci à Boutip pour la bouteille! Bière très sucrée... Trop à mon goût. Elle supporte quand même assez bien son alcool, elle ne parrait pas son 12%. Elle fait effectivement bières "des fêtes", avec ses notes de cassonade et de cannelle. Ce nest malheureusement pas une bière qui fera chavirer mon coeur : trop forte et trop sucrée pour moi.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2013 2011 330ml bottle into a Trappist glass. Pours a beautiful deep orange brown with a half finger tan head that seems to last forever. Sweet aroma with floral and citrus notes. Wow! Just took my first sip of this and the thing that immediately strikes is the fantastic balance. Sweet caramel, citrus fruits, spices and wonderful hoppy (but not overly bitter or astringent) finish and some light alcohol. Amazing velvety and oily mouthfeel. This beer is a gorgeous punch in the face with a velvet glove and seems like itâs one that will get even better with age. Lucky Iâve got another few bottles cellaring.

Bottle from Voldby. (2012 bottle). Hazy yellow/orange colour with a small off-white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Taste begins with fruit and ends with nice warm alcohol. Very thick palate. Very complex finish with notes of alcohol. Great beer.
On tap at Biercab. Hazy orange colour with white head. Honey, malt and fruit aroma. Sweet, honey, caramel and fruit taste. Medium to full body.

Bottled in 2012.
Appearance: The body is an opaque amber to orange hue with a tall and dense light tan head that has good retention, maintaining its shape for a minute or so.
Aroma: The aroma is fruity and leans sweet. Ripened strawberry and apple cider comes to mind, theres a mild dough presence and a touch of phenolic black pepper. The aroma masks the 12% near perfectly, I only get a hint of it. This almost smells wine like.
Taste: A bold fruitiness is on the intro, very sweet red wine like, while strong caramel and brown toffee back it. The flavor picks up some black pepper which overlies banana and hints of bubblegum. The finish is a bit dry and lingers with a touch of alcohol and black pepper, almost tannin like too.
Palate: Thick and moderately carbonated.
Overall: This is a complex beer that leaves me believing Im missing out on a lot here. I find this enjoyable, it reminds me of wine in a way. I recommend this, its a worthy buy if youre up for a big fruity Belgian!

330 ml bottle. 2008 bottle. (Ølbutikken) Copenhagen, Denmark.
Murky brown colour with a small off-white head. A huge amount of sediment floating in the bottle. Sweet caramel, dark fruits, sweetness and mild alcohol in the aroma. Alcohol, dark fruits, malt and berries in the flavour. Waterish. Warms a lot. Disappointment. I was expecting more. Im not sure if this one has aged well...
2008 bottle. Dirty brown body offwhite head. Yeast floaters. Aroma has lots of vinegar, caramel, some blanket. Flavour has acid, little coffee and chocolate. Surprised how complex this is.

2011 bottle via slowbeer vic.
Sweet delicate and spicy nose
Delicious ultra sweet and rich in a bright way nice bitterness to help it aling utterly desirable

How I have not rated this one? Candy orange color almost no head. Nose is sweet with spices. Taste is great. Ages well from the 2005 I had to 2012 batch. Sweet but smooth, high ABV but no booze. its a great beer and one I drink often.

Une de mes bières préférées.
La mousse tient peu car très alcoolisée, cependant elle a un nez riche.
Beaucoup de diversités dans le goût, du citron au cèdre en passant par le réglisse. Cest une tuerie absolue.

A cloudy brown amber with a large long lasting white head on the pour. Caramel malt, Belgian yeast, dark fruit notes along with some citrus orange fruity esters. There is some brown sugar and sweet alcohol flavors with mild bitterness. A medium body, a smooth and mild sticky sweet caramel orange bitterness on the palate. Finish is sweet full flavored. Overall a very well made and tasty ale.
Big amounts of spice and yeast and citrus. Wonderfully layered and blended to create a great flavor profile with a lightness from the pale ale but assertive with the ABV. Very bold and works well.

330 ml bottle from czar - thanks, mate. Pours a sediment-filled pale orange amber with a resilient white head. Aroma is tons of caramel and some barley candy. Flavor is sweet, brown sugar, ripe red berries, fruitcake. Finish is boozey, warm, subtle bitterness, port wine. Lingering barley candy. Strong body, unctuous mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very robust, yet very flavorful.

Poured from a 12oz bottle; brown pour with small head. Nose is sugary spice, dark fruit; flavor follows with some spice on the back end. Reminded me somewhat of Black Tuesday just based on the sweetness factor.

Sugar bomb -- that's all you need to know. Disappointingly overbearing in its fruity sweetness. Below the surface, you can somewhat make out the underlying malt and individual fruit flavors, but the sweetness is just too oppressive. Only redeeming quality is the ABV of 12% is well hidden. But I had higher hopes. C+

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2014 Bottle. Hazy copper with a good lacing medium sized off white head. The nose is fruity, sweet grapes and a bit white wine vinous. Fruity aroma as well with some esters and notes of oranges, apricot, peach, very light grass/hay, syrup, warming and light stingy alcohol. Taste is heavy sweet with just enough bitterness to keep it from getting too much. Almost. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. It is a fine beer, but also very hefty and only enjoyable in small amounts on those rare occasions. Stille Nacht! Heilige Nacht! Christmas is terrible.
Amai, what an explosion of different flavors. It has a paradoxical balance between an aggresive sweetness and an underlying hoppy bitterness. Impressive effort.
Aroma of white wine, apple juice, and great malt. Pours amber with slight film. Taste is great with apple, alcohol, and nice tart spice. Wonderful balance of sweet and spice.
Big malty beer, with lots of head. Aroma of dark fruits and toffee, taste follows. Really enjoy this beer.
From bottle, pours hazzy orange with a big white head. Smell of bread. Pours a big carbonationl. Taste of caramel and toffee and some cherry. This beer is great!
UPDATED: JUL 22, 2013 Champagne-like aroma. Taste of plum and raisins. Greatly balanced beer. Absolutely fantastic beer!

Elle est ambrée, voilée, nayant quune petite tête de mousse qui reste en place et se réanime en la secouant. Les oranges, la muscade, le clou de girofle et des herbes séchées, sorganisent pour séduire le nez, alors que des effluves dalcool emboîtent le pas, avec une bonne dose de cassonade foncée. Un goût épicé et crémeux. Une impression de "suc à crème" aux épices. Il y a des saveurs de dattes et de figues qui frayent au travers un alcool très bien intégré et aussi très efficace. (696-160613)

Svårt med rate på vertikalprovning. Lenner har styrt upp en tung vertikal. 04, 05, 07, 09, 11, 12. Kulörerna skiljer sig stort. 04 är 8% de andra 12%. 04 har härlig sötma och påminner om engelsk barleywine. 05 söt och komplex. 07 äppelkaka. 09 syntetiska inslag men trevlig sötma. 11 krämig, banan och äpple. 12 drar åt en söt saison. Förvånansvärt stora skillnader. Provningen startar från ung till gammal

Bottle - cap says 2010**. Pours cloudy orange with cornflakes floating in it. Huge gigantic orange head that dissipates slowly with tons of clumpy lacing in its wake. Aroma is fruity, caramel, toffee, spices, yeast. Flavor is the same, medium sweet with some bitterness, primarily lemon-testy. Definite belgian yeast notes, some bread, spices, fruitcake, rum. Light warming in the mouth gives away the ABV, but pretty good for 12%. Full creamy mouthfeel. Despite appearances, this is a good beer!

33cl bottle from bier tempel, brussels. Dark copper color with thin to medium head. Carbonation is ok. Medium sweetness and low bitterness. Aroma is caramel and woody. Its a nice beer, but I expected much much better...

Bottle from Tommy, thanks man. Dark brown pour, thick creamy head that disappears rather quickly. The smell is hints of spice,  caramel and raisins. Taste is hard to describe, sweet but also bold and boozy up front almost a wine like finish with hints of spices but also very sweet, with hints of butterscotch and brown sugar, unlike anything I have ever tried.

Nose of holiday spices, malt sweetness and toffee.  Taste is very similar almost like a thick saison for the sseason.  Pour was murky brown and had a nice lingering head that left some serious alcohol lacing on the glass.
12oz bottle pours a thick pale copper color without much head. Very sweet and some pineapple flavor.

330 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled in 2010.  Gusher bottle upon opening, but I didnt lose anything.  Pours moderately hazy and cloudy orange amber color with a 3 finger dense and fluffy white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts.  Spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation.  Aromas of big apple, pear, orange peel, raisin, grape, honey, caramel, banana, clove, floral, herbal, pepper, candi sugar, bread, and yeast earthiness.  Fantastic aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/spicy esters with malt notes; with great strength.  Taste of big apple, pear, grape, raisin, fig, caramel, honey, banana, clove, candi sugar, herbal, floral, pepper, bread, and yeast earthiness.  Lingering notes of light fruits, caramel, honey, banana, clove, candi sugar, floral, herbal, bread, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while.  Fantastic balance and complexity of fruity/spicy ester notes; with a very balanced malt backbone and zero cloying sweetness after the finish.  Medium-high carbonation and full bodied; with a slick and lightly syrupy mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with hardly any warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a fantastic Belgian strong pale!  Big complexity and balance of malt and yeast ester flavors; and very smooth to sip on.  A highly enjoyable offering.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2013 Poured from bottle (2012 dated) to Unibroue tulip. Bright murky reddish orange pour with a big frothy head. Aromas of sour tropical fruit, dry oak, very slight vinegar, plums, white grapes, cherries. Flavor is a blast of bittersweet white grape and mango, alcohol heat going down, dryish finish. This is good. The alcohol is present and warm on the finish, but still goes down pretty easy. High carbonation with a medium slick mouthfeel. Very thick and strupy toward the end as it warmed. Unique flavor and somewhere between sour and dark Belgian quad. Really liking this! Would love to try the Reserva, but not gonna do that level of whale hunting.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2014 25.12.2014, 0,33l bottle (2004 vintage) @ home:
Small bubbly shortlasting head. Aroma is slightly concentrated fruity, raisins, dried apples, oak, candied sugar, pear, burnt caramel, figs, bark, toffee, grass. Taste is mild oxidized and slightly concentrated fruity, raisins, honey, grass, caramel malts, candied sugar, dried apples, alcohol, oak, pears, butterscotch. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Very nice.

17.12.2014, 0,33l bottle (1987 vintage) shared @ BBGTC tasting:
5-3-8-4-13=3,2
Small bubbly shortlasting head. Aroma is kind of strange, old moldy potatoe cellar, paper, potato skin, hay, soil, caramel, molded wood, hints of citrus. Taste is slightly fresh and sweet, sour dark berries, grass, citrus, candied sugar, caramel, butterscotch, sorrel. Little bitterness, slightly sweet sour-ish mouthfeel. Actually kind of nice...

02.02.2013, 0,33l bottle (fresh 2012 vintage) @ home:
5-3-2-1-6=1,7
Small bubbly shortlasting head. Aroma is slightly fruity, dried fruits, caramel malts, almond essence, grain, hay, banana, yeast. Taste is sweet and slightly sour-ish fruity, dried fruits, citrus peel, alcohol, sugar, grass, hay, citrus, light malts. Medium to longlasting bitterness, harsh boozy mouthfeel. Not my cup of tea, needs years of aging.

330 ml bottle bought @ beerplanet.be. 2011 vintage. Pours clear deep copper with a thin creamy offwhite head that quickly dissipates while leaving some sticky trace on the glass. Smell is sweet, malty and fruity with caramel, vanilla fudge, dates, figs, overripe grapes, alcohol, sweet bread, whisky, banana bread, wood and hints of apple wine. Taste is sweet, malty and tiny fruity with caramel, sherry, figs, tart cherries, sweet bread, alcohol, wood, moist soil, lemon zest, whisky, red wine, apple wine and cookie dough. Mouthfeel is surprisingly dry, round, boozy, slightly fruity tart and near full bodied. Finish is tiny bitter, malty and fruity tart with caramel, sweet bread, tart cherries, figs, dates, cookies, alcohol, sherry, wood and hints of apple wine. Complex and very tasty

Bottle @ home picked up at Mile High Denver. 2012 vintage. I really dont know why Ive been slacking on rating De Dolles offerings but I hope to get to a few more of them this week. This pours a clear, rust orange appearance with a fluffy, light brown head. Orange peel, dark fruity, plum, raisin, somewhat spicy yeasty, candy sugar, a bit earthy aroma. Toffee, brown sugar, a touch smoky, dark fruity, caramel, spicy yeasty, light chocolate flavor with candy sugar and a bit of booze on the finish. A true classic that I really should pick up more often.
Beautiful glowing orange colour. Thin wispy  white head.  Medium bodied but so much depth.  haunting hue of balanced sweetness and power and complexity. Nose is as penetrating as John Holmes.

33 cl bottle from Etre Gourmet. 2011 Vintage. Pours hazy yellow with a medium offwhite head. Sweet aroma with fruity notes. Medium carbonation, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, strong alcohol notes. Too fresh ? 
Leaves a thick compact layer of yeast in the bottle.

2000 Vintage from Akkurats cellar. Looks: clear copper brown with small head. Aroma: complex, sugars, vinegar, berries, leather very nice and complex. Taste: sweet sour, vinegar, fruity, complex and hard to describe. Interesting brew!

Bottle. Pours a cloudy amber color with a moderate white head. Nose has some heavier fruit elements to it with some yeastiness. Taste has some sweetness to with the fruit elements coming through, but definitely drinks like its 12%. The alcohol makes it a tad harsh for me.

2009. Heller, sehr hefiger Antrunk mit intensiver Getreidigkeit. Belgisch, alkoholisch, gut. Intensiv, vollmundig, ab dem Mittelteil ist der Alkohol nicht mehr erkennbar. Hell, hintergründig allerdings z. T. Zuckrig. Gut! 11/13/9/12/11/12

The aroma is sweet, fruit, bread.  The appearance is slightly hazy amber, white head.  The flavor is sweet, bready, fruity, candi sugar.  The finish is pine, lingering fruity sweetness.  Full body.  Excellent.

Bottle. 2012 vintage. Rich, ripe, blast of peach, banana, ripe golden apple, orange citrus and honey.. which quickly transitions to concentrated Belgium yeast and spice nuances.. Followed by more tropical, banana, pineapple, spice and honey nuances in the loooong finish... Lingering flavors of Belgium candi sugar and ripe, tropical nuances which coat the palate. Thick and rich, yet balanced with tons of flavor.. While big and bold, 12% alc is well hidden by concentrated flavor.. Very big.. and very Belgium.. I would bet this would develop nicely with age. A wonderful night cap. Dont serve to cold. Worth experiencing. --- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Side by side 99 and 12 bottles @ Kulminator. The 99 pours a very deep, ruddy concentrated red color. The 12 is much light amber in color. Perhaps a recipe change took place in the intervening years? The nose on the 99 is rich toffee, apple, candi sugar. The 12 is moderately hoppy. More earthy, forest mushrooms and caramel. The 99 tastes very sweet. Apples and flabby toffee. Rich, thick malty sweetness. The taste in the 12 is much hoppuer. More lemon and caramel-covered berries. Hot wood. FUll body and smooth for both. The 99 frankly tastes a bit knackered. The newer vintage was more appealing.
330 ml bottle. Pours a clear dark copper color with light head. Aromas of orange zest, licorice, and phenol. Flavors of burnt honey, toasted malts, spices, and bitter orange. Very nice overall.
Årgång 2006. Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, äppelmos, barley wine känsla. Mycket gott och välbalanserat.

Bottle. Aroma honey, plums, fruity. Colour lightly hazy golden. Taste rather sweet, honey, caramel, light fruits. Spices show themselves a moment later. Ginger, orange, cloves. Finish too sweet for me. Want to rerate in future under better conditions.

Bottle @home.   Birra natalizia se ce nè una. rofuma di canditi, coriandolo,caramello e alcool.  il colore è ambrato/ramato la schiuma ha bolle ampie e viscose. é di corpo estremamente pieno, la carbonatazione è scarsa, ma è un pregio, perchè si riesce ad avvertire in maniera più decisa la dolcezza estrema, le note acidule, ed i gusti che ricordano la frutta tropicale. Non ho mai assaggiato annate più vecchie della 2001, ma si narra siano stupende.

Annata 1987 da 33 cl. bevuta al Kulminator di Anversa. Prodotto viintage di altissima qualità, dove le note speziate erano ancora ben presenti e il gusto, quasi torbato, aveva assunto un gusto unico. Un buon livello di amarezza. Chiudeva con una nota acidula, che però nelle annate più recenti (2009 e 2010) era più evidente.

11.2oz bottle from Party Source. Vintage 2012. Somewhat darker yellow - orange color. Clear, but kind of hazy with all the particles floating about in the body. Good thin off-white head. Few loose dots of lace. Bigger body. Very nice light tart taste, and sweet, but with good citrusy zesty kiwi hop bitterness, too. Light belgian sugar sweetness, but besides that, little hint of the alcohol, especially for 12%. More noticeable in the nose than anything else. Smooth, lighter, crisp carbonation. I dont think this is oak-aged, but tastes kind of oaky, its nice. Good, tasty belgian. Uniquely fruity, complex, easy to drink for the strength. Cant complain

2010 bottle.  Pours a cloudy pale orange color with a huge white head that fades normally, no lacing.  Odd aroma.  Sugary sweet aromas of Belgian candi sugar.  Very estery but no particular fruit stands out.  Very floral too.  Taste is just as hard for me to describe as the aroma.  Cloyingly sweet (makes my jaw hurt) up front with Belgian candi sugar and spices.  Turns very fruity and floral.  Finishes very tart and dry.  Thick body yet the mouthfeel has this fizzy carbonation that doesnt seem to fit.  I can see how some people would love this beer but I think its just ok.  Too Belgian, too sweet, too tart.

2010 Bottle. The appearance has a great head and a nice amber color with sediment floating in my glass. As for the scent I noticed sweet malts, yeast, sugar, floral hops, fruits, and spices. The flavor has sugar, carmel malts, spices, pineapple, grapefruit, banana, and hops. The finish is bitter, sweet, alcoholic, acidic, floral, and yeasty. Everything blended nicely to mask the alcohol throughout the entire experience and it tasted very good. Overall this is a fine beverage and is full of flavor.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2013 33cl bottle. 2012 edition.
Appearance: amber beer, small head.
Nose: fruits, wine, yeast, hops, peach, wood, sweet cherries.
Taste: wood (mostly in after taste), very sweet, maybe a little to sweet, fruits.
The young version is a little to sweet for me, i hope to re rate with an older version soon.
9/3/9/3/18
Re-rate with vertical on Christmas!
Comparison of 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013 version and reserva 2010. For rating reserva, check there.
APPEARANCE: all where: clear blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: 2013: heavier in alcohol than the others, very sweet, maybe a little too sweet even.    
2012: fruity, sour, little more alcohol than older ones     
2011: fruity, sour, very nice aged!     
2010: this sample wasnt stored properly! Because of the, the quality was a lot worse than the others! Grains, fruity, quite oxidated, just not that pleasant to drink anymore...

TASTE: 2013: fruity, alcohol, very sweet, sour.    
2012: fruity, some more alcohol, sweet, sour.   
2011: better in general, more wood taste, more sourness, very pleasant.     
2010: again same problem, not properly stored, so alcohol, oxidation, little fruity.

Scores
2013 -> 4,1
2012 -> 4,1
2011 -> 4,2
2010 -> 3,2 (due to bad storing before buying!)

Murky amber-gold with good, creamy, off-white head, good legs / Muted but appealing nose of citrus, spice, and Belgian yeast / Full body, rich, sweet and lightly cloying, malty, fruity, modest hopping but some bitterness on the rich finish, alcohol present but mostly masked by the big body / Big flavors of pineapple, orange, coconut, clove, nutmeg, ginger, coriander, straw, and a touch of wet sweater / These big malt & fruit bombs are not my taste, but this is clearly well done.

Pour is golden/copper with a nice thick head. Nose is fruity, dried fuits and some pears with some spices. Taste starts with spices, big malt backbone, some bread dough, very fruity. Alchohol is present but not overpowering. Syrupy but good drinkability. Excellent brew!

UPDATED: APR 21, 2013 11.6oz bottle. Pour slightly hazy amber/cherry color. Aroma of sweetness and citrus with some spice and dark fruits. Taste is sweet fruits, spices, some yeast and slightly acidic. Carbonation is light. Balance is perfect. This is a terrific beer. Extremely enjoyable. 

EDIT: Tried a 2008 vintage from Matt at Zach & Matts tasting. The difference between this and the bottle previously tasted was a much boozier presence, the 12% was much more in your face. There were still sweet and sour fruit notes as well as Belgian yeast.
Draft at Monks.  Pours a cloudy golden orange with no head. Nose of honey, cinnamon, clove, sweet malts, apple cider, ripe fruits. Thick syrupy mouthfeel.
(I have a cold so I didnt pick up much in the nose.  Flavor was sweet and malty, with tons of dried fruit.  Alcohol was well hidden.
pours copper with nice 2 finger head that stays for a while before disappearing.  sweet fruit candy aroma with slight alcohol.  Sweet malt and over ripe fruit notes.  A good beer.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2013 Poured copper. A huge white head. Nose is spicy, hoppy, candy. Body is full, carbon lively, texture pretty oily. Taste is sweet and semi-sour. Palate with grassy hops, grapefruits and hints of bitterness. Heavy dry bitter & sweet finish.
