Bottle picked up in Vegas. Pour is deep copper with a small white head that quickly dissipated. Big dark fruity and yeasty aroma - clove, light banana, biscuity, spice, cherry, figs, and sherry. Taste is big dark fruits, candy, doughy, banana, toffee, caramel, somewhat earthy, and spicy with a sharp alcoholic bite on the finish. Slick mouthfeel with low carbonation. Beautifully hidden alcohol and a wonderful winter warmer. This  one is a sipper for sure and a solid Belgian.
33 cL bottle poured into a pint glass at the UK National Winter Ales Festival 2013.  Hazy orange colour, flat.  Light, spiced aroma.  Very nice, smooth, tasty and boozy.

This was a 2 year old stille nacht i drank, and the evolution in taste is incredible. All the flavors were fully appreciated.
caramel, floral, citrus, herbs, alcohol, vanilla, medium sourness, medium sweetness, very nice

Color ámbar oscuro. Aroma a fruta ácida asidrado y fresco . En boca muestra esa acidez afrutada,  no excesiva pero que te hace salivar a gusto, además de toques muy ligeros de alcohol y especias. Disimula muy bien sus 12%. En general una buena Belgian Strong Ale, que agradará tanto a los amantes de los sabores ácidos, como a aquellos que sólo los admiten en pequeñas dosis.

2007/2008/2009 vertical tasting: I glasset er de rødbrun, med et lite skum som legger seg rundt kanten av glasset og forblir der. Aroma av tørket og søtet frukt, ja kanskje en tone banan. Smak av søt malt, sukker, appelsin. Fyldig og sticky munnfølelse. Komplekse saker. De respektive årgangene var alle relativt like både på uttrykk og smak. De kan sikkert lagres lengre, og det er vel trolig at man da får større forandringer i smaksbildet.

Poured a light amber with a thin white head. Aroma of spicey caramel malt, dark berry fruits. Medium body, moderately carbonated, flavour is honeyed, sweet caramel malt and some heavy citrus. Finish is sweet and alcoholic

33 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100722.
Pours hazy dark copper color with a medium sized head. Aroma of spices, dark ripe fruits like plums and raisins, caramel notes, some faint toffee and earthy notes. Flavor of ripe fruits, caramel, toffee, spices and wood. Excellent, balanced brew.

COlore ambrato carico con schiuma bianca e piuttosto persistente, Aroma pungente, etilico, di caramello, pepato, spezie. Al palato si ritorva una certa pepatura e le spezie a prevalere sul caramello. Il finale ben amaricato consente di bilanciare bene la bevuta. Essendo una 2012 lalcool risulta ancora un attimino spigoloso, un pò + di maturazione le avrebbe giovato sicuramente.
poured a light amber with a frothy white head.  nose is all belgian malt.  flavor of sweet malt with a bitter hoppiness on the finish.  Overall it is a great representation of the style.

Pours an average creamy white head that mostly lasts. Body is murky and sparkling, with amber colour. Aroma contains dark bread, molasses, orange, lemon, dough, earth, banana, grape, raisin, plum, pineapple, cherry, alcohol and spices. Flavor starts off light acidic, ro go to quite sweet and to finish with warming alcohol and bitterness. The latter is present all the time but comes up strongest in the end. Body is full and syrupy. Carbonation is soft. Well balanced, with lots of aroma's. Mmmmmmm!

Has a lot of fruit and sweetness of a quad, but its blonde and easier drinking.  Pours light yellow with good head.  Bright sweet, fruit, think apple or peach, a good bit of sugar, and a lot of yeast before a dry finish.  way to easy to drink for the abv.  Good stuff.

Bottle. Golden with whitw head. Some apple in the aroma, but nice apple  citrusy and sharp, low levels of spicy phenols and esters. Taste of caramel apple, citrus and peppery spices. A little sweet and quite bitter.  Quite nice.

330 ml bottle, 2009 vintage @ Restobières early 2013. Slightly unclear reddish amber body with a big off-white head. Strong and lovely aroma of dry fruit, brown sugar, spices and some caramel. Flavour is sweet malty, sugar, caramel, dry fruit, yeast, spices, nice bitterness and a clear but not unpleasant level of oxidation. Both refreshing and madeira vinous. Fine body, long and nice aftertaste. A true classic.

Orange-tinged golden pour with a fast fading white lacing. Aroma initially reminded me of a hefeweizen. Theres candi sugar, balanced by tart citrus fruit, sourdough, spices, and a touch of barnyard hay. Low carbonation, almost full-bodied, and a lingering sticky finish. Alcohol is well masked by the sweetness until it reaches your stomach.

2010 bottle. Gusher, but the sediment fortunately stayed at the bottom. Golden/orange, white head. Nose is candi sugars, banana, white wine, booze, spices. Taste is banana, orange, candi sugars, spices, booze. Bittering hops in the finish.

Bottle 2010 picked up at Stearns Liquor, I was warned about the Logsdon being a gusher but not this one (yes it gushed). S: Bananas, spices, that typical belgian yeast smell but stronger, cloves, apples and sugar. A: Dirty looking orange with alot of floaties, a white foamy head that dispenses to the edges. T: Cloves, bananas, esters, fruit, which follows to grapes, honey, and spices with a touch of funk. O: Crispy carbonation, with a fruity dryness finish. O: Nice overall but the price will possibly keep me from buying one again.

Location/Date:Bottle on January 25th, 2013 during day 1 of Nerd Beer Epic Weekend.
Appearance: Pours an orange clear. 
Aroma: Aroma of orange, yeast.. 
Taste: Yeasty, light bitter, orange.   
Palate:Medium body.
Summary: After a night of having a lot of other belgian styles, I found this one to be solid but hard to differentiate.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2013 
Location: Bottle at Nerd Beer Epic Weekend, 1/25/13


Aroma: The aroma is a nice mix of sweet malts, Belgian yeast, and some spice

Appearance: This one has a hazy orange colored pour with a small head on it

Flavor: Tastes fairly sweet too, with lots of yeasty flavors, sugar, citrus, and even a little apple

Palate: The body is medium, it has a sharp feel, some decent carbonation, and a little bit of heat

Overall Impression: 
I thought this was a really solid Winter seasonal.  This may be a touch too sweet for my tastes, but otherwise it is really good stuff.
Pours hazy amber. Very sweet, yeasty nose. Taste extremely sweet with spices and a touch of sourness. A little too sweet for me. Couldnt drink two of these.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2013 2011 bottle, 13C. Amber with a few floaties, a coat of white head that lasts. Aroma has dried and stone fruits, oranges, almonds, fruitcake spices. Very soft in the mouth, lowish carbonation, just slightly syrupy. Very sweet with intense candied fruit flavours - sour oranges, peach, grapes - all melded together. A whiff of booze and then it all gives way to gentle spices in a dryish finish. Powerful, complex and boozy, but nimble and fun too.  [4.1]You do get a lot for that massive sweetness, but youd want to. Palate down to 4. Damn lovely.

Share with Nate.  07 from VE.  Pours red with floaters, white head, lasting with decent lacing.  Caramel, Raisin, cherry, brown sugar.  Alcohol warmth, brown sugar, caramel, raisin, cherry, orange, mild bitter, lingering to after with alcohol.  Just awesome.  Aged well.  Tasty, tasty BSA.

2013.01.23 - De Dolle Stille Nacht - 11.6oz bottle in goblet glass.  Bottle cap marked "bottled 2010**".

Pours a cloudy dull yellow to tan.  Active off-white head sticks around for several minutes and settles to a 1/2cm foamy cap, sticks to glass.

Aroma is Belgian earth bready yeast, with something more; spicy pepper maybe or candied fruit or something.

Mouthfeel is medium and is bit creamy, if only from remaining head.  A bit boozy.

Taste is interesting.  Front end is alcohol bite and bitterness, balanced with some sweetness.  Resolves to spices.  Possibly in the ballpark of the Struise Tsjeeses I drank yesterday.  And similar to that it is improving greatly as it warms up, flavors are blended better and not as distinct.  The bottom half of the glass is tastier than the top half. There are Belgians I like better but this is quite nice.

Aroma 7/10, Appearance 3/5, Taste 8/10, Palate 4/5, Overall 17/20

Yellow color  with small white head.  Aroma of white wine,  wood, cookies, caramel, alcohol. Taste is light sweet that goes all the well, but so nicely balanced, a bit sour as well but in a really nice way. Medium body, sticky texture and soft carbonation. This was old bottle but  that I didnt expect it to be good but it turn out to be amazing.

23.01.13
Ølkonsortiets julekalender.
Uts: lys ravfarget, rikelig og holdbart hvitt skum, noe disig.
Duft: fruktig og fyldig, mye tørket frukt (aprikos) og tydelig vinøs sødme.
Smak: meget søt, masse fruktighet og tung fruktig fylde, langvarig ettersmak på grensa til å være emmen.

A very fizzy, dirty gold beer with a rocky white head.  Fairly sweet and boozy.  Golden raisins, caramel malt and soft spice.  Light syrupy texture.  Low bitterness.  Smooth warm finish.  Dangerously drinkable 12%.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2016 Bellissimo color arancio carico con una massiccia schiuma bianca; aroma dolce e pungente con sentori di mela cotogna, caramello, albicocca, zenzero, canditi e zucchero a velo. Gusto dolce, speziato, fruttato, rotondo e ben bilanciato che riprende gli aromi; corposa, vinosa e "calda" al palato, effervescenza piacevole e retrogusto persistente. La birra di Natale per antonomasia!!!
Le versioni più datate perdono il lato speziato e guadagnano in profondità e complessità diventando ancor più profumate, fruttate e morbidissime... e diventano Capolavori con la C maiuscola!
Hazy orange pour. Soft sweet yeasty aroma. This beers got a strong kick to it, like a large pony. Sweet caramel flavor with plenty hops in the background. This beer is awesome.

From a 33 oz bottle shared at home.  2010 vintage.  Pours a hazy amber with a thick frothy white head.  Bread yeast aroma.  Huge carbonation in the mouthfeel.  Notes of toffee and caramel.  Cherry after taste.  Spectacular.

Ulkonäöltään kullankeltainen ja samea olut, vaahto on melko pieni ja se jättää kukkasen. Hajussa on ananasta, belgihiivaa, hedelmäisyyttä (ananaksen lisäksi) ja hieman yrttejä. Maku on hieman alkoholin polttama, hedelmäinen, hiivainen, pippurinen, yrttinen ja banaaniakin löytyy. Suutuntuma on lämmittävän alkoholinen ja hieman hiilihappoinen. Kokonaisuutena lämmittävä ja mausteinen olut. Tämän uskoisin jakavan mielipiteet, itse pidän. Hanaversio reitattu.

Bottle at Kulminator (Antwerp, Belgium)
Pours amber with a quickly receding head and minimal lacing. Aroma is malty, toffee, and some citrus notes. Taste is sweet. Body is medium, and the texture is relatively thin. Its good, but seems a bit too typical.

2009 bottle at tuulensuu, tampere. Hazy reddish brown color, white head disappearing quickly. Multiform aroma of raisins, citrus, sweetness, yeast. Very smooth and delicious taste. Sweetness, plums, citrus, full body, licorice. This is nice but expected little more.

Aroma has lots of caramel and a touch of toffee. Appearance is an orange golden amber colour with an off-white head. Taste is super caramelised with alcohol hints around the place, touch hoppy, not bad, very good taste bar the alcohol. Palate is nice hoppy feel around the mouth, bitterness is accentuated on the tip and edge of tongue and on the cheeks.

Hazy golden blonde. Small off white head. Aroma is booze treacle sweetness, toffee apple, Christmas biscuits. Taste is lovely, initial boozy sweetness, then fruitiness, caramelly malt, shortbread, port, bit of cherry,warming alcohol. Apples again. Great stuff. Too easy to drink.

Oh my! Pours orange with no head or lacing. Nose is quiet, some orange some candy. Aromas are many...grassy hops, grapefruit, candy,tangerines. Tastes are big sweet and light bitterness with some alcohol burn acidity on the finish. Full body with lively carbonation.  This is a huge beer, lovely.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2015 On tap @ La Capsule, Lille - FR. Color: amber beer with small carbonation and small white head. Smell: very fruity, raspberry, strawberry, malt and sugar complexity. Taste: caramel, malt, strawberry. Aftertaste: sugar complexity, small bitterness, dry sensation. 
-----
Bottle @ Gainsbar, Kortrijk - BE with RudolphSayven & happyhoppy. Color: amber beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Nice goldy reflexion. Smell: high sugar complexity domination, with good honey notes and spicy presence. Notes of caramel and butter. Really high complexity. Taste: nice complexity of malt and sugar with well balanced with spicy and caramel. Really amazing beer! Good beer to meditate  around 10°. Aftertaste: sweet and spicy notes with caramel and alcohol finnish
A very complexe strong beer.. You dont feel that you are drinking a very strong ale, full of rich aromas. Citrus and herby aroma, malty and strong taste. Sure this is a greet brew.

0.33 l bottle. Pours a light brown, with sediments. Medium thick head. Caramel, citrus aroma. Lemon, toffee, caramel and yeast. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pues nada..había que tomar algo navideño estas fechas y fue una elección perfecta. Tiene un color precioso, un toque cítrico y especiado y la graduación perfecta para entrar en calor una fría noche como la de ayer. Todo un dulce navideño!!

Nous voici encore devant une bière dexception, mais serons-nous étonnés ???
Dune part parce que nous sommes en Belgique (hum, hum...) et dautre part 
parce que nous sommes chez les Dolle Brouwers  Ces brasseurs devraient être
qualifiés de sorciers. Et nous allons le démontrer.
Petit « a parte » en guise dintroduction, les bières de Noël sont vraiment un genre à
part entière, parce quelles démontrent la volonté dun brasseur déterminé de laisser
libre court à son imagination pour proposer un produit inhabituel dans sa gamme, 
et surtout aussi elles sont un phénomène social par lesprit de fête qui anime chacun
à cette époque de lannée, et la volonté dès lors dessayer un produit dexception...
Donc pour résumer simplement : « soyons fous, et fêtons Noël avec une bière de
derrière les fagots ».
Si les particuliers gardent rarement maintenant des bières en cave pour en faire une sorte
de bière particulière (sans jeu de mots), il faut donc pouvoir se procurer dans le 
commerce une bière travaillée de façon un peu « folle ».
Nous tombons très bien avec les « dolle » brouwers, puisquils sont fous...(par le nom,
je précise, pour ceux qui ne connaîtraient pas le néerlandais, quelle erreur!).
De plus, nous sommes ce soir la nuit de la pleine lune et le jour des Saints Innocents,
donc cest la totale pour vous faire ce commentaire sur la Stille Nacht (la Douce Nuit).
Un ami du Mexique (cest tout près de la Belgique) ma mis leau à la bouche en
me racontant quil avait dégusté une Stille Nacht pour la nuit de Noël, ce qui est la 
meilleure idée qui soit, et jai donc voulu le suivre sans tarder et pour une circonstance adaptée et
faire mon commentaire sur cette bière dexception.
Dabord et avant tout nous avons une étiquette de type psychédélique, nous dirons à la 
Janis Joplin, avec un bonhomme de neige qui nous présente ses vux en néerlandais.
Nous len remercions et surtout de nous afficher par la même occasion un degré abv
de 12 %.... Merci mon bonhomme (et reviens quand tu veux ).
La capsule indique un embouteillage en 2011 pour mon exemplaire. Nous avons donc
une petite année de réflexion dans le flacon...
Et surtout nous avons une autre mention très intéressante sur létiquette du bonhomme
qui nous dit « bière au goût évolutif ». Cest peut-être une litote, mais il nest pas inutile 
de le rappeler, une bière évolue dans son flacon, parce que tout simplement elle est un
produit vivant... Donc, elle évolue, tout comme nous  (merci!).
Après ces précautions oratoires, nous allons nous décider à verser le breuvage dans un
verre calice (sil vous plaît, merci....).
La couleur est dun ambre roux très joli. La clarté est nette, sauf quelques particules
de levure, qui témoignent déjà de son année de cave au calme.
Mais surtout, surtout, nous avons une myriade de bulles dune finesse extrême et qui
montent dans le verre, comme si elles émanaient dune fontaine en ébullition...
Cest super joli, et cest surtout le gage dune grande bière.
La mousse est dun blanc cassé qui nappe le breuvage de 2 mm de crème pure....
Les arômes sont de céréales avec du candi, de la réglisse, des raisins secs, de la prune,
de la poire et une pointe de noisette. (Si jai oublié quelque chose, vous me le dites )
Après le nez, plaçons-y les lèvres (on ne demande que cela ), et nous découvrons
une texture tout ce quil y a de soyeux.
Lentrée en matière est pimentée avec un rien de poivre (ce qui est normal dans le cadre
de Noël), mais aussi avec une pointe de genièvre (un alcool de chez nous, imité ici à la 
perfection). Cest un début très soigné, avec une arrière-bouche de céréales.
La 2ème bouche est sur une sorte de single malt whisky, ou il y aurait des céréales et de
la levure. La 3ème bouche va déjà apporter la chaleur tout en gardant des nuances pimentées,
avec un zeste dorange, des clémentines de Corse et une pointe de pamplemousse rose.
La longueur est impressionnante, avec des enchaînements « very amazing » comme dit mon
ami mexicain. La levure est remarquable, très douce, et pourtant bien marquée (ce que lon
appellera une levure au potentiel plus plus )
La finale est ample et pourtant pointue, je dirais quelle est vaste.
Lalcool est généreux et évolutif (comme le goût de la bière, dont nous avons parlé).
Il faut boire cette bière entre le tempéré et le degré de cave.
En conclusion, une bière exceptionnelle à déguster à chaque pleine lune, comme moi ce 
soir, et puisquelle évolue (sic), après 30 pleines lunes, vous êtes ronds comme la lune....
Plus sérieusement, un savoir-faire maîtrisé, original et catégorique.  5.  Cest peu dire...

33cl. Bottle. 
Poors clear yellow, orange with yeast floating around. Nice white head. 
Aroma sour, yeast, citrus hops, sugar, caramel. 
Taste nice caramel sweet, some sours, bitter. 
Mouth-feel creamy. 
What a great beer!
Clear amber colour with  a small white head, Sweet full body and and a bit sweet. Complex rich sweet flavour. Oily texture. Sweet fruity flavour.[Bottle from Slijterij Barrique Odijk, Holland]

December 27th, about 40cm of snow covers the roof of my car. Im not going nowhere. Charlie Brown christmas CD, the best christmas soundtrack ever is playing in making this tasting, a cheerful christmas blessing. 
In my good ol Oerbier Nat En Straf glass, Ive poured this cloudy golden lliquid, The head is classic De Dolle quality. Seems to be a lot of yeast rocking around the christmas tree...
The aroma is ok. Well, its "De Dollish". Sparkling corn sirup. Sugar, but in a good way. 
The mouthfeel is incredible. 12%, and I find this beer easier to drink than a 5% session beer on a hot lawn mowing day. Theres alcohol thats not to be denied, but its like this beer was made for moments like this one. Snowed in, add a huge meal, enjoying life looking at a christmas tree.
Not sure if this tops Dulle Teve, or Oerbier, but its a wonderful beer. Maybe a perfect example of what an belgian barleywine sould be. The malt use is a masterpiece. The palate shows signs of residual sugar but its all logic. The overall of this brew sould be at least, in the 90+
(Beer brewed in 2010)

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2013 Cerveza ambarina brillante con espuma delicada que desaparece rápidamente dejando lugar a una ligera crema. Es una cerveza de olores y sabores muy complejos. Amargos (almedra), dulces (miel) cítricos (naranja), acaramelados, hierbas, De gas fino y cuerpo ligero. Perfecta en una noche fria porque calienta la garganta. No le doy más puntuación porque tiene demasiado alcohol.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2013 oranje/gouden kleur met schuimig witte kraag. aroma van fruit, kandij, hop, gist, koekjes deeg, sinasappel en nog meerderen die wat lastig te herkennen waren.  smaak: Boem ! hallo hier ben ik genaamd, ALCOHOL. licht zoet, medium bitter, licht zuur, zeer sterk alcoholisch, kandij.bruine suiker, complex hoppig (de dry hopping is wel degelijk te herkennen), gras, en kruidig.  medium body, dun edoch kleverig mondgevoel.  nadruk: licht zoet-zuur/bitter , mooi etiket, goed bier, stevig alcoholisch.

330ml bottle from 2010. Pours out a hazy orange with a fleeting head. Lots of suspended yeast visible. Aroma of apple, grain, spices, grapes of all colours, marzipan, hay and more. Great complexity. The taste is dominated by sweet honey and distills most of the elements of the aroma into the hints around this. Nice and warming. I think the taste is slightly less complex than the aroma, but its still incredibly good. A really nice Christmas beer.

Aroma estupendo, genial, casi perfecto. Complejo, en donde se conjuntan infinidad de notas.
Destaca principalmente la cebada, así como levaduras dando esteres frutales intensos. Notas citricas (naranja), así como algo de miel, clavo, canela y frutos secos.
También se distinguen ciertas notras florales provenientes de la técnica de lupulizado en seco,

En cuanto a apariencia, cerveza color naranja brillante con ciertos destellos ambarinos a la luz. Fuertemente turbia y opaca en virtud del alto contenido de sedimentación, el cual aumenta al ser una botella embotellada en el 2008 con 4 años de guarda. Cuerpo redondo y completo. Corona de espuma abundante al servir. de retención media, siendo quiza el hecho de su alto contenido alcohólico lo que no posibilite una mayor retención. Carbonatación media.

En boca dulce, cremosa, citrica,densa y excelentemente bien equilibrada.

Al paladar y de la misma forma que en nariz, sumamente compleja pero exactamente bien equilibrada. Se perciben notas ligeramente dulces y amargas, pero a la vez, sensaciones cítricas y acidas conjugandose y complementandose para dar resultados sorprendentes y únicos. 
Las notas que se destacan son a naranja y ligeramente limón, miel y datiles. Frutos secos y caramelo. El final es ligeramente amargo, aun que con una larga duración.

En resumen tengo que indicar que se trata de una excelentisima cerveza. Sabores sorprendentes y únicos que se complementan para hacer una cerveza excelentemente lograda de tal forma que casi se me pasa complementar que casi hasta el final del trago y solo hasta el final, se perciben sus potentes 12% de alcohol. Cerveza de temporada que definitivamente no debe faltar en cada "Noche de paz" (Stille Nacht en Aleman).

Aroma of spicy and banana esters. Flavors of chocolate and various candies (mostly sucre dorge). Big beer but still mighty drinkable. Creamy mouthfeel with restrained carbonation, really masterful of De Dolle! Alcohol is fairly well hidden manifesting only with a slight tickle on the tongue. Highly enjoyable brew by De Dolle, anyone should seek this one out!
Pretty much the perfect Christmas ale.  Strong fig and alcohol.  Aroma has some booze in it but not overwhelming.  Not a quaffer obviously but certainly a warmer.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2013 Bottle @ astral beers. It pours golden with a tiny head on top. Sweet start with caramel and candies sugar, then something like wine and then finishes with a good bitterness that banlaces everything. A great beer!

Bottle. 2008 vintage. Thanks to mike12da. Big yeasty, fruity, sweet aroma. Cloudy, honeyish color. Gushed upon opening.  Huge sweetness in initial; mid moderates to thick prune juice; final rises with some tang and then settles into long sweetness. Medium body. Matured very well.

My traditional Christmas Eve beer for as far back as I can remember. An undated bottle, could be 2-4 years old, poured with a thick creamy head. First taste is sweet, very sweet with a dry hoppy finish. How do they do that? Im now getting a warming sensation running through my body, this mustve been what The Las were singing about surely? 
In contrast the bottle I had last Christmas Eve was coarse and yeasty, this one is clear and as smooth as velvet. Delicious.

Draft at Redlight. Hazy amber pour with a bubbly white head. Aroma of spicy Belgian yeasts, sweet bubblegum, candy sugars, pear and bread malts. Sweet entry with pear, chewy malts, some creaminess, spices with a sweet yeast end. Sweet bodied with restraint carbonation. Some alcohol. Pretty good and fruity.

2009 bottle. Pours a cloudy amber (and sediment) with a tan head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a bit of dark light fruit with some sweet candied sugar and a bit of dark grains. Flavor starts with sweet candied sugar and dark fruit balanced by some dark grains.

Bread, caramel, brown sugar, and Belgian yeast in the aroma.  Flavor starts sweet and bready, with fruit, and caramel.  Ample carbonation gives this a creamy mouthfeel.  More fruit, spice, and a little drying alcohol in the finish, but not nearly as much as youd expect given the strength of this bad boy. Tremendous.

Bottle from Geers. Pours amber (orange, gold) with a big white header. Sweet in the beginning and bitter at the end (dry hopping). I think the hops give it a special taste. Not much carbonation. Good christmas beer.

Robe vieil or, légèrement trouble, peu effervescente. Nez très épicé (notes de cumin), frais (cidre) et gourmand (miel). Bouche ample et moelleuse, finale superbement équilibrée entre sucrosité et amertume. Très belle longueur.

Is not Christmas without stille nacht! This is an amazing elaborated beer, dry hopping and Christmas styles spices makes this beer unique; aged or fresh stille nacht is a beer that shows all the passion and tradition behind it. Ive tried it on tap and in bottles, both amazing. Try it to taste a bit of Christmas magic.

Bottle at tBrugs Beertje, Brugge - 01/12/12. 2011 vintage.
Hazed mid amber with a thin bubbly white head.
Nose is caramel malts, toffee, butterscotch, light spice.
Tastes of sweet sugars, caramel, spice, toffee, touch of booze, dark fruit.
Full bodied, alcohol is well disguised.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: A nice sweet fruity flavor with good bitterness and alcoholic flavor. Amber in color with a white head.
Bottle @ Restaurang Treskillingen. Hazy dark amber colour with a large foamy white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Flavour is fruity, sweet, some spices.

(From notes 17.11.12) Bottle from 2003. Very sweet, raisin. Hint of mint in the aroma also. No carbonation.I guess this is a nice sippin beer, but overall too sweet for me. If I remember correctly, the fresher versions are very different (no notes though).

Botella 2012. Color cobre, con espuma blanca poco persistente y con muy poca carbonatacion. Presencia limpia sin sedimentos. Aroma especiado, pasas, bollo, mazapan y alto alcohol. Sabor picante, dulce, seca, muy buen equilibrio y perfecta integracion de alcohol, muy compleja. Cuerpo oleoso
finally a christmas beer that isnt laced with cane sugar and isnt overly sweet. Perfectly balanced. Cant really place the flavors but its a winner
This beer doesnt have a very strong aroma, but on the other hand the taste is very well balanced

Årgang 2007, smagt 2012
Dufter super godt. Sød honning. Masser af frugter såsom overmoden ananas. Skarp og krydret smag med banan noter. Alkoholen er ikke tydelig men behagelig. Skøn fylde og eftersmag.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2007 Bottle edition tasted in 2012.
All in all a fabulous beer that better year after on bottle. Misses a stronger aroma.

Poured from a bottle. Pours a translucent copper with a huge white head of foam. Great retention. Aroma is spicy and on the verge of tartness. Taste is more spicy notes with some semi-sour notes. Very dry mouthfeel.  The alcohol is covered very well.

Pours hazy orange amber with low off-white head. Aroma is a ton of tropical fruit: apricot, mango, peach, banana. Taste is very fruity sweet, with tons of belgian yeast and a bit of bread / hay for good measure. Creamy, medium body with fairly lively carbonation. Somewhat boozy finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2010 vintage, consumed in December 2012.  11.6 ounce bottle purchased at Best Damn Beer Shop in San Diego thirteen months ago ($5.49).  Pours an orange-brown-amber hue with big white head (composed of rather large bubbles) which fills up the glass but soon reduces to a one-finger layer.  Aroma of honey, bready malts, candied fruit (holiday fruit cake), floral nectar, and candi sugar.  Flavor of caramel, honey, dark bread with orange marmalade spread, molasses, and a sticky fruit presence reminiscent of a moscato (or light port).  Also a possible oxidation / diacetyl / butterscotch note that is not unpleasant.  Dry finish with a hint of booze at the end (though the 12% is generally hidden well).  Fun Christmas beer, and one that my wife very much enjoyed.  (1279, 750)

33cl bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours golden with a slight haze and a very thin layer of lace. The nose has bitter oranges, flowers and some spice. 
The taste has fennel and bitter oranges. The palate is really great at hiding the alcohol. The body is full bodied and textured with a long elegant finish and just enough sweetness to carry it. A lovely beer.

A 2002, 330ml bottle. Showing signs of its age. Prune, raisin, nutty, dessert like. Very nice, caramel, toffee.
A 2006, 330ml bottle. Not as much oxidization as the 02. Still very rich, caramel, toffee. 

Both vintages are very nice and warming. Very well made.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2012 Thanks Dallas for 2 vintages.  Light copper, clear, thin tan head.  Sweet, deep malt, raisins, prunes, toffee, nutty, some leathery light oxidation in this 10-year old bottle (02 consumed in 2012), a little warming heat, body is medium. Interesting winter warmer.  A desert-beer quality.  --tasted a 2006 right after the 2002, and it had a little more malt (bready, light toast), less warming alcohol, less leathery aged character, a little more spicy yeast phenols.  Very tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2012 Pours medium amber with small white head. Head is gone in minutes leaving no lacing. Mega sweet hoppy apricot/cherry aroma. Didnt get any of the banana that others found. Taste is thick SWEET, slightly sour, biscuit, hops. Lovely warming finish. Cant get enough of it!
Flaska märkt 2009 Bärnstensfärgad öl med gulvitt skum. Doft av fikon, tuggummi, alkohol och marsipan. Smak av torkade frukter, alkohol och lätt funkighet och surhet.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2012 Tap. Pour is hazy golden orange with some white head. 
Aroma is honey, light malts, fruit esters, cardamon, spices, citrus,  tangerine. Taste is syrup, tangerine zest, alcohol and a balancing slight tart touch. Medium body, thick and creamy with lingering sweet fruity aftertaste. Magnificent beer.

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. 2011 bottle poured into a trappist glass.  Pours translucent tawny with yeast along the edge of the glass.  Nice small bubble lacing, medium body, low carbonation, syrupy texture, and light candy sugar aroma.  Taste is light candy sugar, molasses, some honey, and finishes slightly bitter.  Alcohol is well covered, good beer.

Bottle from 2011. Dark golden colour with pretty nice, white head. Smell and taste is classic Belgian and quite lovely.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle (Vintage 2005) at Kulminator, Antwerp in 2012. Pours a fairly cloudy, brown-gold with a thick, white cream head. Nose is rich with tangy caramel, plums, dates. Big sweet flavor, sugary and boozy, with loads of toffee, cake, ripe fruits, some tangy cherries, plums, brown sugar, cognac. Full bodied with fine to average, creamy carbonation. Very warming on the finish with robust sugars, caramel, faint toasty malts, lots more ripe and lightly dry fruits. Rich and strong. Good.

bottle thanx to delirium hoppy loft ! 
amber, white foam. smells sweet, bit honey, tastes very sweet, yet very nice. if you search good, youll be able to taste this yoghurty - taste wich i had more in the 05 reserva version ( wich i wont rate cause i onley had a sip of one so far )  . to me this is more of an example of a good version belgian ale , than something so special everyone goed crazy about it. but hey thats just me, right ;)

Pours a dirty water brown with a thin white head. Nice sticky lacing. Aroma of sweet caramel malts and biscuits. Taste like rock candy. Sweet caramelized sugar with a nice bitter hop backbone. Hints of vanilla and a slight funk. Very balanced. Alcohol warms the throat. Lots of carbonation and very full bodied. Coats the whole palate. Nice lingering sweet/bitter finish.

Color: Ambar oscuro, mate

Espuma: Cremosa, densa, grandes burbujas y duradera

Aroma: principio achampanado, frutas y malta tostada

Gusto: licor, dulce, malta alcohólica, tarta

Retrogusto: dulce

Share at tasting.  Gold, white fizzy head, nose is banana, sweet malt notes with some spices.  Flavor is malty sweet with again banana and phenols.  Fizzy, and the carbonation helps make it seem pretty dry.  Good but far from amazing.

E una meraviglia. Dio quanto è buona. Un bel colore aranciato con schiuma abbondante mediamente persistente. Al naso appena versata si presenta con note di yogurt di banane con la presenza di sentori di fichi, datteri e lalcol. Molto potente e in grado di aprirti il naso. Al palato ingresso carbonato. Si sentono i 12° e vi è un ritorno luppolato che resta per tutta la bevuta e che accompagna le idilliache noti dolci dello zucchero candito e del fruttato. Molto complessa, corposa ed elegante come una lady in attesa del principe azzurro. Dio mi ha mandato in visibilio. Una delle miglior Belgian strong ale mai assaggiate. Ottima per davvero. Questi sanno come si fa una dannata birra.

Golden slightly orange body with yeast particles . Head with medium to large bubbles that collapse quickly to thin tiny ring around glass. Honey,apricot, slight mineral on nose. Really sweet with moderately high carbonation keeps it light on the tongue. Slighty acidic, boozy,and bitter ending. Magnificenty crafted brew to warm up on a winter night. Great cellar candidate.

Bottle @ Home, 2009 vintage. Pours hazy burnt orange with a fading white head. Aroma of malt, bread, yeast, honey, light spicy. Flavour of malt, sweet christmas cake, caramel, honey, candy sugar, booze. Full body, soft carbonation, warming alcohol. Nice, but abit on the sweet side for me. 190912

330 ml bottle shared by dbsdelight- thanks again, Dan! 2005 vintage, tried side-by-side with the 2005 Special Reserva. Pours a hazed gold with no head. Sweet aroma, with honey, vanilla, sweet malts, straw, musty funk, and a lot of apricot. Flavor of caramel, honey, sweet malts, apricot, apple, and graham cracker. Medium-bodied, with a sweet, sticky, malty mouthfeel and low carbonation. Nice Belgian strong ale. Good gravy, though, I wont be rating this as high as the last several raters. But I will re-rate when I try a newer one.

Bottle, 2003 vintage, opened 2012. Clear dirty amber colored beer with little head. Aroma is full of red wine and sweet, heavy port. . Flavour is really sweet, alcoholic and returning most of the port notes. This was an awesome experience, thanx Dean for sharing!
Potent but the alcohol is mostly buried under the intense but complex sweetness. Slight bitterness for balance. Amazing.

Drank at Mikkeller with OleR.
We had 04, 05, 07, and 10, I am going to review 04 because it was amazing.
Deep amber with no head.  Aromas of dark fruit, rum, port, homemade caramel, absolutely amazing.  Drank like fine port, smooth, boozy, sweet, amazing.  Fairly flat, but given the age its forgivable.
With the fresher vintages, the carbonation is stronger and the buttery, caramel flavors are less prevalent.

Split a bottle with my wife in our NYC hotel. Very nice.
I was surprised that the color of this beer was not dark at all, but rather a hazy golden sunset hue. The beer has a medium-small white head that recedes pretty quickly, leaving a fair amount of lacing on the glass. Aromas consist of Belgian yeast, alcohol, and delectable fruity esters. Stille Nacht has a very bold and brash flavor, with a heavy alcohol presence. I would really like to sample some older vintages, as I imagine this beer ages quite gracefully. Despite the deceptive appearance, this beer tastes remarkably like a quad. The feel is very good and the heat is even enjoyable. This spicy beer was a tasty treat. I look forward to stashing a few of these away in the cellar.

Amazing deep malts, multiple blends of amazing, dark brown sugar malt. So beauitful and rich. Hops were light but well mixed at correct times and nice picks. This beer is a reserve type xmas beer, but a lot of thought went into this. Yummm

330 ml bottle from Whole Foods Market, Coddingtown, Santa Rosa, California. Pours a hazy amber color with a huge frothy white head that lasts almost forever. Aroma is fruity, yeasty and spicy, incredibly complex with notes of bitter orange peel, pineapples, sugar cane, ginger, coriander, cardamom and Chardonnay wine. Taste is also incredible, inmensely fruity and rich. It starts off with sweet touches of peach, pineapple and mellon, Then it turns stronger, liquorish with hints of vanilla and spices. Full body, creamy and warming. A dessert beer clearly. Long finishn and fruity aftertaste. Among the best non-trappist Belgian ales.

Im a Strong Belgian Ale freak, so this was right up my alley! Once again you need the taste, the aroma...you know the deal, but you also need that kick! That kick is a kick in the ass with this beer with a 12% ABV, it puts it up at the top! You are going to pay for this one, probably just as much as a cheap 6- pack but its worth it, it is one of the best Belgians you will ever try.
Thanks for picking this one up, Chipalsa! Nose is yeasty, caramel, some dark fruits, lemon zest. Tastes are similar. Good stuff all around. Cant wait to try more from them.

Bottle
Appearance - Hazy yellow, lots of bubbles
Aroma - Yeast, pineapple, lemon zest
Taste - VERY carbonated, yeast, orange

OmegaX sure knows how to spot these good brews - and thanks for the share. The alcohol is incredibly well hidden here, and thats likely due to the immense carbonation.

2009 edition (cellared 3 years). 3 finger beige head that sinks to 5mm, yellow-orange body with lots of sediments. Nose: Figs, hay, yeast, banana, bubble-gum, marzipan and champagne. Aroma: Raisins, plum, figs, dates, alcohol-sting, honey, caramel, grass, banana, apricot, grapefruit, brown sugar, bubble-gum, licorice and marzipan. Long ending.

330ml bottle, shared by Fatphil & Anna (2006 vintage). Hazy orange color. Rich fruity, wild berries, gooseberry, raisins and faint apple in aroma. Aroma is very pleasant, well matured and clean. Nice thick body. Bread, caramel, honey, dried fruits, raisins in body. Cant taste alcohol, but I can feel warmth of it going down my throat. Very good beer.

Brown reddish with an enormous soapy head and tons of weightlessness sediments. The aroma is fruity and caramel sweetness, with a pleasant alcoholic touch. The flavour is quite sweet, but a warm touch avoids the cloyingness. It also has a floral touch, reminds me of honey. Treacherous and powerful. A lovely black beast.

11.2 oz 2005 bottle. Poured with a ton of sediment, my bad, a murky brown body with TONS of floating yeast, a small to averaqe sized bubbly white head. Aroma starts off with a big dose of apple cider, vanilla, butterscotch, tropical fruits, wet wood, toffee and Belgian yeaast. The body is big and full with a good amount of heat that lingers and really warms your throat nicely along with average tingly carbonation and a syrupy feel with an average duration aftertaste that is really dominated by the heat in your throat. Falvor of apple, grains, brown bread, sugar, wood, toffee, caramel, tropical fruit and yeast. This is one great beer that I cant believe I never rated. Awesome stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2013 Comparing the 2011 draft to a 2008 bottle. Draft is a hazy amber with candy sugar apricots. Little fizzy. Little spicy. Bottle is dark plum syrupy wonderful. Darker in color and much richer in flavor. Sweet but smooth. Recollection of the regular bottle is that the Christmas spice comes out more and the sugar feels more balanced. All three versions are good but the bottle is better and the 2008 bottle is an experiment in aging and reducing similar to a perfected  Balsamic vinegar. Fantastic! Update: Having the 2012 vintage on draft at Farmers Cabinet. Feels more vanilla caramel than usual but still great.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are rich dried fruits, candy sugar, malt, notes of alcohol and hops. Nice and warming.

25 may 2012, bottle. Light yellow, clear, some sediment. Nose is sweet, tart Belgian yeast. Thin body and a bit fizzy. Sugary, slightly tart Belgian strong ale and yeast. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2013 330ml bottle. Yeast, herbaceous aromas. Pours dark gold,with nice white head, non long-lasting, some lacing. Medium body and average carbonation. Taste is malty, caramel, somespicy, alcohol noticed, but well balanced and rounded. Tasty and worthy one.
Sample. Color dark orange with small head. Aroma caramel, spicy, yeast, fruit, froral. Taste spicy, hop, fruits, alcohol, sweet.
Una cerveza compleja y bastante fuerte. Esta mejor dejándola un tiempo, ya que probamos una con año y otra con 2 años y habían perdido parte del toque de alcohol.

From BA: Brewed in 2006, drank early 2007. 

Small 33ml brown bottle, this is the 12% version, so may not follow others reviews, poured into a Hoegaarden Grand Cru large tulip glass. 

Impressive slightly off white, huge head, which hung around for some time. The head sat on a almost hazy yellow body of liquid. Although this is classed as a dark ale, it is fairly light in appearance, even if you allow the sediment to get into your glass. 

Aroma of sour yeast, citrus fruits, strong and heavy, with vanilla and bannanas in the mix somewhere too. 

Taste is both bitter and sour, tart with a fizzy yeasty flavour which gives the beer an overall pleasing, refreshing feel to it. 

The flavours stay in the mouth for a while, giving this beer a good strong mouthfeel, the yeast flavour stays the longest, leaving a bitter, truely yeasty taste in your mouth, at 12% you would expect it to hang around in the mouth though, wouldnt you? 

Very good beer, couldnt drink it all night (without falling over), but a fine example of what Belgium can produce.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours amber with a white head that fades leaving a little lacing. Aroma is sugar, yeast, malt and sour fruits. Taste is sugary and yeasty with a bit of warming alcohol.

Had this on bottle at ölbutikken.
Pours light amber with frizzy dissappearing head
Aromas of belgian yeast barley and oak. Some sour fruits.
Round sweet mouthfeel. alcohol.
Some grape some belgo yeast in taste but general a very nice and sweet almost perfect beer

A - pours clear golden apple juice with high white head. S - aromas of yeast, apricot,pineapple, bubble gum,  peaches, and barnyard funk, and alcohol. M - lively carbed brew, medium bodied with very fill palate. T - bubble gum, belgian yeasts, apples up front. Barnyard funk, pineapple, sweet malts on the palate. Lingering alcohol warmed maltiness. O - very good strong Belgian, complex and not overly sweet. 7+
Bottle. Pours clear copper with a high head. Aroma Belgian hops, grass. Plumes, raisins. Medium palate. Not Bad.
Draught @ Mikkeller, bottles. Ridiculous head, as per usual with De Dolle, truly looks inviting. Nutty, spiced, fruity, malty, sugary. Active body, alcohol deceptively well hidden.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2012 Bottle. 12 oz. (2008) Pours an insane dark hazy orange, with one of the most epic, thick beige head Ive ever seen. The head was almost solid, with bits of spice througout. Aroma of barley, roasted malt, clove, cinnamon, and hints of walnut. Full bodied, with beautiful sedimentation, well balanced carbonation, and a heavy, powerful finish. The 2000 version of this beer is one of the rarest and most sought after beers in the world. Outstanding Belgian Strong
Mental. Its complex and strong. Alcohol is prevalent. Its a special treat to bring out and impress friends who are not amateur beer drinkers.

poured from a bottle cellared back in 2006.  plenty of carbonation evident upon opening...pours a murky orange/brown with a thin head that settles nicely into a ring clinging to the edges of the glass.  aroma is splendid...candied fruits, raisins, tropical fruit...guess I gotta taste this at some point, but wonderful nose!  flavor is almost as good...opens with sweet fruit and malt notes...strengthens after a moment, then softens up and lingers...and lingers...and lingers with brown sugar apparent.  palate is still heavily carbonated compared to what I was expecting but is still very oily with some slight alcohol burn.  an excellent brew that I will definitely need to purchase again down the road
Taste is mandarian orange, pineapple, booze and yeast.  An excellent Belgian Strong Ale.

11.2 oz bottle, pours a cloudy golden orange with a small white head and lots of sediment. Aroma of oranges upfront, some pepper, spices and Belgian yeast. Flavour of oranges, orange rind and pepper mainly, with a yeasty and salty finish. Unusual flavours with the salt, but everything works together in harmony. Excellent.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2015 Bottle 330ml.
Pours dark golden/orange, with low white head, and some lacing. Aroma is of sugar, bananas and alchool. Tastes equals aroma with sweetness, bananas and alchool. This might be too sweet for me, and it has a high alchool presence. High cellaring potential. [Edit: Had this one aged about 2 years. Pretty much the same rating, but with some port notes, and oxydated a bit. Fruity. Full bodied, low carbonation. Not changing score, this is pretty much the same, too sweet for me. (8/4/7/3/15)] [Second edit: Had a bottle from around 1995 (exact date not know). Quite different from other bottles Ive had, as I was told there was another yeast involved in there. Pours amber/deep golden with medium light-beige head. Aroma is of fruits, bretts. Taste is of fruits, sugar, bretts, alcohol, very slight cardboard, hints of madeira. Palate: Full bodied. Overall: Rodenbach-like features. Awesome. Cant believe a bottle that old is that good. (4/8/3/8/16)]
(bottle 10/03-2012) large beige head, clear amber color, yeast aroma, very balance and well covered alcohol, slightly sweet taste.
Dark amber color, with almost no head. The smell is sweet and fruity, with slight banana notes. It tastes sweet, very fruity, alcohol presence can be apreciated but not for 12º and a little bit acid.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2015 Bottle 330 ml [2011]. Appearance: Pours red with almost no head. Unlike others said, the beer is really clear, no sediments. Aroma: Sugary, lot of fruits, citrus, spices... quite complex. Taste: Very sweet and sugary, alcohol tickles the tongue, spices. Also very complex. Overall: Easily drinkable for a beer that is so sugary.  Definitely one that I will put in my cellar to see the evolution.


NOTE: Early 2015, we tried a bottle from the mid-90 (exact bottling date is unknown), thanks to Mathieuc! Brettanomyces have developped nicely to make this sugar bomb (when young) quite easy to drink. There was also a superb Rodenbach-like fruitiness, winey notes and some Madeira that suits the beer profile quite well. The only downside was the cardboard presence that wasnt too disturbing, but definitely noticeable. [8-4-8-3-16 = 3.9]

Bottle/11.6oz - Pours a hazy golden amber in color with a big foamy white head that settled to a medium covering over the beer... produced some really nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is bready Belgian yeast, light citrus and lots of light fruity esters... apple, pear, grapes...  Flavor is pretty sweet with lots of fruit, bready yeasts and just a hit of floral hops.  Finish is sweet, fruity and slightly bitter at the very end.  The ABV would keep me from drinking too many of these n one sitting, but this is one dangerously drinking beer!!  Love it...
basement aromas, bread, hay, alcohol, apple, amber, hazy, rocky head, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, lively, bitter, long finish, complex

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 A: Hazy orange body, large frothy white head, spotty lacing.

S: Yeasty notes, orange blast, bready malts, booze, and spice.

T: Oranges, tangerine, yeast, spice, bread and residual booze in the finish.

M: Medium bodied, assertive carbonation, lingering finish of spicy yeast and booze.

O: A delicious, amped-up Belgian strong pale ale.

Bottled from beerplanet web shop. Hazy orange color with huge white head. Aroma of apples, pear, earthy notes, alcohol. Taste, apples, pear, syrup, caramel, vinous notes, alcohol, wood, earthy hints.  Long fruity, alcoholic finish. Again one of the rare sweet examples, I liked.

Pours a cloudy orange with plenty of sediment apparent and a massive, foamy, white head.  Nose is boozey with Belgian yeast, bread, and perhaps a bit of apple cider. Flavor is pretty much the same with a very discernable candied sweetness that would prevent me from drinking more than one or two of these in a sitting. This is a very bready Christmas ale. I liked it, just not at the price point.

Bottle 0,33ltr: Hazy dark amber/orange coloured winter warmer, an classic you have to drunk once or more times. Pretty taste of caramel, spices and slightly an fruity hints. Quite complex but subtle brew, thats dangerously easy drinking.

330ml bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu

Pours dark orange with a smooth white head. Strong fruity and malty aroma with notes of spices, caramel, plum and dark fruits. Finish is strong and spicy. Alcohol burns through slightly too much. Complex, but balanced strong ale.

Bought this bottle at Capones last year. Bottled in 2009.

A - Pours murky amber orange with a decent one finger tall white head leaving light lace down the glass.

S - Smells of tons of sweetness. Hints of caramel malt, candied sugar, dark fruits, some fruitiness, and plenty of booze. I would say this was the best part of this beer.

T - Starts off with quite a bit of sweetness - mostly candied sugar and sweet caramel malt - slowly giving way to hints of dark fruits, light spice and lots of warming booze. The sweetness is pretty cloying, combining with the booze to leave the pallet coated long after the finish.

M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Sweet, cloying feel that never really goes away. Quite a bit of booze initially only getting stronger over the course of the glass.

O - I have had this one in the past and it was much better than this bottle. I will have to give this one another chance in the future because this bottle did not do it justice.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2012 senza dubbio la migliore birra della de dolle! molto dolce e molto piacevole da bere, con un sapore unico e inimitabile...lunica pecca e che è una birra natalizia e quindi non si riesce a trovare tutto lanno ;-)

En botella.color dorado cobre.espuma densa con bonitos encajes.impresionante despliegue en aromas.naranja, caramelos, frutos exoticos y alcohol.al paladar deliciosa, floral, embriagadora,entra  casi sola, alcohol muy bien escondido.

Pours a cloudy dark orange color.  Huge fluffy crater filled head.  Lacing all throughout the glass.  The glass was full of spiciness, tropical fruit, alcohol, and candi sugar.  The taste was fruity up front.  Apricot and grapes.  Then the spices kick in with the alcohol and a bit of funk.  Smooth, medium bodied but I thought was a tad to big carbonated.  Overall a really good beer but doesnt match Oerbier for me

2011 edition. 33 cl bottle. Pours a beautiful sunset orange, I think Ive never seen another with this colour, with an inch-thick off-white head. Aroma of caramel, sugar, a hint of booze, spices [ginger, cloves]. Sweet, but the awesome thing is that it stops right before getting nauseating. Sugary, caramelly, spicy, with a long sweet & spicy aftertaste. Warm, with medium body, leaves your mouth very clean and dry. Wonderfully done, my favourite Christmas ale so far.

Bottle, 33cl, 2010 vintage.
Pours a cloudy amber-orange with a white head.
Smells of belgian yeast, orange zest, speculoos cookies, and some other fruits.
Tastes mind-blowing; theres a lot going on here. All the aromas are present in the taste, and the speculoos cookie flavors are prominent, with a big kick of fruitiness and candi sugar, finishing with a warming alcohol. Theres just a mild bitterness, but also some citrusy acidity in the finish. Full bodied. Soft carbonation.
Texture is quite smooth, until the finish which ends a bit like a sugar cookie, actually, with a the lingering somewhat gritty sweetness all around the palate.

This is a really interesting and good beer with a lot of flavor. I might just have to try some more samples ;-).

vintage 2010. pours a murky dark yellow/orange color with a big bubbly head. typical Belgian aromas along with some sweet smelling fruits. carbonation has a slight bite to it. could use a dulling down. but other wise the taste is fantastic. not very well versed in the Belgian styles but this beer is definitely one of the better Ive had the pleasure of trying. malts and hops balanced very well throughout.

Bottled 2000 drank summer 2011. Pours golden orange, mostly transparent with thin off white head.  Nose has lots of malt sweetness, caramel, some sweet scotch, with light dark fruits in back.  The flavor adds more wood notes and is far sweeter than expected.  Full bodied, syrupy and creamy with a well balanced carbonation.  A little sweet, interesting scotch notes.

A big thanks to weaselknievel for sharing this bottle. I now have one tucked away, hopefully, to be left for a few years. Had this at the 2012 NWAF, Manchester. Pours an amber colour with a decent white head. Alcohol is quite prominent and the aroma is just a little tart with caramel, oak and barley notes. Similar flavours with a little lemon tartness upfront, caramel, woody and yeasty characters. Interesting musty oak linger. Very well balanced and delicious.

31/12/2011 Bir&Fud Bottega (Vintage 2008). Ambrata scura, torbida, con schiuma frizzante bianca, abbondante e persistente. Parecchi piccoli sedimenti sul fondo. Aroma zuccheroso, dolce, fruttato, caramellato, speziato, intensissimo. In bocca è dolce, malto caramellato, molto speziata con un bellissimo finale amarognolo di buona secchezza e straordinaria complessità. Corpo pieno, carbonazione corretta. Birra straordinaria, un vero capolavoro.
Hazy amber pour straight from the tap at the Kerstbierfestival in Essen in 2011.  Not much head.  Honied sweetness, some yeast and caramel.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2013 una birra incredibile..aroma complesso(caramello,cereali,noci) allapparenza è ambrata/rossa e abbastanza limpida, il gusto è incredibile,dotata di dolcezza e sapori decisi è di sicuro una delle mie birre preferite,la migliore del birrificio dedolle,peccato che sia solo natalizia...






stille nacht imbottigliata ottobre 2011,consumata il 5 gennaio 2013..
aroma devastante,ti travolge il naso..sicuramente molto alcolica,deve addirittura essere aumentato laroma alcolico grazie allinvecchiamento da come me la ricordo..fruttato,estremamente fruttato e caramellato..schiuma bianca molto compatta e densa..birra ambrata,quasi rossa..gusto infinitamente speciale..fruttato allennesima potenza ed alcolico,i sapori sono essenzialmente dolci,caramello,frutta candita e quel retrogusto luppolato finale la rende una creatura meravigliosa poichè lamaro si sente molto nel finale ma rimane sempre accompagnato dal suo sapore "originale"..a mio parere linvecchiamento ha amplificato i sapori e gli odori,trasformandola e mutandola in qualcosa di ancora più speciale..grazie a margherita e..prosit!


aggiungo unultima nota a questa splendida birra..ho avuto modo di trovarmi al kulminator e ovviamente ho voluto testare una versione vintage della mia birra preferita,prendendone una dellanno in cui sono nato,il 1987..una birra vecchia 25 anni,che emozione!! bottiglia bellissima,leggermente strappata e sbiadita..viene versata dallalto e molto decisamente per rianimare 25 anni di imbottigliamento con un bel pò di schiuma a grana grossolana..lodore che si sviluppa è un odore sicuramente alcolico e potentissimo che inebria tutto il locale! avvicinandosi col naso si avvertono odori dolcissimi e alcool,assenza di luppolo..il gusto mi ha lasciato molto perplesso..ritengo che oramai non ppossa più essere considerata una birra ma praticamente un liquore..sapore dolcissimo e molto deciso,leggermente secco nel finale e assenza totale di luppolo con frizzantezza altrettanto impercettibile!! lesperienza ne è valsa la pena ma continuo a preferire qualcosa di più recente,magari invecchiata..ma non così tanto!!

Hazy amber orange coloured beer with large white head and lots of carbonation. Spiced fruited aroma with slight hoppy and malty hints. Full sparkling palate. Finish is sweet spicy with hoppy and alcoholic hints ending slight bitter medium dry. Easy soft drinker, very tasteful.

Clear amber pour medium block head soft carbonation aromas fruit grain yeast strain herb and spice sweet sugar the flavours a fizz on the tongue peppercorn cinnamon clove some orange a lovely wheat taste bright yeast taste a bitter with a lovely light sourness sugar sweetness herbal touch the finish the flavours overpower the strong alcohol content so tasty smooth balanced full bodied spicy aftertaste with herb yeast grain fizz classy goodness from De dolle

Bottle at North Bar Leeds. Well. This is fucking ridiculous, isnt it? Pours an opaque gold-amber, very small head. Aroma is of apricot, caramel, Belgian twang. Taste is extremely rich, led by the Belgian twang, with spice, dried fruits etc. Quite pungent. Brilliant and complex. Sediment adds a more sweaty character and makes it generally not as good. Fizzy but fairly full bodied. Just great.

2008 bottle. Pours a hazy amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity spicy yeasty dark fruit aroma with weak hints of caramel. Sweetish malty warming spicy dark fruit flavor. Has a sweetish malty dark fruit finish with weak yeasty hints.

2009. Pours clear deep amber with a small off white head.Aroma is sweet, yesty, cloves, spicy, buckwheat. Flavor is sweet, bitter, pungent, malty, fruity, alcohol and caramel. Finishes with a warming alcohol, malty and bitter.

Bottle.... 2005 edition......It pours hazy amber with yeast lefties...with a medium off white head.... the aroma is malts, spices and fruit.... the flavor is loads of fruits and spices.....the finish is sweet, alcohol with a nice balance .......
A Roma al birrifugio, ma ne ho appena ordinato una cassa! Non ci sono parole per descrivere la Stille.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2013 Orange amber colour, off-white head. Aroma of malt, candy sugar and spices. Caramel, cloves and dried fruits. Some citrus coming through. Flavour quite sweet but still balanced. Quite yeasty. Full body, long spicy and alcoholic finish.
(From 33cL bottle @ Het Brouwershuis, Baarle-Hertog)

Update: 19 Sept 13
Bottle from 84, and all I can say is WOW. Its so complex and brilliant, it really does age well. Now I understand what the fuzz is about. 9-3-10-4-19: 4.5
Pours amber with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, green apples and light acidic. Flavour is caramel, alcohol, apples, yeast and fruity notes.
Orange colour with a foamy white head. Malty aroma with dried fruits, orange and yeast. Flavour is sweet, malty and fruity with orange, dried fruits, spices and caramel. Full-bodied.

33cl bottle. Amber coloured with tan head that quickly diminishes in a thin layer. Aroma has cinnamon, citrus, malts and candi sugar notes. Flavour has sweet, dry fruits and caramel notes. On palate results bready and sweet at the beginning. The final is alcoholic and long. Carbonation is soft. Texture is oily. Body is high.

Pour from 2003 bottle, dark red with thin off white head.  Aroma has notes of toffee, molasses, clove and cinnamon spice notes, hints of dark fruit, caramel notes, some candi sugar in there as well.  Taste is more rich caramel, toffee, some dark fruit, hints of spice and earth in there, finishes a bit sweet but the flavors are excellent.
Green apples on the nose. Classic self-pouring active head. Creamy, spicy, malty, cherries, and wonderful sweet mouth feel. So complex yet still superbly well balanced. Tasted @60F on tap.

Bottled 2008, stored for three years.
Orange-brown without head. Big particles and gushing.
Fruity aroma with heavy alcoholnotes. Woody, with notes of basement, chocolate. Quite acidic.
Fruity and alcoholic flavour with acidic notes. Dry finish. 
Has not matured well which is sad since this usually is a great christmas beer.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2012 Clean golden body and firm, rocky white head. Orange liquor, spiced cake, slight bit of fermented fruit and cherry chocolates. Rich, sweet, delicious and Christmas-y. Smooth, very sweet body, with firm warming alcoholic back. Interesting sour hints in the middle and long complex (but not too delicate) aftertaste. Very much a winter beer to enjoy sipping, not chugging. Not refreshing but powerful and teasing. Great brew,top class. (33cl bottle) (Rating re-indexed)
Had a 2003 bottle shared by deanso and it way even better than I remembered. So concentrated and rich. Really great stuff. Will try to cellar my bottles as well...
Dark blond to amber colored beer with a lasting rocky foamy head. Complex fruity and herbal aroma. I recognize orange peels and notes of cardemon. Some alcohol, yeast, notes of bitterness at the end.
Poured from a 12oz bottle.  Pours brown with foamy head.  Aroma is spice and some dried fruits.  Taste follows the nose with a nice sweetness and just a touch of spice.

Bottle, vintage 2011. Orange colored beer with a beautiful foamy, slowly diminishing white head. Fruity aroma with notes of orange zest, apricot, candi, yeast. Very complex. Taste is medium sweetness, medium bitterness, fruity, slightly tart and extremely wellbalanced. A new favorite of mine. Ill cellar a few bottles and see what happens.

2011 Bottle.  Pours transparent gold with minimal head.  Big and bready nose, lots of spice, ginger, banana, small amount of citrus and vanilla.  Heavy flavors of figs, raisins and other dark fruits.  Again very bready.  Mouthfeel is silky smooth, coats very well and leaves a flavor that lingers quite a long time.  This beer is hands down one of my favorite Christmas beers!
Woow! The Stille Nacht was even better this year. So sweet, so fruity, so good. I had it on tap. Persistent froth, brown color, resin taste. So pleasant.

Clear amber beer with white head. Aroma is very warming spice sweet. Rich full-bodied beer with nice caramel sweetness and nice bitterness in the background. Taste is some spices, little raisins. Very nice winterbeer.

On draught  @ Kerstbierfestival 11, Essen. Orange/golden with dirty white head. Nose : Caramel, fruity esters : peach, apricot. Sip : really oily with small carbonation. Very sweet beer with strong strawberry like fruity taste. Fruit notes are more then just one of course : peach, cherry to call just a couple. Really nice brew. Easy to enjoy.

Bottle 2003. Quite hazy red-brown body and a small diminishing off-white head. Aroma of red wine, alcohol, lots of malt, caramel, nuts, woody and licorice. The taste is heavy sweet, light acid and nearly none bitterness. Full body, thick feel, sticky, soft carbonation,

Bottle at Winking Lizard Crosswoods on 12/12/11. Clear and chunky amber pour with a thick fluffy white head. Aroma of metal, citrus, stone fruit, berry banana and a hint of booze. Apricot flavor with some malt and booze before a grape finish with a bit of banana.

2009 bottle from Otsuki in Osaka. Color is a hazy slightly cloudy copper with a thin white head that recedes quickly. Very dense aroma almost like a barley wine... can tell that theres a lot in this beer. Holy crap this packs a ton of flavor! Immediate sweetness but balanced with nice bitterness... coats the mouth... again it reminds me of a barleywine in terms of intensity. Beautiful beer... heavenly.
Bottle, pours hazy ice tea w/ foamy/creamy white head, aroma is stone fruit, brandy, some parmesan, rich and candy sweet, very smooth and nice warmth (no burn) on finish, excellent holiday brew

Aroma: banana, hops
Appearance: The beer has a golden, almost amber like color. The liquid is sparkling and the head is white. The foam is sticky to the glass.
Taste: Sweet in the beginning with a nice bitterness to it afterwards.
Palate: Thin texture, with lively carbonation. The finish is long.

Side notes: Easy drinkable beer, with high alcohol percentage.

Davvero una buona birra da bere dinverno, in pieno periodo natalizio. Al gusto è la dolcezza a far da padrone, un intensa dolcezza riscaldante data probabilmente dallelevato tenore alcolico. ottima.

Pours a nice and murky golden/olive drab color.   Aroma is of yeast, citrus, grapefruit, slight clove, and malt.  Flavor is of spiced malt, tang, citrus, and that good old Belgian yeast.  Very dry.  Very good.

on tap. 2010.  hazy orange with a huge frothy head, 
aroma: green apples, baking yeast, belgian yeast, peppery, spiced, weak banana, caramel, dusty
Dry and fizzy mouthfeel 
Taste: dry, somewhat boozy, yeast, weak banana,, pear, some sweetness, dusty, bready, light candy, light bitterness. very hard to classify IMO. but very interesting.

Pale amber/golden pour lots of frothy off white head .... aroma is grainy and spicy fruity hops .... taste is bitter and grainy with a caramel malt and a funky citrusy hop lots of bitterness and spicy hop .... mouthfeel is lively, bitter and a bit acidic .... a beast of a beer warming abv in the finish with a spicy dry hop

2006 @ age 5: Some head, highly carbonated. cloudy deep golden. nose is sweetwith dried fruit, salt(!). very nice but the saltiness is maybe too evident?  fat medium body and some lenght.. surprisingly short for the fatness. cream caramel, dry apricot, almonds, dry fruitcake, white chocolate. ridicously  yummy. Perfeck desert beer. Could drink this all night..

Porting this review from BA.

Appearance:
First off, let me say that this is HEADY. I havent even poured the whole bottle yet. Ive got just over 4 fingers of head here, just waiting for it to simmer down so I can pour the rest.
The color is more or less the same as a mango juice, but slightly less opaque. Hazy for sure, with little yeasties floating around.

Smell:
Bananas and cloves all around. Slightly spicy on top of that, with some orang citrus lingering around in there too. A pretty well-balanced aroma if you ask me.

Taste:
Gotta say, this doesnt taste anything like it smells. Citrusy, okay, but far more lemon flavor than orange. Some alcohol heat pierces the flavors as well. Belgian yeast is running all over the place, and some hints of sourness are there too. Extremely complex, and fairly difficult to describe in an appropriate order.

Mouthfeel:
Extremely high carbonation. So high that its hard to get a really good idea of what youre tasting at first. Other than that, medium body.

Overall:
I would put this on the "good" side of Belgian beers for me, which is significant, but because they arent normally my bag. Its definitely tasty, and I like the complexity. My only real complaint is the alcohol heat, making me think that I might have liked the 8% version more.
Bottle from 2006. Hazy golden beer with  an offwhite head. Malty fruity aroma, yeast, candy, bready notes. Malty bready flavor, fruity with some yeast and some alcohol.

33 cl bottle @ home, bottled 2010
LOTS of foam. Ive never seen before that when beer fits into a glass, it then starts to push itself out of the glass in form of a foam. Rather spicy aroma with a toffee typical to an aged belgian ale. Pepper‐like spices, even chili. Flavour is sweetish with typical belgian yeast and toffee. Also some alcohol. Lots of CO2 in the palate, becomes sticky towards the end of glass. Thick and spicy stuff.

Mousse blanche, trés abondante, persistante. Robe blonde (blonde/ ambrée en bouteille), bière sirupeuse, sucrée, notes de pommeau/ cidre, douceur maltée/ alcoolisée agréable, belle amertume en finale, à boire doucement. Trés doux !

(33 cl bottle from Belgisk Bryg; Batch and year not marked on the bottle but bought in 2011) Pours a relatively clear golden with little, off-white head. Aroma is tart, slightly yeasty and turpentine. Palate is oily, full-bodied, lightly carbonated and with a boozy finish. Taste is fat, rather sweet and tart. I guess this will improve with age - at the moment it seems rather sweet and alcoholic.
Bottle shared with northropfrye. Bitter citrus taste balanced nicely with sweetness. Tastes festive to me.
Bottle in tulip glass. Aroma is very fruit, grapes even. Hazy orange colour with light white head. Taste is sweet fruit, candy, bitter hops, very well balanced. A nice drink.
33cl bottle. Hazy orange with a huge lightbrown head. Smells hoppy citrus. Tastes sweet, fruity with a very bitter finish. Slight alcohol taste.

Djuporange med småbubblig lågt skum, lite jäst i bottensatsen. Stor söt doft av söt starkcider, mogna äpplen, alkohol, russin och aningens jäst. Minst lika stor smak av mogna och samtidigt syrliga vinteräpplen typ cox orange, mandelmassa, honung, plommon, russin, alkoholvärme, lite beska på slutet. Perfekt balans! Perfekt till mörk choklad, marsipanchoklad, vinteräpplen ost mogen ost.  Ser fram emot att ge den en femma om ett par år.
Bottle. Flavour and aroma is mostly spicy belgian yeast with some malt sweetness and candi sugar. Very interesting and worth aging if you can.

Bottle from Cracked Kettle. It pours hazy light orange, with a long-lasting foamy white head. The nose is pineapple, red apple, concentrated orange juice, hay, light sourness, spice and bonfire. The taste is pineapple, orange pith, mango, tangerine, slight sourness, white bread, hay, wheat, light wood, spice and pepper, with some serious alcohol warmth in the finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Complex, well balanced and big on the alcohol. A quality brew.

0.33l bottle from CrackedKettle. Finally! Have been waiting quite a while for this moment, and when the Premier Leauge is starting up and Fulhams on the TV, I guess that is a good accation as any. The silent night is a heavy clouded unfiltered murky copper-like beer with a fading and sidesticking off-white head and some nice big beige sediments. Aroma has some light tart and sour notes, some green apples, sour cherries?, nice yeasty, ripe strawberries, lots of red currants, some thin caramel and some hints of alcohol. Quite complex in the aroma! Lively carbonation, its quite full-bodied and it has a oily mouthfeel. Lots of taste here! Starts off mild bitter with lots of red fruits, it has some gooseberries, strawberries, chocolate paper, honey melon, candy, light tart green apples, hints of funk, yeast, and its ending nice, sharp and bitter with good amounts of hops. Its just melting on the tongue this! One helluva Belgian strong ale!

Had a bottle. The pour is nice leaves a good head the taste is complex but after having the reserva I can tell this one will taste better with age. It tastes pretty harsh right now but it was enjoyable.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2013 Bottle of the 2005 vintage at Kulminator. Nice caramel colour with a small white head. Sweet and fruity - apricot, marmalade and toffee.
1987 Vintage (tasted 5th Sept, 2013)Rusty colour with virtually no head. Aroma is brown sugar, sherry, dark fruits. Thick on the palate, sweet with a hint of fruity tartness. Taste is raisins, prunes, dried apricots, muscat. This has matured well. 
A 9, L 3, T 8, P 4, O 17 => 4.1

33 cl Bottle. Dark amber colour, with a rocky head. Great aroma of some caramel and yeast. Unfiltrated. Very big mouthful with some nice malt taste and hints of hops, and is some winery, very tasty. Big body.

330 ml bottle, from Ølbutikken, Copenhagen. ABV is 12%. Deep golden colour, some floaties. Huge white head. Strong and complex aroma of spices, Belgian ale yeast, brown kandij sugar, caramel, oak and alcohol.  Very sweet flavour, but still with a refreshing character. Strong and complex fruity and spicy notes, hints of oak, decent hops in the finish. Very enjoyable.

Bottle. Pour is dark gold with a massive white head which leaves excellent retention/lacing. Aroma is apricots, sugar, caramel, spicy belgo yeast, some medicinal notes. Taste is very rich sweet/bordering on cloying, fruity. Palate is oily, soft, with low bitterness and sweet finish. Definitely good stuff, I wouldnt suggest drinking the whole bottle yourself.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2011 33 cl bottle. 2010 vintage. Quite clear, a bit hazy, yellow body with medium-huge white head. Smells of candi sugar, belgian esters, banana, clove, bandages, some alcohol, light malt. Taste is medium sweet with medium bitterness. Very balanced. Medium bodied with high carb. VERY NICE!

33 cl bottle. 2009 vintage. Darker than 2010, more hazy. medium white head. Taste is quite sweet with notes of light molasses, grapes, belgian esters, much less alcohol than the 2010. The smell reminds me of cachaca. Very well balanced. Taste is also sweet with lots of molasses and medium to high bitterness for the style. Medium bodied with ok carbonation. Very nice as well. So much sugar, I love it. 

33 cl bottle. 2006 vintage. Even darker than the others. Huge white head. Smells lots of light candi sugar (reminds me of Cachaca), grapes, belgian esters (banana, cloves). Very well balanced. SO GOOD! Much more balanced than the newer ones. The taste fills the whole mouth, light-medium sweet, medium bitter. So well balanced... So good. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Very good... I love this beer.
Had this beer a couple of months ago, but didnt take much notes which generally means there was nothing special about the beer.

Bottle 330ml @ yngwie
A gusher pours clear golden with floaties and a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, dried fruits, alcohol and some spices. Taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Tasted on 7/9/11 from a 330mL bottle purchased at West Lakeview Liquors, 2008 vintage.  Pours cloudy burnt orange with a bunch of suspended sediment chunks and a thick off-white head that slowly recedes to uneven lace, leaving a thick sheet of residue along the inside of the glass.  The nose is fruity and esthery with burnt caramel, a dusty and somewhat tart aroma, spicy Belgian yeast, and an underlying lightly metallic smell as well.  The flavor is very ripe pitted fruits and sweet caramel malt up front, moving to some acidic tart notes and spicy Belgian yeast, and then to the more bitter burnt caramel and brown sugar, with some toast as well.  The body is full and somewhat sticky with average carbonation and a long spicy yeast and toasted and burnt caramel finish.

Cloudy orange body with a white head. Strong aroma of fruits and alcohol, orange, caramel, honey and spices. Great flavour of caramel and sugar, not cloying at all, with a hint of bitterness in the finish. Great.
Bottle from Høkeren. Murky golden with a white, creamy head. Spicy Belgian yeast, sweet heather on the nose. Heavy sweet, acidic flavors with spicy notes. Full body. Short, dry malty finish.
A nice hoppy, bitter beer. Very strong on alcohol. Because of the name i expected a pitch black beer, but its actually pretty light.

Bottle; Pour is murky golden with a nice, fine bubbled, frothy off white head that retains very well into this tulip. Light, spotty lacing present. Spicy, fruity, mildly funky, hoppy nose. This brew is lightly bitter, mildly sweet, slightly spicy, bready, and lightly funky. Citrus, Bready Malts are present here. This brew has a nice hop profile as well - The ABV seems to be masked fairly well ; regardless,  I think the downfall here is that it isnt quite as complex as I would like for it - I suppose thats where the reserve version come into play
Bottle. Color dark orange with small head. Aroma caramel, spicy, yeast, fruit, froral. Taste spicy, hop, fruits, alcohol, sweet.

11.2oz bottle in a Trappist glass.  Pours dark golden with a thick, fluffy, cream-colored head.  Aroma of strong caramel malts, spicy yeast, a little fruit, and some light floral hops.  The malts are really strong, and this beer is really sweet and alcoholic.  Smooth texture.  A pretty unique beer.

Malt Hummel bær skum lidt tæt guld bund fald 
Sød meget bitter mellen liv tør 
f33cl årgang 06

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2011 Bottle @ Kulminator, 2004 vintage, shared with Brooke. Pours nearly flat, cloudy unfiltered orange/amber. Aroma is boozy herby caramel candy juice, dried fruit mixed up with booze. Wow, smells like a drunken Christmas eve. Caramel crazy. Totally uncarbonated now, which brings syrupy sweetness out even more. Nice - a little too sweet. Pace not race - drunken next to 05 version and 05 grand reserve.

Fruchtiger und hefiger Geruch, der an Pflaumen und Weintrauben erinnert. Fruchtiger, sehr prickelnder Antrunk. Ab der Mitte pflaumig, Feige und beginnend alkoholisch. Dabei immer noch perlend, schäumend und sehr belebt. Sanfter Übergang in den toffeeartigen Abgang. Hier tritt der Alkohol energischer auf, wärmend, untermalt von einem schokoladigen Ausklang. 
Ein außergewöhnliches Bier. Test vom 17.2.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2013 (22/05/2011) 2009 Vintage [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */: wow, completely different style of beer than I expected for a winter beer, pours amber/orange, bitter hop, easter like, very spicy, champagne, sweet malts, fruits (lots of peaches in here) & some flowers, medium body but feels a bit light, warming but doesnt feel like 12 %, interesting ///// Okay, being bad at re-reviewing beers, I didnt take any notes but I have tried plenty vintages of this one by now. Pretty sure I have had 1982. One from late 80s, early 90s, 1999, 2002, 2005 & prob. bunch of other vintages as well. Totally different experiences with each one. The early 90s one was too far gone, same late 80s (worst one) & the 1999 didnt impress that much either. 1982 one was the best one??? Weird right, flavours really came really together there. The  yoghurt, fruit & white bread flavours really came together in the 1982, perfect oxidation. They were a bit too much to take in some of the earlier vintages, others they were really interesting. It is hard to put a rating to this beer. We are not talking about one consistent beer here but more like 10+ different one. Going to 4.5 because I have come to like the fresh ones more since I gave this one originally a 3.6, the 1982 was def. higher than 4.5 & the lesser older vintages can be pardoned, no matter what people say, 15+ years is not really the lifespan of a beer.

2009 : Deep amber beer. Extremely tasty, AROMA : Caramel, pine, lightly toasted. Heavy, bitter and hoppy. Full body, creamy.
